Epicurean Cordyceps for Culinary Enjoyment (With Recipes from a Chef)

This book will be Full Color, Paper Back and expected to be over 150 pages. The book is set to be released sometime around December, January, or February 2019. Contributors will receive updates on the progression of the book and gain access to some of our research results..
 

 
The $14,000 dollar goal will mostly be funding Research through Independent Laboratories. The goal will also be funding Publishing, Printing, and Distribution.
 
Heres the Breakdown

Indiegogo's percentage + Taxes: about $4000
Creating and Shipping Non-Book perks: about $600
Stipend for Author to secure 2-3 months to work on finishing the book: $2000 

Research
Lab Test including; 

Which substrates produce more active constituents
 Antioxidant capacity
Immune Cell effects
 Wild vs Cultivated Mycelium & Fruiting Bodies 

Estimated $5000
 
Publishing

Review & Editing $300
Printing: about $1500
ISBN: $500


 
Wouldn't it be great if we exceeded our $14,000 goal? If we do we have plans, big plans!
 

 

 
Anything beyond these goals will be used to purchase equipment to begin doing more in house research.
 

 
All donations above $5 receive the perks of all tiers below 
The eBook and Physical Copy are significantly discounted for contributors.



 

 
Many thanks to those who believed in my work and helped me to get where I am today! Honestly, there are too many people to feature, but here are a few.
-William 




 

 
Check out these awesome articles & interviews with the Author
 
Civil Eats
Lancaster Online
Probiotic Life Podcast
Get in my Garden Podcast
Cornell Small Farms Program
Spore Addict Times
 
Cordyceps in the Press
New York Times
National Geographic
Vice

Share this Campaign with Friends on Facebook & Twitter
Share this Campaign on your Instagram Story
Add us on Instagram & Share our pages with friends @MycoSymbiote @MyoSymbiotics
Become a Patron on our Patreon

story:
COME ACQUISTARE

Il calendario è acquistabile on-line su questa piattaforma; è una vera e propria prevendita che ti permetterà di comprare il prodotto oggi e di riceverlo comodamente a casa entro la fine del 2018 (ma puoi anche ritirarlo di persona se abiti vicino a noi). Esplora i vari pacchetti e scegli quello che fa per te!

CHI SIAMO

Siamo il Gruppo Veganzi della provincia di Venezia. Siamo attivisti per la diffusione della scelta vegan e il nostro gruppo esiste da dieci anni, per la precisione dal novembre 2008. Sul nostro territorio, in questi anni di attivismo, abbiamo organizzato quasi un centinaio di eventi fra conferenze, sit-in, proiezioni, partecipazioni radio, banchetti, corsi di cucina, rassegne cinematografiche, flash-mob, gare culinarie! Cerchiamo sempre di inventarci qualcosa di nuovo per raccogliere fondi da investire nell’organizzazione dei nostri eventi perché non sono mai a costo zero e richiedono l’investimento di un po’ di risorse economiche. Ecco perché abbiamo pensato di realizzare questo bellissimo calendario!

 

DI COSA ABBIAMO BISOGNO?

Il crowdfunding su questa piattaforma ci permetterà di stabilire quante copie del nostro calendario stampare (e quante spedirne o consegnarne a mano). Il tuo acquisto del nostro calendario tramite questo valido sistema è per noi il metodo più rapido e sicuro per centrare l’obiettivo!

PERCHÉ SOSTENERE IL NOSTRO PROGETTO?

Come gruppo informale di attivisti per la diffusione della cultura vegan cerchiamo di organizzare eventi per far conoscere il nostro stile di vita etico a più persone possibili sul nostro territorio. Questo richiede tempo, energie… e risorse economiche. Le vendite del nostro calendario sono per noi un modo per raccogliere i fondi necessari per organizzare al meglio i nostri eventi, perché questi richiedono l’acquisto di materiali, stampe, affitto delle location, etc.

Inoltre ogni anno sosteniamo adozioni a distanza di animali salvati da situazioni tragiche e cerchiamo di contribuire, nel nostro piccolo, alla sopravvivenza di rifugi che ospitano e si prendono cura di animali salvati da macelli e dallo sfruttamento (queste attività sono tutte documentate). Tutti i fondi che riusciamo a raccogliere vengono quindi reinvestiti per i nostri eventi o per dare sostegno a realtà animaliste che ne hanno urgente bisogno.

IN QUALE ALTRO MODO POSSO CONTRIBUIRE?

Il tuo contributo maggiore puoi darlo acquistando il nostro calendario da questa piattaforma! Ma puoi fare dell’altro… come diffondere la notizia di questo crowdfunding, spingendo parenti ed amici a sostenerlo a propria volta!

QUANDO POTRÒ AVERE IL MIO CALENDARIO?

Il calendario sarà pronto per la fine di novembre. Da quel momento noi potremo cominciare a spedirlo a tutti coloro che non risiedono nella nostra zona o che, pur essendoci vicini, preferiscono riceverlo comodamente a casa (spendendo però qualche euro in più per la spedizione). Consigliamo, quindi, a tutti coloro che ne hanno la possibilità di venire a ritirare il proprio calendario a Mestre, durante la nostra riunione mensile di dicembre 2018 (data ancora da stabilire ma che comunicheremo tempestivamente).
Come ultima alternativa per chi risiede nella provincia di Venezia ma fosse impossibilitato a recarsi alla nostra riunione di dicembre 2018, proponiamo di ritirare di persona il proprio calendario presso una delle nostre abitazioni; essendo il nostro gruppo formato da una decina di persone, e abitando in zone diverse, può essere che ci si riesca a mettere d’accordo per questo tipo di consegna a mano.

story:
Summary

 

I'm Sam Qualiana, a screenwriter of independent films who has worked in numerous capacities on over 30 feature films in my career. My vocation has always been storytelling - This is the first manuscript I have written for a novel and now I want to share it with you.
 

I came up with the concept for Journey of the Avenger in 1998, when I was 12 years old. I created a series of stories and drew artwork of every character and creature in their world. As I got older I decided I wanted to expand the stories and write the first one into a screenplay. Once I completed the script I'd decided I needed more, so I wrote the first story into a manuscript for a 62,000 + word novel. I've created an entire universe over the past 20 years that revolves around these stories. I made star charts that show the other planets in their universe, I've been working on a visual dictionary that shows artwork of what the aliens look like and explains in detail everything about each creature, ship, person, planet and so on; Basically everything that happens within these stories is explained or summarized in there.   

 

I'm hoping that with your help, I can get a jump on releasing this first story to the world. In the future I plan to create all of the stories within this series into more novels. By contributing to this campaign you'll help me turn my words into a physical book that I can distribute and share with you. 
 

What We Need

I'm looking to initially raise $500.00 for the campaign.

All of that money will go towards paying an artist to come up with an incredible cover for the book as well as ordering a minimum of 50 hard copies of the novel. 

If we raise more than that, I will order more copies of the book that I will be able to sell to the public.

I have worked out a game plan for how to get these books printed and have a couple of different options that I will mill through depending on how much I end up raising in the end. I know how much it's going to cost and the more we make the better it's going to be.

If we don't reach the goal, all that will do is slow us down. I will still work on raising the money myself to get what I need, but it will take much more time to complete. 

The good news is that anyone who wanted to read the book will still get a digital PDF copy at the end of the campaign, regardless if we reach the goal or not. 

 

The Story

Journey of the Avenger follows the story of Charles Bligh on his first voyage into space as the Captain of the star ship Avenger.

The novel is a story of self-discovery, consequences, dealing with the reality of death and the human condition; All within a space western.

Synopsis:

Earth Year 2116, the scout ship Grasshopper crashes on an uncharted planet in the Thadious System. In their final transmission the crew reported the sighting of a lost starship, the Abigal Rose. 

Admiral Stanley Franklin of the United Earth Project’s Star Force Command, promotes Charles Bligh to Captain of the Avenger and puts him in charge of the rescue mission to the Thadious System. 

This mission is personal for the newly instated Captain, as his brother Daniel was one of the crew members aboard the Abigal Rose when it disappeared into space three years ago.
Charles and his crew travel to the foreign planet Oblivia and reunite with survivors of the Abigal Rose's crew. Upon their encounter however, they discover that the amphibian and fish-like humanoids that have protected these men and women over the years are at war with a relentless adversary.

Charles must decide either to put more lives in danger to help the natives of this foreign world or to abandon them and any hope they may have for survival. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that not everybody has a few extra bucks to spare. I wish I could donate to every friend's campaign that pops up, but in reality we can't always do that, so if you aren't able to donate even the smallest amount, I get it. 

Maybe you just don't like reading science fiction, that's fine too. It's not everybody's cup of tea. You're not hurting anyone's feelings having your own taste. 

But if either of those are the case and you still want to help, indiegogo has share tools that will allow you to at least spread the word. Even that small gesture can go a long way.

 

Thank you for your support, this story means a lot to me and I hope it's something others will enjoy as well.

story:
Short Summary

Work. Money. Family. Friends. Purpose. Love. Service. Country. Faith. Health. Community.

The list is never ending. The priorities are always shifting. The grind never stops.

Our names are Dr. Brian Peterson and Ivy Sole, alums of the University of Pennsylvania and multidisciplinary learners, creators, and thinkers. When we were in the midst of our Jordan years (45 and 23, respectively), pursuing education, writing books, making music, and holding full time jobs in higher education, we happened upon a book called Essentialism: The Disciplined Pursuit of Less. The core tenet being, by doing less, we can do more of what’s important and do it better. But what happens when it’s all important? What do you do when, by virtue of your identity, you cannot do less? When you’re a crucial piece of too many puzzles to count, what do you cut?

The Good Grind is our attempt to make sense of a world that demands more of us than we think we have to give. We want to expand the notion of Essentialism to account for all the things that become essential when your life is at the intersection of racial, gender, sexual, political, socioeconomic, ethnic, and faith identities. We want to help folks do more and do it better, while embracing their unique brilliance, and savoring the moments.

What We Need & What You Get

The first order of business for The Good Grind team is getting as many books in your hands as humanly possible. We've got the Ebook covered, but we need help getting the paperbacks printed and covering costs for expansion into podcasting, workshops, scholarships, and more! 

$5000 provides:

- The first run of 500 print copies of The Good Grind

- Season 1 of The Good Grind Project podcast (10 episodes!)

- Book launch events in Philly, NYC, and DC in 2019

As soon as you hit the third tier of giving ($50), you're automatically entered into a raffle to send The Good Grind to a group of students of your choice! 

The Impact

We embarked upon this project quite literally to change lives. The Good Grind is a quick but transformative read. We hope that the book, podcast, and future workshops create opportunities for growth, conversation, and collaboration. We want to help you shape the best version of yourself, and we want to get The Good Grind story to as many people as possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't be a fan and cop an Ebook, we'd love for you to put others onto The Good Grind by spreading the word. We'd also love for supporters to share your Good Grind stories and follow our progress on social media. Follow us on Instagram @thegoodgrindproj.

story:
A bit about this fundraiser:

  • This coming April 25th, I'll set out to hike from Mexico to Canada, by way of the Pacific Crest Trail-  a 2,658.9 mile long equestrian/ hiking trail, through parts of California, Oregon, and Washington.

Why do I want to backpack 2,658.9 miles?

  • This endeavor will be invaluable in the pursuit of a life well lived, and career inspired by the natural world. Thru-hiking is full of weight, ups and downs, obstacles to overcome, and skills to learn. I've only been camping a handful of times! Lots of funny stories to come :)

 Why have I set up a fundraiser?

  • First, I'm not going to say that I'm excited that a fundraiser is a means by which i'll be taking to the PCT, as I don't want for things to just be handed to me in life. 
  • On the flip side, this has been a really bright way of connecting with friends and family.
  • Your contribution is repurposed towards shoes, for example, (i'm projecting to work through 7 pairs of trail runners--those are the most practical shoes for this hike), which equates to  350 PCT miles. In that sense, we're walking the PCT together.
  • With every contribution, act of love, random act of kindness, here, I'm humbled, and inspired to see through my sense of purpose more passionately, and moreover, inspired to give back on a person to person basis.

The Impact

  • Logistically, this fundraiser might very well be my lifeline to Canada.
    • The average cost of a thru-hike on the PCT runs between $5-6,000, and as of 3/22, I'm headed to the trail with $2,700 of my own. (If you'd like to hear about the work I've been putting in to save money, please feel free to ask. I'll spare you a saga, here.) 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can, please share the link to this fundraiser.

Thank you. With Love, 
Lana B.

story:
My Story

My name is Travis Bibb and I am the author of the upcoming horror novel entitled Mockingbird HIll. After a year and a half or research I have completed the narrative centered around a small town mortician named John Campbell and his best friend Sheriff Greg Sanderson as they attempt to track down a serial killer who is terrorizing their peaceful town. The book is very dear to my heart as it is set in a small mountain town in east Tennessee my native state. My over all objective is to aid my pursuit of being an independent author. 


The Impact

 I have poured my heart into this project and want to share my creation with the world. I am proud of this horror story am ready to stand behind it. 


What We Need & What You Get

The funds I hope to raise here will go towards the publication of my book as well as to produce promotional items such as T-shirts, posters, and stickers. I am looking at this as a long term project and hope to have everything in place in time for fall and release the book no later than October 1st, 2012. Even if I do not reach my goal by the end of this first campaign what funds have been raised will still be utilized during the release of Mockingbird Hill. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you very much for taking the time to read about my book and I am thankful for any dontations received. If you cannot give but would still like to promote my project please send me an email at 1313MockingbirdHill@gmail.com. For more updates on Mockingbird Hill   please visit me on twitter at www.twitter.com/Mockingbird1313 and "Like" Mockingbird Hill on Facebook. www.facebook.com/MockingbirdMill

story:
How far would you go to avenge the one you love? Would you go beyond death? Born into the stifling confines of French upper society, Babette Varanus never thought that she would have to answer that question. Surrounded by wealth yet ostracized by her peers, Babette had little interest in love until she met Korbinian, a scandalous German baron with the audacity to regard her as his equal. But when the intrigues of her grandfather's enemies conspire to tear them apart, Varanus will embark upon a journey of vengeance, love, and redemption that will take her beyond the limitations of mortality and reveal to her the dark forces that command humanity from the shadows. Faced with madness, murder, hidden cults, and erudite vampires, does she have the strength to withstand the storm that rises against her?


The Ouroboros Cycle: A Monster's Coming Of Age Story is a tale of adventure, romance, and vampires. It is author G. D. Falksen's attempt to raise awareness about the illustrated novel. If it does well, we hope it will encourage more publishers to release illustrated books, reviving an art form that is now severely on the decline.

But we cannot do this alone. Like many books, the novel has a limited marketing budget, which makes it difficult for us to boost the signal and raise awareness. That is where you come in. We're asking for your help in raising money for a full-scale marketing campaign.

The Ouroboros Cycle is the culmination of ten years of work, an attempt to tell an epic decades-spanning story through a beautiful but dying medium. If The Ouroboros Cycle proves successful enough it will show publishers that illustrated novels really are worth the extra work and the cost of the art. That means more novels with art and illustrations, more work for artists, and more art. And more art is always a good thing.

Money raised by this campaign will go to pay for ads, social media management, promotional assistance, and other methods of boosting the signal. We intend to produce at least one book trailer (more depending on the funds raised), posters, promotional merchandise, etc.

In addition, if this campaign surpasses its goal, some of the money will go to cover the cost of illustrating the remaining books in the series. While the entire series is scheduled for publication, illustrations will only be included if sufficient funds can be raised for them.

Any and all support is welcome, and all of our rewards are drawn from or inspired by the novel. We have prints of the novel's art, signed copies of the book, the novel's soundtrack, custom made accessories, and much, much more.

In addition to the listed rewards, we have tons of stretch rewards in store. Whenever this campaign reaches a goal a new stretch goal amount will be revealed along with the stretch rewards that accompany it.

Exclusive Ouroboros Cycle desktop wallpaper
Everyone who contributes to this campaign will receive an elegant collage of art from The Ouroboros Cycle, Book One. This splendid piece will be exclusively available through this project.

Ebook copy of The Ouroboros Cycle, Book One: A Monster's Coming Of Age Story
Every contribution of $15 or more receives a complete ebook edition of The Ouroboros Cycle, Book One: A Master's Coming Of Age Story on your e-reader, computer, or other digital device. This bonus reward is included in the item description of all rewards that it accompanies.
 
 
Ebook copy of The Ouroboros Cycle, Book Two: A Cautionary Tale For Young Vampires
Enjoy an ebook copy of Book Two of The Ouroboros Cycle when it is released.


MP3 download of the Ouroboros Cycle soundtrack
Created by the ingenious French composer Spiky, the official soundtrack to The Ouroboros Cycle is haunting and elegant, providing the perfect accompaniment for reading the book.
 
 

Heir Apparent

A signed and numbered print of the Varanus coat of arms; a signed a numbered print of the von Fuchsburg coat of arms; and an ebook copy of The Ouroboros Cycle, Book One: A Monster’s Coming Of Age Story.

 

Art prints from The Ouroboros Cycle, Book One: A Monster's Coming Of Age Story

Enjoy the beautiful art of The Ouroboros Cycle. Printed with care on high quality paper, these pieces are perfect for decoration, display, or your own private collection. By the talented artists Lawrence Gullo and Fyodor Pavlov.

 

Signed copy of The Ouroboros Cycle, Book One with exclusive book plate

This autographed copy of The Ouroboros Cycle, Book One comes with a beautiful book plate inside the front cover. Exclusive to this campaign.

 
 
Insect Specimen

Perfect for the scientist, the natural philosopher, or the doctor of physick, these insect specimens are encased in transparent resin to allow for better study. Put them on display or hide them among your collection of curiosities.

 

Leather Vial Case
Handcrafted with precision and care, this case comes complete with a selection of vials for holding liquid samples and supplies.

 

Leather Book Cover

Crafted with artisan quality, these leather covers fit easily around copies of The Ouroboros Cycle, transforming trade paperback into beautiful leatherbound. Embossed with the sigil of The Ouroboros Cycle, this is the perfect addition to anyone's library.

 
 
Iosef's Origin Story
Learn the origins of the mysterious vampire scholar Iosef Shashavani, and how he came to enter the House of Shashava. Each copy is signed by author G. D. Falksen, numbered, bound, and sealed for delivery to you.
 
 

Scion Cultist's Mask

Inspired by the Scion Cult of The Ouroboros Cycle, this one of a kind mask is crafted from leather with artisan quality.

 
 
Scion High Priest's Mask

Crafted from soft leather in the shape of a wolf's head, this copy of a Scion cult priest's mask is hand painted and embellished with sigils and icons just like those used by the Scion cult's human followers. Accompanied by hand embroidered velvet prayer cloth. Unique and one of a kind.

 

Plague Doctor Skull Mask
Though the time of the plague doctors has past, still there are occasions when the cautious scientist wishes to protect herself from harmful substances or esoteric diseases. This unique, hand-crafted leather mask covers the face and eyes, while a detachable lower mask embellished in the manner of a skull covers the mouth and nose.

 
 
 
 

STRETCH REWARDS:

If this project passes its goal everyone who has contributed $50 or more will receive special added bonuses at certain funding points.

 

$5000 -- Signed Thank You Post Card From G. D. Falksen

If this campaign reaches $5000 everyone who has pledged $50 or more will receive a thank you card with art from the book hand signed by Ouroboros Cycle author G. D. Falksen.

 

$8000 --Leather Keychain

If this campaign reaches $8000 everyone who has pledged $50 or more will receive this beautiful artisan-crafted leather keychain, embossed with the emblem of The Ouroboros Cycle. Crafted with care and dedication, its all-seeing eye will keep your keys safe and easy to find in your pocket.

story:
~ Dear Friends,

After watching my video campaign, you will get an inside look at my children's book "The Paci Fairy", the fun easy solution to getting rid of the Paci.  The video offers insight on how my method was born and why it works.  You will have a better understanding of what I am pursuing with my children's book series "The Paci Fairy".  I share personal footage of my daughter and myself during that very scary and exciting time when The Paci Fairy came to visit!

The book has done very well and is actually considered number one in its genre on Amazon.  It is now time to expand our horizons and broaden our audience. 

This is why I am seeking $1,500.  I would like to shoot a larger format video that will reach the masses.  Of course, my goal would be to have it go viral, but there is no certainty that this will happen.  But with my filmakers in place, a little magic and my ideas already storyboarded... I know we can get this video out there from the web to Utube to even television!  I can reach all those parents and guardians that may be dealing with the same frustrating issue......how do I get rid of that beloved Pacifier!!!  The entire $1,500 will be used for three days of shooting, casting, props, crafts services and any extra cost that may be incurred.

The opening of my campaign video exposes a sneak peak to the larger format video that will be shot at the end of this year in which specific illustrations from the book will be brought to life.  For example, the wedding couple getting married with pacifiers in their mouths' illustration will be shot with real people (similar to the beginning of this video). 

   ~ Please come be a part of the video...and please be a part of my dream! ~

                            ~ I welcome All support in every way ~ 

Gratefully Yours, Melissa

 

Help put an end to this silent epidemic ~ Go to www.thepaci-fairy.com ~

                                             Stop the madness!

story:
What we do

We at Minds of Peace organize Israeli-Palestinian public congresses for peace negotiations.  We bring ordinary Israelis and ordinary Palestinians to discuss, debate and negotiate solutions to the conflict under the guidance of two moderators and according to a set of ground rules.  Our ultimate goal is to create popular support and activism among Israelis and Palestinians for the establishment of an Israeli-Palestinian public negotiating congress with political power. This will be the 16th such congress.   

Why We do it?

We believe involving the people directly in negotiations has been the missing element in all previous peace efforts.  The congress intends to involve the people in the peacemaking process, prepare them for a peaceful social order, and motivate the leadership to conclude agreements.

What We Need & What You Get

Bringing Israelis and Palestinians to a negotiating table is extremely challenging, but that is what we do. It is also expensive, and that's where we need your help!  We need $2500 to cover expenses for the next congress.  Your contributions will pay for expenses, such as:

-          Getting permissions for Palestinians to enter Israel.

-          Renting Conference hall with equipment.

-         Paying for travel and accommodation for the Palestinian delegation.

-          Filming the event & public relations

We will use the money we raise to organize a congress on July 13-14, 2012. You will become part of our people-to-people peace initiative and help us carry the initiative one step closer to the next step– building a momentum for the creation of a major Israeli-Palestinian public negotiating congress with political power!   

The Impact

The Minds of Peace Organization has, so far, successfully led 15 small-scale Israeli-Palestinian public negotiating congresses around the US, Canada, in the West Bank and lately in Israel. The delegations included ordinary people from the entire political spectrum, including: Israeli settlers, Palestinians who had spent years in Israeli jails for resisting the occupation, Israeli supporters of right wing parties, students, business people, and people who lost loved ones in the conflict. In each case, the delegations succeeded in generating agreements. Moreover, each congress succeeded to create peace coalitions which are committed to promote the culture of peace. To view the agreements, visit our website: mindsofpeace.org

 The Concept

6 ordinary Israelis meet 6 ordinary Palestinians in order to discuss, debate and negotiate solutions to their tragic struggle. They have 5 sessions, over one weekend, to reach a grassroots peace agreement. The dialogue is conducted in front of an audience, which is invited to participate in the peacemaking process.

 

 Our Main Goal

Our purpose is to create a major Israeli-Palestinian public negotiating congress with political power.  

Thank you very much for your interest and support 


Dr. Sapir Handelman                                   Dr. Daniel Mahgerefteh
Chairman, Minds of Peace                            President, Minds of Peace

Update, 8/25: The campaign has now ended and we've wound up with a whopping $2,705 in donations—almost twice as much as our initial fundraising goal! Thanks to all of our generous supporters who have helped make Getting Lucky happen. Please make sure your contact information with Indiegogo is current and accurate to ensure that you receive your upcoming rewwards!

Update, 8/23: Thanks to your generous support, we have officially REACHED OUR STRETCH GOAL! As a special bonus for all of our funders—including those who donate in these last two days—we will reveal the full front cover art as a special sneak peek just for our supporters. So keep spreading the word!

Update, 7/17: WE HAVE REACHED OUR INITIAL GOAL! In less than a week! Thanks and gobs of heartfelt gratitude to all who have donated and spread the word about this project! The campaign is not over yet, and we are now working toward our stretch goal of $2,500. Scroll down for more info on what we hope to do with the additional money we raise.

 

Dear Friends and Fans of Poetry,

Since inception, Spooky Girlfriend Press has published, almost exclusively, chapbooks by women. Women from a variety of stations in life whose poetics and work are more varied than the typical Norton anthology would suggest. We believe that women continue to be underrepresented in the world of poetry and our primary goal is to fight against this condition and attempt, in our own way, to make a dent in this situation. We have learned a lot along the way from friends and our publishing operation has improved little by little over time up to the current day. Today, we are ready to publish our first book!

But we need your help.

For our tiny two-person operation, publishing a book is a very different animal from a chapbook and we want to be sure to do the book justice. The book we want to publish is by Nicole Steinberg, a poet we’ve been excited about and loved for years. The book, Getting Lucky, is a collection of sonnets culled from the editorial copy of Lucky, a newsstand publication about shopping and style. By adopting the magazine's gendered and glossy language, Nicole's poems explore contemporary ideals of beauty and femininity, as well as female-specific narratives we see in media, culture, and everyday life. We are hoping to reach a goal of $1,500, all of which will be used for design, production, and marketing, and poured into this book that we love and think you will love, too. Plus, the more we raise, the more we can do! Nicole is in the early stages of planning readings this fall to spread Getting Lucky far and wide, and additional support will help make to make this happen!

 

Sample poem from Getting Lucky. For more poems, visit the Spooky Girlfriend Press website.

 

Nicole has been working on this collection since 2009. Poems from Getting Lucky have appeared in the following journals and publications:

At-Large, BOMB, H_NGM_N, The Inquisitive Eater, Lyre Lyre, Moonshot, No Tell Motel, Oxford Magazine, Pax Americana, The Portable Boog Reader, Wheelhouse, and more

"Steinberg’s re-appropriated text functions as a telling commentary on modern American society and the gendered molds it imposes on women and girls. The counterculture revolution urged from within the controlled, sonnet form gives tongue-in-cheek nods to the norm while flipping the bird with glittery fingernails."
—Sivan Butler-Rotholz on Getting Lucky

 

Stretch Goal

As of July 17, we officially met our initial goal of $1,500, and we can guarantee that Getting Lucky will be published, along with a fantastic cover design by artist Carrie Gabella. If we go over that goal, we can do even more to promote Nicole’s book. And the more we raise, the more we can do!  

Our first stretch goal is $2,500. Your contributions will go towards:

  • Enhanced interior design of Getting Lucky
  • The cost of printing additional books
  • A larger marketing campaign, so these poems can reach a wider audience
  • Funding for a fall 2013 book tour along the East Coast, currently in the early planning stages
  • Support for other readings and appearances in 2014, including the Associated Writers and Writing Programs Conference (AWP) in Seattle and elsewhere

 

Wanna get lucky?

Please take a look at the very cool book trailer above, shot and edited by Tony Borzotta, and browse the variety of options to help make this book a reality. Everyone who contributes gets a free copy of the finished book! If you can't contribute, please help us get the word out about this campaign via Facebook, Twitter, your blog/website, email, or elsewhere, using Indiegogo's helpful sharing tools above.

We thank you so much for your time and consideration and hope that you will help us in making Nicole’s book a reality.

Spookily,
Nate and Laura

 

Sample poem from Getting Lucky. For more poems, visit the Spooky Girlfriend Press website.

 

Outside Links and More Information

Spooky Girlfriend Press
Nicole Steinberg's author website

 

More from Getting Lucky:

As It Ought to Be
Moonshot

Short Summary

Hello! My name is Jordan Sternberg and I am going to be a senior at the Idyllwild Arts Academy* this coming fall. I am in the newly founded InterArts* department where I will be creating our schools first ever Arts Magazine.

I chose the name Asylum because of it's double meaning. The school is an... interesting place that can sometimes make me feel like I'm going crazy. However, this magazine has become a sanctuary for me to express thoughts and ideas. 

This magazine is going to be placed all over our small town of 3500* for students, faculty and residents to see Art from the perspective of people like me, people who have been traditionally put on the back burner. Although my school supports this idea, they can only help me artistically, not financially.

 

What We Need & What You Get

And for that reason I am here, on Indiegogo to fund my project. Printing magazines in small quantities isn't cheap and I need all the help I can get.

This project will cost approximately $12000 to complete. Of course I am not going to burden you with that hefty pricetag so I'm only here to ask for the money to print the magazine. The printing company requires a minimum of 1000 copies so here is the breakdown for that.

Printing cost break down (Approximately):

 
In case you decide to be a part of a miracle here are some other magazine costs(Not as detailed as the printing):
  • $3000 for supplies. This includes fabric for fashion, paint supplies for the visual artists, costumes for dancers and the computer software to put the whole thing together
  • $500 for gas. My school is about 6,000 feet up and it is a 45 minutes drive down the mountain, in a van... not cheap :)
  • $1000 for security. In case something goes wrong with supplies or slight price calculations are off for print we want to make sure there is a little extra for protection.
To show my appriciation for your participation we really have some great perks on the side you should look at. Any amount helps!
Also, in case we aren't able to reach our goal, we have negotiated several things that could cut printing prices- cutting pages, shrinking the size of the magazine, using no recycled paper and removing several trips from the itinerary. 
 

The Impact

This is so much more than a magazine. This is collaboration. We have students from 12 countries, 4 grades and 5 artistic disiplines on board for this. We have teachers that have taught graphic design, worked as a fashion designers assistant in New York, or give seminars in Los Angeles about what it means to be an artist.

This is more than a one trick pony. This will be sent to competitions all around the world. It's a safety zone for people who want to express their thought without fear of judgement. It has articles in English as well as Korean, Mandarin and Spanish. This is something amazing. It just happens to be a magazine.

 

If you can't contribute that is totally fine. There are other ways to help. Spread the word. Tell friends and family about this truly revolutionary idea.

 

This is something incredible. It's an Asylum... no, it IS Asylum

 

 

 

-Jordan Sternberg

      -Editor in Chief of Asylum

 

 

 

Links to asterisks:

http://www.idyllwildarts.org/

http://www.idyllwildarts.org/arts-q10242-c10022-InterArts.aspx

http://www.idyllwild.com/

story:
Farming4Yes Banner Appeal

Our aim is to raise the costs of producing and distributing YES banners to be displayed the length and breadth of the country. We want to get these banners displayed in prominent locations for maximum impact and to keep the YES message highly visible. We aim to get the banners printed and distributed by the end of June and time is short so please support us!

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need £5000 to get enough banners to make an impact. If we can get banners into every corner of the country the effect will be massively increased. We hope to get them distributed and have them all go up on a single day in a country-wide ‘reveal'. If we exceed our target, the extra funds will go towards more banners! 
  • You can get your own banner by making a donation of £20 inc p&p 
  • The banners will simply read YES

The Impact

  • Farming for Yes have been building great momentum since our participation in "the Big Rural Debate" organised by the NFUS. The farming community are engaging with us and we are now getting more involved with the wider community. We will be making a MAJOR announcement in mid June which will propel our momentum considerably. The banner reveal day will follow afterwards to keep that momentum striding on. We firmly believe we will win this vote in September, but only with your support can we push the gains we have already made to be certain of the result. 
    Farmer or not, be part of this significant part of our strategy and help us achieve the goal we all want. Our own independent Scotland. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t help us just now, please share our appeal amongst your contacts and help spread the word.

story:
Goal: $1800

 

My Story

 

My name is Madeleine (MADlines) Clifford and I am a lyricist, educator and page poet originally from Seattle, WA.  You might know me as one half of the female hip hop duo, CANARYSING (http://canarysing.tumblr.com/).

   

I’m excited to announce that I was recently accepted into the VONA/Voices workshop—a  week-long workshop for writers of color from around the globe. (http://voicesatvona.org/Index.html)

 

I have been accepted to work with poet Willie Perdomo. Willie Perdomo has won the Pen American Center Beyond Margins award and has been the recipient of numerous fellowships. I am confident that he will successfully mentor me in fine-tuning my MFA thesis project, which consists of a collection of narrative poetry and prose.

 

But…I NEED YOUR SUPPORT!  Please help me attend VONA/Voices this summer and support myself as an artist.

 

The Impact

 

VONA/Voices is the only multi-genre workshop for writers of color and is an amazing opportunity to examine not just multi-genre writing, but also multiracial perspectives  through a creative lens. 

 

As a multiracial person myself, I have continuously wondered: how might my multiethnic upbringing inform my work?  How can I write into multiculturalism?  Does my Patwa-infused, Caribbean ancestry inform how I craft language in my poems?  

 

Taking part in a VONA/Voices workshop will allow me to analyze these inquires further and contribute to a literary body of work that can give voice to a generation of mixed Americans.

 

What I Need & What You Get

 

To attend VONA/Voices, I need $1,800 for workshop costs and related expenditures. VONA takes place from June 19th - June 25th at UC Berkeley.  Every bit counts.  If you can only support a $1 that helps too.

 

Supporters of WRITE ON! will recieve the satisfaction of helping a young writer build her body of work! 

 

BUT WAIT! There's more...

 

Check out PERKs on the right side of this page.

story:
About Eau de Vie:

Eau de Vie launched in February 2010 to great acclaim, and has in its short three years collected a swag of awards for its high standard of service and great quality drinks and experiences - so not only are we super nerdy about cocktails, but we have a pretty sweet trophy shelf too. Eau de Vie has since been launched in Melbourne and just recently celebrated its first birthday. 

Eau de Vie is all about pushing the boundaries when it comes to drinks creation, customer service and theatre. Our bartenders are amongst the best in the country (we'd like to think maybe the universe as well), and include the current Australian Bartender of the Year, Greg Sanderson (heading up the Melbourne operations), and the 2007 Bartender of the Year, Charles Ainsbury(heading up the Sydney operations) as well as a crew of raffish rogues, with many a cocktail competition to their name.

Awards include: Gourmet Traveller Bar of the Year 2011, Australian Cocktail Bar of the Year 2012 & 2011 (Australian Bar Awards) World’s Best New Cocktail Bar 2011 Tales of the Cocktail New Orleans, Time Out Bar of the Year 2011, Time Out Cocktail Bar of the Year 2010, Time Out Best New Bar 2010

Why this Cocktail Book?

There are a lot of cocktail books out there, but a lot of the time they are simply re-hashing the same old drinks. We hope that the Eau de Vie cocktail book will be something very different, and it is possible that this will become the single most important book to mark our age (we can have high hopes . . .)

We are aiming for 200 pages of inspirational drinks art

Beautiful drinks photography, inspirational at home recipes as well as the secrets behind our signature cocktails will hopefully make this interesting reading for both bartenders and cocktail fans. We'll also be including information on the venues themselves, some of our staff, both past and present & the drinks they are known for and love to make...

Our goal: 

To inspire people to make more cocktails at home – to entertain friends with great drinks and have more fun!

Your Donation:

We really want to make this as beautiful a book as we can. The money raised will go towards paying for photography & design, as well of course printing. In addition of course there are the Shipping fees & Indiegogo's share ;-)

Without you and your support - this book may remain a pipe-dream. With your help, we can help spread our passion for great drinks!

Your donation, depening on level, will get you anything from an amazing and (we hope) inspirational cocktail book, to a private party at our venue & books all around for you and your friends.

Get involved!

BOOOM!

story:
Welcome To The Mytro

Imagine if, right now, clattering underneath your feet was a secret train system that could take you anywhere in minutes. Imagine a trip full of mystery and excitement from New York to Barcelona to the wind-swept coast of Italy to the edge of space. Imagine dangerous strangers, amazing friends, and high adventure.

Imagine Mytro.

I'm John Biggs, a tech writer and East Coast Editor of TechCrunch. I used to run Gizmodo and write occasionally for the New York Times. In short, I love to write and I wanted to share something cool I've been working on for the past two years - a new book called Mytro. 

Written for young adults but fun for all ages, Mytro is the story of a secret subway system, the kids who discover it, and the strange and dangerous group bent on taking control of it. It's full of fun, adventure, and intrigue and I want you to be the first to have it.

About The Book

I was inspired to write Mytro when I discovered the famous statue of Lucifer in the Retiro Park in Madrid. The statue held so much grace and power I wondered if something could have been hidden underneath. A moment later the idea of the Mytro - of a secret train system that connected the world capitals - popped into my head. That was five years ago.

I love travel. My defining memories are of the long car drives between Columbus and Martins Ferry, Ohio we took to visit my grandmother as well as the many trips my family took to Europe. The romance of the rails sticks with me even today - I prefer a long train trip over a plane trip and have so little time to partake. I wanted my kids to know this same love, this same romance, this same mystery.

Why a novel? I don't know. In the interceding years I've done lots of writing but never YA fiction. But I knew I had to tell this story. I tried to mix my love of travel with a Da Vinci Code-like adventure that never stops. The whole story takes place in a day as the heroes criss-cross the globe using the Mytro until they discover its terrible and dangerous secrets. Secrets that could destroy the world.

The story centers around Paul "Turtle" Fulton and Agata Llorente, two high-schoolers thrust into a world of intrigue and mystery. Together, they travel the world to solve the mystery of the Mytro.

This is the first part of a planned trilogy. Book one is complete while the second book is currently plotted out and I've begun work on it.

Try Five Chapters Free!

Still not sure? How about five free chapters of the book for the price of one tweet? Simply click here and the chapters are yours - free!

What We Need & What You Get

I'm looking for $8,000 to help fund the following:

  • A full, professional copy editing of the book
  • A professionally printed and handsome hardback edition
  • A solid, beautiful soft cover edition
  • Fund the next two books in the trilogy
  • Hire Bryce Durbin, online designer, to help illustrate the book.

What do you get? Depending on your pledge you will receive a copy of the book in multiple formats and you can even appear in the next book. You will also be a friend of the Mytro and get special perks as we approach the release of the next two books. 

You will be helping me prove that crowdfunding is a viable publishing alternative and that the world is ready to work around the damage caused by traditional publishing.

story:
After our successful Kickstarter campaign we are excited to offer our book along with some other rewards on Indiegogo too. 

Vintage Addis Ababa is a crowd-sourced digital archive that gathers old photographs from private collections to create visual memories of the city’s past. By preserving photographs from locals, the project aims to tell the stories of everyday people from the past, people that are not mentioned in history books.

So far we’ve collected and scanned over 1,500 photos. We have also worked to capture the stories behind them. These unseen photos which Vintage Addis Ababa has curated bring to light a rich and varied perspective of history. After reaching hundreds of thousands of people online through social media we’re now turning the project into a photo book.  

We believe a high-quality photography book is a good way to do justice to the photos and stories behind them. We are working on a high-end product while maintaining the overall personal and intimate look. The book will feature the photos with their rough edges, entire text written by a typewriter and bi-lingual Amharic/English quotes so as to not loose the authenticity.

Grants we’ve received in Ethiopia from the Embassy of Switzerland, the European Union in Ethiopia and Alliance EthioFrançais have helped us expand the project. Our recently completed crowdfunding campaign on Kickstarter helped us to raise enough funds to produce the book.

We now offer the book and other rewards on Indiegogo too.

With your support we might be able to expand the book a little bit and add more pages. With your help the photographs and stories can be passed from the hands of their owners in Ethiopia to the hands of an international audience. Imagine; these stories which show the celebration of everyday life, despite the hardships of the time, will be heard across the world!

Book specifications

225 pages, full color on premium uncoated paper
Sewn-bound in a hard-cover with textile cover
Printed in Germany 
Size cm: 17x23 (closed) / 34x23 (open) 
Size inch: 6.7x9 (closed) / 13.4x9 (open) 

Bekele Nega in 1956 (boy on the left) when he went to the Akaki Adventist boarding school and in 1973 when he applied to get a seat in the last general election of emperor Haile Selassie.​

Genet (second from the right) during a celebration in the 60’s, graduating in the 80’s, and working at Ghion Hotel in the 80’s.

Vintage Addis Ababa in the news

“Love can often flourish in the most hopeless of situations.” BBC

“ቪንቴጅ - አዲስ" -የአዲስ አበባ ትዝታ ፡- ዕድሜቸው 30 እና ከዚያ በላይ ያስቆጠሩ፣ በአብዛኛው በጥቁርና ነጭ ቀለም የተነሱ፣ ትናንትን ነጋሪ ፎቶዎች የተከዘኑበት ድረ-ገጽ ነው፡፡” BBC

“A recent photography project celebrates a counterintuitive truth about human life: that what is most personal tells us about what is most universal.” Selamta

“Vintage Addis Ababa aims to show that people still had lives to live in spite of the monumental incidents happening in the country." Quartz

Interview with Wongel on Arte (French and German)

 

The team

The team behind Vintage Addis Ababa are Wongel Abebe, Philipp Schütz and Nafkot Gebeyehu. 

Wongel graduated from the Addis Ababa University School of Journalism and Communications in 2016. She currently works in communications and on various initiatives around youth empowerment. The Youth Mag and Young African Think’rs are her notable undertakings. 

Philipp Schütz studied at the School of Design in Zurich and moved to Ethiopia 6 years ago. Since then he has been working as a publisher, graphic designer and photographer. He produced and published the Simiens book (successfully funded on Kickstarter).

Nafkot Gebeyehu, also a graduate from Addis Ababa University School of Journalism and Communications, currently works in communications and PR. She is a co-founder and host of the weekly radio show The Schmoo Show on EBC radio in Addis Ababa.  

Feel free to drop us a line here on Kickstarter if you want to get to know us better or meet us for a coffee in Addis Ababa.

Our partners in Addis Ababa





From cover to cover all stories and captions will be written on typewriter, giving you that vintage feel.

Imagine; these stories which show the celebration of everyday life, despite the hardships of the time, will be heard across the world!Book specifications225 pages, full color on premium uncoated paperSewn-bound in a hard-cover with textile coverPrinted in Germany Size cm: 17x23 (closed) / 34x23 (open) Size inch: 6.7x9 (closed) / 13.4x9 (open) Bekele Nega in 1956 (boy on the left) when he went to the Akaki Adventist boarding school and in 1973 when he applied to get a seat in the last general election of emperor Haile Selassie.​Genet (second from the right) during a celebration in the 60’s, graduating in the 80’s, and working at Ghion Hotel in the 80’s.Vintage Addis Ababa in the news“Love can often flourish in the most hopeless of situations.” BBC“ቪንቴጅ - አዲስ" -የአዲስ አበባ ትዝታ ፡- ዕድሜቸው 30 እና ከዚያ በላይ ያስቆጠሩ፣ በአብዛኛው በጥቁርና ነጭ ቀለም የተነሱ፣ ትናንትን ነጋሪ ፎቶዎች የተከዘኑበት ድረ-ገጽ ነው፡፡” BBC“A recent photography project celebrates a counterintuitive truth about human life: that what is most personal tells us about what is most universal.” Selamta“Vintage Addis Ababa aims to show that people still had lives to live in spite of the monumental incidents happening in the country." QuartzInterview with Wongel on Arte (French and German) The teamThe team behind Vintage Addis Ababa are Wongel Abebe, Philipp Schütz and Nafkot Gebeyehu. Wongel graduated from the Addis Ababa University School of Journalism and Communications in 2016. She currently works in communications and on various initiatives around youth empowerment. The Youth Mag and Young African Think’rs are her notable undertakings. Philipp Schütz studied at the School of Design in Zurich and moved to Ethiopia 6 years ago. Since then he has been working as a publisher, graphic designer and photographer. He produced and published the Simiens book (successfully funded on Kickstarter).Nafkot Gebeyehu, also a graduate from Addis Ababa University School of Journalism and Communications, currently works in communications and PR. She is a co-founder and host of the weekly radio show The Schmoo Show on EBC radio in Addis Ababa.  Feel free to drop us a line here on Kickstarter if you want to get to know us better or meet us for a coffee in Addis Ababa.Our partners in Addis AbabaFrom cover to cover all stories and captions will be written on typewriter, giving you that vintage feel.

story:
My name is Thomas Winterman, and my life has been transformed in every way. I used to be fat (275 lbs.), alone, unhealthy, uneducated (kicked out of community college), lacking passion, lazy, and working a manual labor job I hated. Today I am lean (185 lbs.), in the best shape of my life, married to a beautiful woman, a therapist (a job I love), and I hold a masters degree in counseling psychology. How did I do it? This is the story I want to share with the world in my book, The Thrive Life.

The Thrive Life is my passion; it is my life's work thus far. This is the book I have written not only about my journey, but it is also a manual describing how others can transform their own lives. It is a blend of personal experience, therapeutic expertise, and psychological theory rolled into one. I believe my book can help people. This is why I have created this funding project - I need your help!

I need to raise $3,200 in order to make my dream a reality. I have already written the manuscript and have spent the last several months pitching my work to various publishers. I have decided to self-publish my work after months of research and evaluation of my options. The $3,200 will pay for professional copy editing, content editing, internal book design, a professionally designed book cover, and marketing. My wife is a teacher and I work as a therapist for underprivileged children at a non-profit agency. We just don't have the money to invest in my book right now.

The Thrive Life is a culmination of my experiences, my work, and my contribution to the world. I believe that my book can help people, but I cannot get it to the masses without your help. Please consider giving to my campaign. Whether you give one dollar or one thousand dollars, every contribution makes a difference. If you cannot contribute any money I completely understand; giving money is not the only way to help though. Please help spread the word about my campaign and my dream! Share my campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and any other way you can think of. With your help my dream can become a reality. I believe in my work - and I am asking you to believe in me. Thank you!

If you would like to see some of my writing I would love for you to check out my blog at www.thethrivelife.org. Also, I have included some great perks with your contributions! A person who contributes $25 or more will receive a free e-book version of The Thrive Life. A person who contributes $100 or more will receive an autographed soft cover version of The Thrive Life. And now for the big one. Anyone who contributes $500 or more will receive the first two prizes and will also receive a personalized two hour goal setting session with the author!

story:
”Det er nogle rørende historier. Det er godt og tiltrængt at få disse personlige beretninger ud”
- Janus Staffe alias Geolo G, Malk De Koijn

Kort om antologien

”I alle historierne kunne jeg genkende problemerne – jeg har haft dem selv, bare i meget mindre grad” – Katrine, 18 år
 
Foreningen Outsideren har besluttet at udgive en antologi, der især henvender sig til unge i aldersgruppen 16‐20 år. Antologien indeholder udvalgte artikler fra tidsskriftet Outsideren.
 
Ønsket er, at antologien skal hjælpe unge med at tale om psykiske kriser og sygdomme - både for at bekymre sig mindre om almindelige livskriser, og for bedre at kunne ta' fat i hinanden, hvis de selv, eller en i deres omgangskreds, begynder at udvise tegn på en psykisk krise.
 
Antologien er på 140 sider, farvetryk, indbundet med hård ryg, 1. oplag 300 eksemplarer.
 
Se mere på http://www.outsideren.dk/2013/03/12/rovdyr/

- hvor du også finder et uddrag fra antologien.

Ved at støtte antologien, er du med til at

  • Give unge et direkte og uhøjtideligt indblik i det at leve med en psykisk sygdom

  • Gøre afstanden mellem dem med og uden psykiatriske diagnoser mindre

  • Få en unik bog på gaden med historier, der sjældent bliver fortalt

Vil du gerne støtte projektet - bare ikke lige her - kontakt os på redaktion@outsideren.dk

Vi har brug for din støtte fordi:

  • Vi ikke er professionelle fundraisere - vores speciale er at skrive godt om at leve med psykisk sygdom

  • Din støtte er afgørende for om antologien kan udkomme

  • Der skal findes noget om psykisk lidelser, der fortælles i hverdagssprog og af mennesker, der selv har prøvet det - som supplement til behandlernes syn på sindslidendes problemer

Det koster i alt 89.200 kroner at trykke antologien, hvoraf vi har fået 2/3 af pengene fra Frimodt-Heineke Fonden, Jascha Fonden, Susi & Peter Robinsohns Fond og Pædagogernes Fond - tusinde tak for deres støtte.

Din støtte går direkte til papir, tryksværte og layout.

Skulle projektet blive overfinansieret, vil midlerne blive anvendt til en undervisningsguide til ungdomsuddannelserne.

Antologien er skrevet og tilrettelagt af frivillige.

Antologien distribueres ad to veje:

  • Gennem regulært salg til privatpersoner, fagpersoner og andre interesserede.

  • Som undervisningsmateiale til ungdomsuddannelserne (dvs. alle erhvervsrettetede og studierettede uddannelser, der starter efter folkeskolen). Disse uddannelser er valgt, fordi de netop henvender sig til unge i den aldersgruppe, hvor psykiske lidelser oftest starter.

    Til at understøtte brug af antologien som undervisningsmateriale, er Outsideren i forhandling med en række samarbejdspartnere om udvikling af en undervisningsguide.

Det er vores mål, at antologien er kendt og tilgængelig på ungdomsuddannelser i alle regioner samt at den kan findes på landets biblioteker - det sted man oftest søger information, hvis man er usikker på hvad der foregår i en selv.

”Jeg følte mig enormt lettet da jeg læste bogen, fordi jeg følte at så var jeg ikke den eneste.” – Fransisca, 18 år

Baggrunden for projektet

Selv om hver anden familie i Danmark på et tidspunkt kommer i kontakt med psykiatrien, eksisterer der meget lidt litteratur om sindslidelser, der er skrevet af mennesker, der har prøvet psykisk sygdom på egen krop.

Københavns Kommunes bibliotektsdatabase indeholder 296 titler, der handler om psykiatri. Af disse er blot 4 skrevet af sindslidende selv. Resten er skrevet af psykiatere, sygeplejersker, forskere og pårørende.

I foreningen Outsideren mener vi i særlig grad, at kunne tale om de nære tanker, overvejelser og personlige udfordringer, der følger med psykiske sygdomme, fordi vi lever med dem til dagligt.

Ifølge WHO er 75% af de, der rammes af en psykisk lidelse, yngre end 26 år ved sygdommens udbrud.

"Jeg tror jeg vil have en større forståelse hvis jeg møder en psykisk syg, efter at have læst det her. Før jeg læste den, ville jeg bare være på dybt vand” - Oliver, 20 år

Hvis du er flad, men gerne vil hjælpe os med antologien:

Vi kan altid bruge en hjælpende hånd - lige nu til at:

  • Udbrede kendskabet til denne kampagne
  • Udbrede kendskabet til antologien - evt. i et lokalt samarbejde med vores samarbejdspatner En Af Os
  • Det du lige kan, som vi ikke har tænkt på

Om Foreningen Outsideren

Foreningen Outsideren blev stiftet i 1995 med det formål, at:
  • At mindske fordomme og udbrede kendskabet til psykiske lidelser, herunder, at det er muligt at komme sig af en psykisk sygdom
  • At skabe en bedre hverdag for borgere med en sindslidelse

Tidsskriftet Outsideren var i 2010 foreslået til Cavling-prisen for at sætte fokus på livsbetingelserne for ”den meget store gruppe danskere, der i deres tilværelse kommer i kontakt med psykiatrien. Bladet giver et markant bidrag til at sætte psykiatribrugere på dagsordenen som ligeværdige borgere i samfundet.”

Læs mere om foreningen her

Foreningen Outsideren har tidligere været initiativtager til projekt Udskrivningsguiden, der i dag er i anvendelse på psykiatriske afdelinger i Region Hovedstadens Psykiatri.

Og - hvis du vil dele dette opslag med alle du kender, er det en kæmpe hjælp!

story:
The Summary

 

 

Dear Berliners and the World, 

As it is right and praiseworthy. Do you want to be a Millionaire, to receive more Wisdom and Love?

 

To live in a manner that is whole and perfect. 

This is a manual for you to become a Millionaire, receive more Love and Happiness in your life.  

Please join our Crowdfunding campaign for the 'Wirtschaft' Book and contribute to our Indiegogo Campaign. In our quest to bring more Wealth, Health and Happiness to all in this world. By contributing a perk of €30, you will receive a hard cover book in German or English language and a fine art print from the Artist and Author Tom Love. 

The book contains 5000 words, 100 images and 210 pages, with practices to become rich and a Millionaire, receive Abundance, Health and Love. The philosophical method to be rich, has been a central theme in many studies, from Early Christianity, Ancient Judaism and Vedic traditions. 

The Book 'Wirtschaft' gives accurate instructions to use as a key to improve life, become a Millionaire, receive Wisdom and Love in your life. The book is melded with words and images to teach, and is also a tool for growth. It is a practical guide to narrate the philosophical key to wisdom, and is the artistic creation from Tom Love. 

By joining us in our Indiegogo quest, the book 'Wirtschaft' will be created in different languages, and published, made available to everyone in book stores, in Berlin, and the rest of the world. 

 

Thank you. 

 

Tom Love 

 

Sermon 

The Storehouse of Riches 

 

Design your own future for permanent increase in Wealth, Wisdom and Strength. Receive the ability to be Rich, Wise and Beloved.

Read the 'Wirtschaft' Book which is complementary and available to download. Or join us in our quest to bring this book to the rest of the world, and make Wirtschaft a book created in different languages and available in bookstores in Berlin and rest of the World. 

 

The Book

Wirtschaft will be a hardcover book, with 210 colored pages, and include a practical guide and exercise to become a millionaire, and be Rich, Wise and Beloved. 

 

The Print

Untitled Print is a photographic fine art print, made by Tom Love to narrate the relationship of art and the prophetic vision of perpetual increase. It is a 5.9 by 8 Inches printed German etching paper by a professional fine art printing company.  

 

The Timeline 

May 2017 

Production of the Wirtschaft book begins for 3 months.  Including translation, editing, and printing of the book. 

 

August to November 2017 

Delivery of the Book and Print to contributors in Berlin and rest of the world. 

 

The Perk 

€30.00 Perk to receive a Book in either English or German language. Please specify your option of German or English Perk. And a Fine Art print from Tom Love signed and enumerated. 

 

Costs of Production 

 

Self Publishing for 100,000 Books is €1,500,000 for €15,000 each print on demand book. Printing for Fine Art print is €1,000,000 for €10 per print at professional printing company.

story:
A Brief Description About Myself

Hello all!!!

First, I would like to thank you for taking the time to check out my project. I'm known to most as Toya J. I'm many things (activist, modern day mystic, accessories designer, and a few more)  but for the purposes of this project I am a poet.  I'm a California native currently residing in Las Vegas. After a degree, several "respectable" jobs, and a few years in non-profit work I've decided to go the route of the self-employed. Which is hippie talk for wayward artist. So I'm presently knee deep in the Las Vegas art scene pursuing my creative endeavors and focusing on all the things I've always wanted to put together such as poetry workshops, open mics, events, and my poetry book.

 

 

That Which Does Not Burn

Two years ago a friend of mine read some of my poetry and suggested that I publish a book. Before then it had never occurred to me to do this so I initially shrugged off the idea. But she planted a seed and since then I've had several others ask me if I'm going to publish my poetry. I took this as a sign.

I gathered all my poems, dated as far back as 2004, and compiled them into one collection. This is how That Which Does Not Burn came to be. I titled my book after the African adinkra symbol for imperishability and endurance, Hye Won Hye. Hye Won Hye literally translates into "that which does not burn". African priests used to wear the symbol because they would conduct rituals involving fire and not get burned. I noticed that all of the poems in the collection tell a story--my journey. And my journey hasn't been easy. I've been through a lot and yet I've taken every experience as a lesson, never allowing anything to break or burn me. 

I feel like its important for everyone to have a platform where they can share their experiences with others. I wrote my first poem at the age of 12, and from then on the creative expression has always served as an outlet. Being able to tell your story and connect with others is one of the most powerful forms of healing there is. My poetry is 100% authentic, vulnerable, and raw. Sometimes it's beautiful and sometimes it doesn't make me look very good but it's always honest. I believe that when you are not afraid to be yourself then it gives others the courage to do the same. I just want to share my art so that others are moved in whatever way they are inspired. 

The What, Where, & Why

That Which Does Not Burn will be my very first book of poetry. Never in a million years did I ever think I would publish anything. Therefore this project is extremely special to me. That Which Does Not Burn will be a self published work. I've decided to go that route for a few reasons:

  • Self publishing allows me to retain all rights and creative control over my art
  • It's cheaper. Cutting the cost of production which allows me to sell my book on a "donation" bases, rather than at a set (and inflated) price. 
  • Copies will be printed at a Vegas based printing company in order to support local business. 

The amount needed for this project is $750, which would be considered a very reasonable sum in terms of book publishing. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • 100 book bound copies
  • ISBN #

Everything else such as manuscript editing, book cover design, marketing, e-book, copyright, etc has already been handled either out of my own pocket or through a network of people willing to donate their services in order to see my project come together. I've already got the ball rolling; now I need this last piece in order to complete it. Even if I don't raise the entire $730, any amount I do receive will go towards printing as many books as I can. Any funds raised above my goal will be put into my next project, a recorded poetry album. 

Donations & Perks

Eternal gratitude and humble appreciation will always be expressed for any support I receive for this project. Whether it be through monetary means or simply sharing this campaign with others.

My tangible "Thank You" includes signed copies of my book, gift certificates from my online jewelry store,  a special mention in my poetry book, and much more!!!!

A Brief Description About Myself
Hello all!!!
First, I would like to thank you for taking the time to check out my project. I'm known to most as Toya J. I'm many things (activist, modern day mystic, accessories designer, and a few more)  but for the purposes of this project I am a poet.  I'm a California native currently residing in Las Vegas. After a degree, several "respectable" jobs, and a few years in non-profit work I've decided to go the route of the self-employed. Which is hippie talk for wayward artist. So I'm presently knee deep in the Las Vegas art scene pursuing my creative endeavors and focusing on all the things I've always wanted to put together such as poetry workshops, open mics, events, and my poetry book.
 
 
That Which Does Not Burn
Two years ago a friend of mine read some of my poetry and suggested that I publish a book. Before then it had never occurred to me to do this so I initially shrugged off the idea. But she planted a seed and since then I've had several others ask me if I'm going to publish my poetry. I took this as a sign.
I gathered all my poems, dated as far back as 2004, and compiled them into one collection. This is how That Which Does Not Burn came to be. I titled my book after the African adinkra symbol for imperishability and endurance, Hye Won Hye. Hye Won Hye literally translates into "that which does not burn". African priests used to wear the symbol because they would conduct rituals involving fire and not get burned. I noticed that all of the poems in the collection tell a story--my journey. And my journey hasn't been easy. I've been through a lot and yet I've taken every experience as a lesson, never allowing anything to break or burn me. 
I feel like its important for everyone to have a platform where they can share their experiences with others. I wrote my first poem at the age of 12, and from then on the creative expression has always served as an outlet. Being able to tell your story and connect with others is one of the most powerful forms of healing there is. My poetry is 100% authentic, vulnerable, and raw. Sometimes it's beautiful and sometimes it doesn't make me look very good but it's always honest. I believe that when you are not afraid to be yourself then it gives others the courage to do the same. I just want to share my art so that others are moved in whatever way they are inspired. 


The What, Where, & Why
That Which Does Not Burn will be my very first book of poetry. Never in a million years did I ever think I would publish anything. Therefore this project is extremely special to me. That Which Does Not Burn will be a self published work. I've decided to go that route for a few reasons:

Self publishing allows me to retain all rights and creative control over my art

story:
**Final Update**

It is with gratitude, excitement, and a feeling of accomplishment that I’m happy to announce that my campaign goal has now been fully funded due to a tiny bit of outside funding! I would like to thank my friends, family, publisher, and even some strangers for coming together to support me on this endeavor. We couldn’t have done this without you!

Story of My Book

The Adversity Seekers — As a larger society, we are often told difficult and adverse circumstances are negatives and only negatives. And while this can certainly be true, it also need not be. In my book, I will illustrate through personal experiences, those of high achievers, and thoughts from psychologists that stress and adversity can be harnessed to our benefit in our journey to recognize our best selves. 

My name is Chris O’Reilly and I am the author of The Adversity Seekers. I wrote this book because I want to proliferate the otherwise unseen message of actively seeking difficult challenges and the adversity that naturally follows in order to fuel personal growth. And through my own often unglamorous story, I want to impart that if I can transform and turn around my life, you can, too.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover just how capable and resilient we as humans are, and how struggle and stress from that struggle can be harnessed to do good. Through my book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for finding your best self through adversity in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you move forward with tools and practical knowledge on just how to begin the long, rewarding process of growing mentally tougher through not shying away from the inevitable stresses of life. 

In this book, you'll learn about suffering and how you begin growth to maximizing your life through its difficulty. 

You will learn a history of how past cultures have viewed suffering as a positive tool. The Spartans were particularly regimented in this regard, and you will find a new appreciation for the warriors (of civilian and military profession) in our present culture.

I share the story of my life - going from born 10 pounds, 11 ounces and thought to be twins until the day of my birth to a competitive athlete now at age 28. In that span of time, I gained 100 pounds twice, lost 100 pounds twice, battled mental illness, earned a college degree, survived decades of bullying, and learned a lifetime’s worth of lessons.

Who is your favorite fictional character? I tell you my own, and why I believe we treasure these beings from stories so much, especially during times of adversity and struggle.

You will love and enjoy this book if you want to turn your life around and are looking for ways to do that. I also know that this book is for you if you are ready to acknowledge who you truly are, warts and all, in order to get started on your journey to becoming whole. Realizing your potential is what I hope to help with, and I believe that you will get much from my book to start doing so. 

The Adversity Seekers is a non-fiction book that I believe could feasibly speak to anybody of any age, gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, etc. If you want to grow, and you feel stuck in a rut right now, you can benefit from reading my book - my message does not discriminate. However, specifically, I know I could have used this message of adversity seeking as a young college student, and have spoken to many middle aged adults who are looking at struggle and how to grow through it for the first time.

The Book - The Adversity Seekers

My book is written as one cohesive arc. As I share my life journey, I give challenges to each reader. And, in between each vignette from my life, I share thoroughly researched pieces on various aspects of what it means to be an adversity seeker. 

I explore the phenomenon of delayed gratification, as well as the benefits of fictional characters and stories on our lives and the history of suffering. 

Overall, I share a cohesive blend of different tips to find the positives in struggling and personal and outside stories meant to illustrate these points. 
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020.

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish!

A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book.

Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover.

I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book.

And more!

About the Author

Chris O’Reilly is a writer and speaker who has lost 100 pounds twice in his life. Last year, he finished in the top 16% of worldwide finishers (more than 1,500) for the annual CrossFit Murph Challenge (a mile run, 100 pull-ups, 200 push-ups, 300 squats, and another mile run). He has performed at The Second City and iO in Chicago, Illinois, and is making his debut as an author with this book. Currently, he is in the midst of founding his life and business coaching company.

O’Reilly is passionate about the power of the human mind over the human body, especially during times of extreme stress and duress. As somebody who has struggled with depression and anxiety his entire life, he has always sought the reason behind why human beings are meant to struggle and grind so hard. He came to the conclusion that humans are meant to in order to be pushed to discovering the best in themselves. He wanted to write this book and share his message and story to make an impact, however small or large, on those wanting to come to that conclusion themselves. 

Growing up a larger kid in an Irish/Italian family, however, O’Reilly understands the struggle: Pizza is awesome. So is spaghetti. So is Irish soda bread. So are Ho-Ho’s, and Twinkies, and Oatmeal Cream Pies. So fret not! Having treat nights is still part of the message!

For more information, you can connect with Chris O’Reilly at christopher.oreilly7591@gmail.com, and on LinkedIn at LinkedIn.com/chris0reilly.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #AdversitySeekers and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media - I would love to be included, too!

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Chris
