story:
Who We Are

Spit That! is a spoken word poetry group at Ithaca College founded in 2006 by Jaylene Clark. We form a community where students may develop and share their thoughts through written and spoken word in a comfortable and non-judgmental community. Spit That! educates its members on various aspects of poetry, while liberating and inspiring the writing of its members through weekly workshops. We spread awareness of sociopolitical issues through poetry performances and readings both on and off campus.

To maintain our dedication to our mission statement, we support our student poets with creative writing prompts, performance opportunities, and open ears. Our group's efforts culminate in our annual spring showcase, which features performances by a select group of IC poets and guest artists. We often collaborate with other clubs and organizations on campus, Cornell University and the greater Ithaca community.

What We Need

We are currently fundraising to have Shihan, a renowned contemporary poet, perform at our spring showcase! Support Spit That! and the writing of countless aspiring spoken word poets.

The Impact

  • Creating a sense of community through the arts
  • Encouraging the use of poetry as a method of catharsis and expression 
  • Showcase the talent of current Ithaca College students

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Like & Share!

story:
¿Qué?

El calor y la noche fue escrita hace más de veinte años con la ingenua intención de metaforizar la vida diaria. Lo grotesco es que esa metáfora (el inhumano calor atemperado por el amor a dos mujeres), ahora, ya, está empezando a ser una realidad. Y si no, al tiempo.

Un calor atroz se ha apoderado del mundo. Física y moralmente, las consecuencias son devastadoras. La aparente inverosimilitud de ese calor sirve al autor para metaforizar una realidad social enferma e ir más allá de las antedichas consecuencias. El protagonista de la historia, Gregorio Almeida, es un hombre que vive (sobrevive) solo en una pequeña ciudad de provincias y que se alimenta de la amistad con una anciana vecina y del recuerdo de una reciente historia de amor con una muchacha, cuyo erotismo (casi suicida) devora al protagonista. Poco a poco la vida (y la soledad, y la indefensión) se deteriora y se va desvaneciendo. Los habitantes de la ciudad parecen haber enloquecido e insisten en vivir el infierno como un dechado de felicidad. El perpetuo sol y las temperaturas son sinónimo del mismo pensamiento común y obligatorio. Plagas de cucarachas convierten en probabilidad lo que parece imposible. Y, sin embargo, el amor, la lucidez, la amistad y la ternura sostienen, casi en vilo, a Gregorio Almeida hasta darle valor, finalmente, para enfrentarse al rostro de ese calor que supera cualquier dimensión conocida.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de publicar obras poco convencionales pero de indudable calidad, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para promocionar cada título cuando esta todavía se encuentra en proceso de edición.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Antonio Gallo.

El autor de El calor y la noche nace y vive en Córdoba hasta los treinta y pico años de edad. En el año 2000 decide (ay) abandonar sus marcas e irse más al norte de Despeñaperros para vivir en Madrid y trabajar como maestro de Educación Primaria y, de paso, tener una hija. Cosas que pasan, qué le vamos a hacer. Dicho autor ha publicado algunas novelas y libros de poesía. Aunque eso carece de importancia. Lo único que importa es la gratitud hacia los antepasados que avalan sus recuerdos, sus lecturas y su vida. Y el agradecimiento, también, a la certeza implícita de que el mundo está lleno de persianas y de penumbras, a través de las cuales, en ocasiones, se nos cuela (y nos justifica, y nos ampara) el amor y el respeto por la sintaxis heredada. El autor agradece a los muertos que aún lo siguen alimentando, el empeño que se toman a diario en no hacerle olvidar el sentido del pudor, lo que no es fácil en los tiempos que corren. Convendría también recordar las palabras de Fernando Pessoa: La sintaxis es cómplice del alma.
          Decir yo o decir soy le parece al que esto escribe de una presunción tan disparatada que casi roza el mal. Ni intelectual ni moralmente ambas palabras se sostienen. Con qué derecho las utilizamos, es algo que siempre le ha sobrecogido. Bien es verdad que la necesidad de usarlas para orientarnos en el uso cotidiano de nuestra mediocridad diaria (sobre todo desde un punto de vista social) avala, en cierto sentido, su uso. Sin embargo, dicho uso no las exime de una cierta náusea. Al menos, el autor de El calor y la noche lo siente así y así se lo parece.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«Lo peor no es cuando estoy dentro de la caja y tú estás conmigo en la habitación. Lo peor viene luego, cuando te vas y me dejas sola ahí dentro. Eso es lo peor. Entonces me doy cuenta de lo poca cosa que soy, me doy cuenta de que no soy nada. Nada. Que si tú no volvieras yo no tendría esperanza. Lo peor es la oscuridad, la oscuridad de la noche, no saber cuándo vas a venir y la poca importancia que tengo. No puedo hacer nada más, sólo llorar de vergüenza. Los minutos me parecen años. Y sé que no vas a venir, aunque te llame, que sólo vendrás cuando tú quieras. Eso es lo peor, ¿entiendes? Es algo que descubro en mí, que sé de mí. Y me pasa de golpe. No te lo sé explicar, no lo sé expresar con palabras. No es algo que entienda porque lo piense, es algo que entiendo porque lo siento, porque lo sé de otra manera, porque lo sé gracias a lo que tú me haces. Pensar en que estoy como estoy no me sirve de nada. Es saberlo sin necesidad de pensarlo. ¿Me comprendes?
         Yo no me puedo mover por las correas, y al principio no me angustio. Pienso que te vas para volver pronto. A veces te oigo andar por la casa, ir a la cocina, abrir la nevera. Oigo, incluso, cómo te sirves algo de beber. También oigo cómo te acercas por el pasillo y te quedas al otro lado de la puerta espiando mis sonidos. Yo sé que crees que no lo sé, pero lo sé. Lo malo viene después de ese principio, cuando oigo que te vas otra vez y ya no sé dónde estás. Cuando no te oigo. Entonces es horrible porque empiezo a estar segura de que no vas a volver nunca más. Es una angustia que va creciendo dentro de mí poco a poco, hasta hacerse realidad: estoy convencida de que no vas a volver, de que no me vas a quitar las correas. Y saber eso es lo peor. Puede durar cinco o veinte minutos, pero son una eternidad. Y aunque vuelvas, esa eternidad se me ha quedado dentro para siempre. Para siempre. Y es dentro de esa eternidad cuando comprendo, de golpe, que no soy nada, que no merezco nada. Ni siquiera el dolor. En el fondo de ese pozo negro el dolor sería un regalo. Tan acabada estoy.
         Necesito que me entiendas, quiero contarte estas cosas antes de que sea demasiado tarde».

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 880€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción BACK IT es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Antonio Gallo vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Política de Privacidad
story_txt:
¿Qué?El calor y la noche fue escrita hace más de veinte años con la ingenua intención de metaforizar la vida diaria. Lo grotesco es que esa metáfora (el inhumano calor atemperado por el amor a dos mujeres), ahora, ya, está empezando a ser una realidad. Y si no, al tiempo.Un calor atroz se ha apoderado del mundo. Física y moralmente, las consecuencias son devastadoras. La aparente inverosimilitud de ese calor sirve al autor para metaforizar una realidad social enferma e ir más allá de las antedichas consecuencias. El protagonista de la historia, Gregorio Almeida, es un hombre que vive (sobrevive) solo en una pequeña ciudad de provincias y que se alimenta de la amistad con una anciana vecina y del recuerdo de una reciente historia de amor con una muchacha, cuyo erotismo (casi suicida) devora al protagonista. Poco a poco la vida (y la soledad, y la indefensión) se deteriora y se va desvaneciendo. Los habitantes de la ciudad parecen haber enloquecido e insisten en vivir el infierno como un dechado de felicidad. El perpetuo sol y las temperaturas son sinónimo del mismo pensamiento común y obligatorio. Plagas de cucarachas convierten en probabilidad lo que parece imposible. Y, sin embargo, el amor, la lucidez, la amistad y la ternura sostienen, casi en vilo, a Gregorio Almeida hasta darle valor, finalmente, para enfrentarse al rostro de ese calor que supera cualquier dimensión conocida.¿Quiénes?Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de publicar obras poco convencionales pero de indudable calidad, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para promocionar cada título cuando esta todavía se encuentra en proceso de edición.De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.Hoy te presentamos a Antonio Gallo.El autor de El calor y la noche nace y vive en Córdoba hasta los treinta y pico años de edad. En el año 2000 decide (ay) abandonar sus marcas e irse más al norte de Despeñaperros para vivir en Madrid y trabajar como maestro de Educación Primaria y, de paso, tener una hija. Cosas que pasan, qué le vamos a hacer. Dicho autor ha publicado algunas novelas y libros de poesía. Aunque eso carece de importancia. Lo único que importa es la gratitud hacia los antepasados que avalan sus recuerdos, sus lecturas y su vida. Y el agradecimiento, también, a la certeza implícita de que el mundo está lleno de persianas y de penumbras, a través de las cuales, en ocasiones, se nos cuela (y nos justifica, y nos ampara) el amor y el respeto por la sintaxis heredada. El autor agradece a los muertos que aún lo siguen alimentando, el empeño que se toman a diario en no hacerle olvidar el sentido del pudor, lo que no es fácil en los tiempos que corren. Convendría también recordar las palabras de Fernando Pessoa: La sintaxis es cómplice del alma.          Decir yo o decir soy le parece al que esto escribe de una presunción tan disparatada que casi roza el mal. Ni intelectual ni moralmente ambas palabras se sostienen. Con qué derecho las utilizamos, es algo que siempre le ha sobrecogido. Bien es verdad que la necesidad de usarlas para orientarnos en el uso cotidiano de nuestra mediocridad diaria (sobre todo desde un punto de vista social) avala, en cierto sentido, su uso. Sin embargo, dicho uso no las exime de una cierta náusea. Al menos, el autor de El calor y la noche lo siente así y así se lo parece.¿Por qué?Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:«Lo peor no es cuando estoy dentro de la caja y tú estás conmigo en la habitación. Lo peor viene luego, cuando te vas y me dejas sola ahí dentro. Eso es lo peor. Entonces me doy cuenta de lo poca cosa que soy, me doy cuenta de que no soy nada. Nada. Que si tú no volvieras yo no tendría esperanza. Lo peor es la oscuridad, la oscuridad de la noche, no saber cuándo vas a venir y la poca importancia que tengo. No puedo hacer nada más, sólo llorar de vergüenza. Los minutos me parecen años. Y sé que no vas a venir, aunque te llame, que sólo vendrás cuando tú quieras. Eso es lo peor, ¿entiendes? Es algo que descubro en mí, que sé de mí. Y me pasa de golpe. No te lo sé explicar, no lo sé expresar con palabras. No es algo que entienda porque lo piense, es algo que entiendo porque lo siento, porque lo sé de otra manera, porque lo sé gracias a lo que tú me haces. Pensar en que estoy como estoy no me sirve de nada. Es saberlo sin necesidad de pensarlo. ¿Me comprendes?         Yo no me puedo mover por las correas, y al principio no me angustio. Pienso que te vas para volver pronto. A veces te oigo andar por la casa, ir a la cocina, abrir la nevera. Oigo, incluso, cómo te sirves algo de beber. También oigo cómo te acercas por el pasillo y te quedas al otro lado de la puerta espiando mis sonidos. Yo sé que crees que no lo sé, pero lo sé. Lo malo viene después de ese principio, cuando oigo que te vas otra vez y ya no sé dónde estás. Cuando no te oigo. Entonces es horrible porque empiezo a estar segura de que no vas a volver nunca más. Es una angustia que va creciendo dentro de mí poco a poco, hasta hacerse realidad: estoy convencida de que no vas a volver, de que no me vas a quitar las correas. Y saber eso es lo peor. Puede durar cinco o veinte minutos, pero son una eternidad. Y aunque vuelvas, esa eternidad se me ha quedado dentro para siempre. Para siempre. Y es dentro de esa eternidad cuando comprendo, de golpe, que no soy nada, que no merezco nada. Ni siquiera el dolor. En el fondo de ese pozo negro el dolor sería un regalo. Tan acabada estoy.         Necesito que me entiendas, quiero contarte estas cosas antes de que sea demasiado tarde».¿Cómo?Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 880€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.
Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

story:
Short Summary

Philadelphia Stories Jr. publishes writing and art by local kids in a free magazine, read by more than 4,000 people each year. We also partner with libraries, schools, and other youth organizations to celebrate their work through events and free workshops.

Publishing a free magazine and hosting free events isn't cheap, but we believe it's important. We don't need to give you more doom and gloom stats on how schools are cutting arts programs. We'd rather tell you the good news that kids are still telling stories with words and art.  Do you remember that first time you felt yourself truly launched into a new world through the magic of words? That's what we're trying to do with Philadelphia Stories Jr. -- to provide a place where kids can discover the transformative power of story, and learn that every voice is unique and important.

What We Need & What You Get

NEW! Make a donation to the campaign before our deadline of December 10, and you will be entered to win 4 tickets to the Arden Theatre's production of Sideways Stories from Wayside School! (And, you can still select a perk!)

  • We need about $3,000 to cover our costs for one issue of Philadelphia Stories Jr., which includes the party, the printing, the production, and the postage (how's that for alliteration?).
  • We have met our first goal of $2,000, which will make 2,000 copies of the free magazine available to readers of all ages. THANK YOU!  Phase 2 of our campaign will help fund our free workshops and get the free magazine out to more places. It's not too late to show your support!
  • We're offering perks that let you show the world how cool you think it is that kids get to be published authors and artists! We'll offer home delivery of the magazine for a year, fun Ts for kids, and even a pass to a one-day publishing workshop for writers of any age!

The Impact

Every little bit helps. You can't give too little - and you certainly can't give too much! Your contribution will directly support:

  • Publishing the work of young writers & artists.
  • Making that work available at every branch of the Philadelphia Free Library and many more libraries and schools. We have to ship the issues to reach this wide audience, which ain't cheap.
  • Space rental where we can host events to celebrate young artists beyond the ones published in the magazine.
  • Free workshops & programs: If we exceed our goal, these additional funds will help us pay qualified workshop instructors to bring their expertise to teach kids how to tell their stories.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone has the means to make a contribution. If you can't donate today, please consider:

  • Telling your friends about our campaign. Taking a few minutes to share a tweet or status update pointing your friends to our site can really help! 
  • Telling your local school or library about the program and encouraging their young artists & writers to submit their work.
  • Asking your local school or library if they would be interested in distributing the free magazine.

story:
♥ Yippie, hooray we made it. We're beaming and crying all at the same time. Your belief means the world to us and we are eternally grateful. ♥

We're starting work on the FRENCH & INUKTITUT ᐃᓄᒃᑎᑐᑦ translation of Our Canadian Love Story.

Our little love tale has made it to indiegogo's homepage and took their twitter campaign of the day. Air Canada featured us in a fantastic interview and we're mighty proud of how much love and support you've shown us. It's been a remarkable ride as well as a full time job. 

You have made our publishing dream come true. Thanks to all of your donations Our Canadian Love Story will soon be printed and now el señor Giacomo and mademoiselle Jacqueline officially get to fall in love.

It only took 160 of you to make Rebecca and I dance across the rainbow...and then the contributions just kept coming. Remarkable. We're humbled and speechless.

Linnie's love letter to funders and to Canada:

♥ on march 7th you made our dream come true. rebecca and i are dancing across the rainbow and you’re the ones holding our hands. this dream has been about so much more than just publishing ‘our canadian love story’.

this book is linnie’s ‘thank you’ note to the many canadians that have left their homes and families, waved their loved ones good bye in the place they’ve known and adored, in the hope of turning a page and starting their own 'canadian love story'.

i cannot wait to talk to children and parents all over canada about the hardship they’ve endured to make a new life in a foreign place…a place we all want to call home…a place we take pride in…a place we finally hope to belong to…and a place we know we can give our all to. we’re not here because our homes aren’t livable, but because we come with the united hope of contributing in a place that will appreciate our efforts.

the reasons we come here are as diverse as the colours of the beaches around the world…our stories are our own…our pains are shared…and the hopes that unite us dance along the same spectrum of the rainbow.

canada does not make it easy…canada makes us prove the genuinity of our love…the intensity of our commitment to our immigration efforts and often tests us to the breaking point of our ability to prove our love to the new country we want to call home…

it’s sometimes a lonely journey until we find the many others that have committed to the opportunity to start afresh.

this is an education challenge…a chance to give those who need to talk the ability to share their stories and those who have been here for years a new perspective on the many facettes of what immigration means to those who commit to it.

all this and much more is what your belief has allowed us to accomplish…we thank you more than words can say…because it means the world to us…because it is our world…the world of a new life…far away from the life we know. ♥

Our promise to you continues to ring true:

For every $25 donation you contribute, we promise to send you a signed hardcover copy of Our Canadian Love Story. Unless we know you. Then we will deliver it in person.

All of our thank yous make beautiful gifts.

Of course there are many other special thank yous to be had...like signed and numbered copies of Rebecca's original illustrations for the book, thank you mentions, in print, forever or even your very own custom character.

I would be happy to customize my author's message for you or imagine owning your very own character. A twelve string acoustic guitar playing owl (already taken), a bongo playing panda or a trumpeting giraffe? Your character will be part of el señor Giacomo and mademoiselle Jacqueline's band. Of course we will introduce the cast in the thank you section of our book. Perhaps you'd like to dedicate a character to your child, your niece, your unborn baby? You could also dedicate the Thank You to your business, your rotary club or pretty much anyone you like.

More support equals a more awesome package for you filled with more love from us. 

By publishing Our Canadian Love Story we sincerely hope that our little tale will inspire dialogue within your families, schools & playgroups about what immigration means to the fabric of our joint Canadian life.

And if you’re feeling a little less philosophical: then it’s simply a whimsical tale about two jackrabbits who fall in love...with each other and with Canada.

El señor Giacomo and mademoiselle Jacqueline, the main jackrabbits of our tale, arrive in Canada much like you did…or maybe your mom and dad or gran and pop, or oma and opa, or nonna and nonno, or grand-père and grand-mère*…because somebody they knew said to them:

“There is a place where the horizon is endless. Where the sky dances with the light that is the music of our planet and where the ground is dusted in white diamond powder. And the best part is, that it tastes and smells like sweet sugary maple, right from the Atlantic coast on the East all the way to the Pacific coast on the West.”

Help them pack their bag in a land far away from ours. Learn why jackrabbit fur changes colour. Watch them chug a spoonful of courage and fly to Canada on an Air Canada Goose flight. And finally wave at them as they arrive at Terminal 1 of Canada International Airport.

Take a seat in the front row as they fall in love and start a band.

What will your belief & support help us achieve other than a dance over the rainbow?

I wrote Our Canadian Love Story on three Air Canada puke bags. The story spilled out in one go and turbulences didn't allow me to reach for my notebook. You will agree that said bags are no suitable medium for a children's tale and even less so for a tale about love.

Rebecca is so magicaly gifted and I feel so blessed that she imagined my words into pictures.

Together we are on the road to self-publishing.

$10,000 will allow us:

* to start up Silk Web Publishing

* because important book sellers only buy from real book publishers

* keep it local and print with Friesens (employee owned and truly Canadian)

* written in Canadian air space

* illustrated in Canada

* printed in Canada

(for the same reasons we love & support farmers markets)

* print professional quality

* Hardcover: 100 lb. Matte over 100 pt. board; 4 process colours

* Trim Size: 8.25 x 9

* 32 pages plus endsheets, plus casebound cover

* 80 lb. Matte White; 4 process colours throughout

* Endsheets: Offset White; one PMS colour one side of each (solid wash)

* raise our voice

         * create a website

         * advertise to independent kid’s store, the library people etc.

         * bribe our favourite social media folks to toot our horn

* get our acronyms right

* ISBN, EAN, CIP want more?

* there’s a lot of stuff that goes on books and some of it costs money

When will you get to hold your thank you?

This is an all or nothing campaign. Because we have already made our goal we can officially honour all of your Thank Yous.

We are hoping to publish asap. If things stay on track we will be able to ship out your thank you much sooner than August 1st. It goes without saying that we will keep you posted.

Other ways you can help us?

* Raise your voice about what we’re doing: Our story makes for great small talk on buses, in cost-co line-ups or pretty much any time you find yourself in possession of a mega- or microphone (at an Indian wedding, a karoke bar…)

* Bribe YOUR favourite social media folks to toot our horn

* This is the time to rally up your mom, uncle and grandma to show them how easy Indiegogo makes sharing things on facebook & twitter.

Have we mentioned that we love you yet?

Thank you. So very, very much.

Let’s hold hands and run across the rainbow.

Penned from us to you with love and gratitude.

Linnie & Rebecca

Keep checking back to see where this can go...they sky is the limit & pretty please tell a friend.

*Unless of course you’re first nations. Then you constitute 4% of the population that has been lucky enough to call Canada home since day one.

story:
Double Blind Book Reviews.

 

My name is Rick Carufel and I am the founder of Double Blind Book Reviews. I have been an author for 15 years and an artist for 45. I self publish my own books as ebooks and POD paperbacks and those of others as an indie publisher.

Sadly there is a free for all as far as indie book reviews are concerned. None are truly objective or impartial. Double Blind Book Reviews plans to fill this gap with the only reviews to use a double blind experimental model to insure impartiality. Furthermore we plan to have our email traffic audited to insure the scientific method is followed.

Basically manuscripts submitted for review have the name of the author and the title removed and replaced by a number and the genre. This insures no personal bias on the part of the reviewer. Conversely no reviewer is connected to any reviews and all reviews will published only on our website.

This is an innovation of the book review process that will produce book reviews of superior quality to any available to date for both traditional and indie authors. We intend to set the bar for quality reviews.

The reviews will be a free service and the reviews will appear only on the DDBR site. Reviewers will be sought in the teaching community. There is a great number of retired educators who are avid readers.

The site will be supported with sponsorship and donations.

What I am seeking is the launch money. To get the website built and advertised across the major book venues online. A law firm must be retained for legalese and auditing to insure strict adherence to the scientific method.

I believe there is huge author support for a service such as  this.

story:
“An adventure... a sturdy guide into one of the most brilliant, contradictory, acidic, psychic and dangerous minds of the last few decades.” - John Robb

Now available here: https://www.dailyreckless.com/product/40-odd-years-of-the-fall/

Backdrop

The Fall were a phenomenon in the history of popular music. From 1977 until the untimely death of mercurial frontman Mark E Smith earlier this year, they produced a vast catalogue of work (500+ tracks) and were, in John Peel’s estimation, the band against whom all others must be judged.

40 Odd Years Of The Fall is a song-by-song account of their musical output based on author Tommy Mackay's hugely popular fan site, The Story Of The Fall. Its reach is extensive, including many rare gems and tracks which were only ever aired in a live setting.

The book has a foreword by Arab Strap's Aidan Moffat (which intriguingly begins, "The only time I ever met Mark E Smith, I told him his band were shite"), and is quirkily illustrated by The National newspaper's resident cartoonist Greg Moodie - both major fans.

A valuable resource for old hands and new converts alike, 40 Odd Years Of The Fall explores the wide-ranging and occasionally maddening back catalogue of the group in a way that is at once accessible, informative, compelling and consistently entertaining.

Behind The Counter

Each year is chapterised and opens with a unique, full-colour collage of then-current Fall references, and an introduction setting the material in the wider historical context of the time. Each track features the author's pithy observations followed by notes on line-up, release, first live performance, Peel session and other details.

A chunky 268 pages, the book is 234 x 156mm (9" x 6") and printed on 90gsm white offset with a 240gsm gloss laminated cover. It is printed by Bell & Bain, one of the oldest and most respected independent book producers in the UK. Funds of £7500 are required to meet the cost of printing, along with postage and sturdy packaging.

The Bad Stuff

The basic perk (the 'First One Today') is a downloadable PDF of the book. The second level perk (the '2nd Dark Age') is a signed paperback copy of the book.

An additional perk (the 'Totally Wired') includes a limited edition set of four signed A3+ (483 x 329mm) watercolour paper art prints, based on the illustrator's Mark E Smith collages. Together with the book, they make an essential and highly original companion set to The Fall's body of work.

Pledge!

This is a book by fans for the fans. The only way we can make it a reality is to crowdfund it, and we need to reach that total to make it work. Please help by pledging a contribution and using the share tools to spread the word.

And remember, you don’t deserve rock and roll.

Now available here: https://www.dailyreckless.com/product/40-odd-years-of-the-fall/

story:
Unmasking: A Woman's Journey is a story of abandonment, molestation, segregation, kidnapping, bullying, and domestic violence.  It is a story of a social worker who struggled with the same issues endured by her clilents. It is the story of Gloria Ewing Lockhart, 1946 to the present. It is a story of how despite these injustices, Gloria held onto her dreams and completed college; trained for the Olympics; climbed Mt. Kilimanjaro; and professionally ascended to a position of leadership as President and CEO of a non-profit organization where she now empowers others to follow their dreams as well.  Your contribution toward the publication of this inspiring memoir and catharsis will fund the final editing of Unmasking: A Woman's Journey before publication.  Your contribution to this effort will also assist with an honorarium to the college intern who is compiling the Resource Guide that will accompany this book--to assist others on their journey.
We need $3,000 to complete the editing/proofreading of my memoir before publication. Your gift to this effort will also assist with an honorarium to a college intern who is compiling a Resource Guide that will accompany the book--to assist others on their journey.  I have been working on my memoir since 1991, and I am excited to know that your donation today will move me closer to the goal of publication. I will keep you posted on our progress.  Thank you again for supporting this Indiegogo campaign.
Please take a minute to spread the word about my project to your friends and others in the community. You can also visit me on my website, Facebook or email. Thanks again for your gift and your vote of confidence in this project.
Once published, a percentage of the proceeds of Unmasking: A Woman's Journey, will go to charity to help low-income youth achieve their dream of college or trade school.
Unmasking is an amazing book which quietly pulls the reader in page by page and matter-of-factly discusses the life of an innocent African American child growing up and enduring prejudice, abuse, and loss in America. Lockhart's book is all the more powerful as her words pull you back through the decades through the eyes of a very brave soul who emerges as an accomplished woman and inspiration to all who have overcome adversity." Susan G. Solomon, President, Solomon Marketing Communications, Washington, D.C.
Helen Keller once said, "I am one, but still I am one; I cannot do everything but still I can do something; and just because I cannot do everything, I will not refuse to do the something that I can do." Please take a minute to spread the word about my project to your friends and others in the community.  You can also visit me on Facebook, my website or email me. Thank you for making Unmasking:A Woman's Journey a reality.

story:
Hello. I’m Deane Driscoll, and I am an astrologer.  

For me, astrology has been much more than a hobby, much more than a profession even.  It has been my calling.

MY STORY

I was very fortunate to know early in life what my true calling was. Because many still don't know that at midlife.  I began studying astrology when I was in grade school.  But in fact, it was my father who actually inspired me to want to know more about the planets and stars; although that was never actually his intention.

My father was a dreamer, and all his dreams were of the sea.  He loved sailing.  And somewhere along the way, he learned how to navigate using the night sky.  So he knew many of the constellations.  One fateful, clear, 4th of July night we went up to lay on our rooftop and watch the neighboring fireworks.  It was quite the show.  But that was nothing compared to what came next. After the fireworks died down enough to see the stars, and everything grew quiet again, my father pointed skyward and began naming them for me.  He pointed the constellations out as they rose in the sky and told me their stories.  Because the sky, as it turns out, is absolutely chock full of stories.  

As my father talked that night, a lightbulb went on over my head and I suddenly realized:  'THE SKY IS ORGANIZED!'  I was about 10 years old at the time and this was an immense revelation to me.  Up until that point I had assumed that the pretty light show above our heads was random.  I was gobsmacked, flabbergasted and more importantly I was hooked.  There was no going back at that point.  I was going to be an astrologer.   Because what I most wanted to know was this: Is the organization above our heads a language—one that we might one day learn?

Turns out, it is, and we can.  And if there's a language, then someone put it there.  Someone who very much wants to communicate.  So for me, when I look up, I see a love letter from our creator, and I want to know what it says.  And when I read someone’s natal chart—that most important and unique blueprint they brought with them into this life—I am translating a very ancient and beautiful code: the language of the heavens. And though it is ancient, this language is not dead.  Far from it.  The sky above us is alive with movement—everything is constantly in motion up there. And this movement tells us what time it is.  Celestially speaking, the entire cosmos is engaged in a sort of dance.  Some months it's a delicate, graceful waltz and other months it's an all out rave! And if you know how to read it, you'll know which dance to do when.  You see, in addition to being a sailor, my father was also a musician.  He played the drums.  Rhythm filled our house.  Perhaps that's why I can look up and 'see' the dance now. 

For more than 30 years the obsession with this cosmic dance has been both my calling and my spiritual journey--watching the dance and telling others what steps they'll need to learn.  And, though it is not possible to know everything about astrology (one of my favorite things about it, by the way), after a lifetime of studying and teaching it, I now find myself in the position of having something to say about it all.  Something original.  And I’d like to say it in writing.

MY GOAL

The book I am writing is called (surprise) 'The Cosmic Dance.'  It is the culmination of everything I have learned about how we are connected to the cosmos.  If you contribute to my project you will be helping me to bring a lifetime of experience to others—astrologers and non-astrologers alike.  And you will have helped to preserve this wisdom for the next generation of astrologers and seekers yet to be.  My goal is to have a finished manuscript by Christmas, 2014.  If you've ever written a book, you'll know how ambitious a goal this is.  But this is my dream.  So, to those of you who might like to help me put my book out there, I want to say ‘thank-you.' Your contribution and good will is invaluable to me. And your support will help me to realize a very cherished personal dream. 

NEW MOON BALLROOM

Years ago I wrote a monthly column on the sky for a small local paper. It was to help introduce people to astrology and what it can do.  I called it 'The New Moon Ballroom' and I compared the movement of the moon and planets each month to a particular dance.  Even though we live very different lives from one another, we do all share the same sky.  And that means we all share some universal themes as well.  The idea was to help people stay in step with the rhythm of the sky each month.  Because what happens above us is mirrored here on earth (As above, so below; as within, so without; as the universe, so the soul).  To illustrate how absolutely fascinating astrology is, I've written up a quick peek at what the July skies might have in store for us all.

A new moon occurs when the Sun and Moon form a conjunction or pairing in the sky, and come together in the same sign of the zodiac.  This occurs approximately once per month (or, about every 28 days). It marks a time when we begin again as far as our goals are concerned.  Isn't it wonderful to know that we get to 'reboot' some part of our lives each month?  If you know your own natal chart, you can make each new moon more personal by seeing where it impacts your individual horoscope.  And if you don’t know it, guess who can tell you?  Yes, that’s right!  Call your friendly local Astrologer.

The New Moon for July will occur on July 26th in the sign of Leo the Lion, the sign of courage, children, creativity, performing, and recreation.  This new moon is doing an energetic watusi, so put your dancing shoes on!  It also happens to be conjunct (sitting with) Jupiter and this should bring prosperous and happy new opportunities to develop your creativity.  Bonus points if you actually use creativity in your projects at work; they should grow in both number and scope now.  And Jupiter should help boost your confidence to get out there and have your ideas heard or seen.   Some of us will even have spectacular new opportunities coming our way.

Saturn, which has been retrograding since March 2nd, finally goes direct on July 20th.  When Saturn retrograded (a retrograding planet appears to be slowing down and traveling backward) it gummed up the works for a lot of people in their careers.  Projects may have stalled or been back-burnered for awhile. But at the end of July, as Saturn goes direct again, your careers should stop stagnating and get up and running again.  For some this means being very busy, and if you combine this with the Leo/Jupiter new moon, you may suddenly have more work than you can handle.  Saturn direct is also good news for real estate (both buying and selling). So get ready, but remember to have fun while you’re at it.  Leo is the sign of recreation, after all.  This is only a small portion of the dance the heavens are doing now, but it gives you a small idea of what's possible with astrology.

Remember, it’s only a dance.  Each month the planets will teach you a new one.  And we can all afford to learn a few new steps every now and again.  So play, smile, be kind.  Then look up and thank your lucky stars!


Check out my website: www.deanedriscoll.com for more monthly articles on the sky and updates on progress with my book.  And thanks for your support!

story:
UPDATE: This book is ready and now available on http://book.killerproductdemo.com both digital and printed

Create and Deliver a Killer Product Demo

Have you ever thought why some product demos inspire while many others are boring and soon forgotten?

Would you like to demo like Elon Musk does and Steve Jobs did?

If you have a great product, I’ll give you three reasons why this book should be on your bookshelf:

 

  1. It’s a complete guide with practical advice on how to create and deliver a product demo
  2. It will bring out the best of your creative side so you will craft a unique and inspiring demo
  3. It shows the dissection of dozens of product demos that made history. A ton of inspiration
 

 

About Myself

I am Oscar Santolalla, a Peruvian based in Finland. I am Host and Producer of the public speaking podcast Time to Shine. I have worked in the technology arena for more than 10 years. Due to my years of experience as a Product Manager I became naturally interested in technical talks and product demos.

One day I started analyzing speeches and especially product demos that made history, such as Steve Jobs' iPhone launch and Elon Musk's Tesla Powerwall keynote. That led me to share the stories behind them and the mechanics of successful product demos. Today I am writing this book in which I offer you very practical advice, and also ignite your creative side so you will craft a unique and inspiring demo.

What You Will Get

Today I have a lot of material that I have created and this is the opportunity to put it all together in a 180-page step-by-step guide. This book is already more than 50% written, but I still plan to spend some extra time in researching, analyzing more product demos, conducting a few more interviews, and adding practical advice on the latest trends in demos. 

The main costs involved in this project are:

  • Professional editor fees
  • Layout and design
  • Printing costs
  • Shipping costs
  • Indiegogo and payment processing fees
In order to be on the safe side, I need at least USD 8,000 to produce and ship 250 copies of the book. I believe an updated book on product demos is long overdue and I need you to help make it happen.
I am also offering high-value extra perks, such as: private workshops, coaching sessions and sponsorships.

The Perks

Now it's time for you to choose among the rewards you can obtain by supporting this book. All of them are high value for this time-limited offer:

 


Estimated delivery of the books is September 2016.

 

The Impact

Very often I meet new guys working for a startup or a technology company, and they confess me that they would like to find more effective and inspiring ways to show their products. If you share this feeling, this book is for you.

"Create and Deliver a Killer Product Demo" is unique as it is focused on creating those memorable WOW moments that stick on people's minds. 

The book analyzes the best of demos that made history, from Engelbart's Mother of All Demos (1968) to the contemporary demos.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk is that the campaign doesn't reach its goal. Rest assured that even if I don't reach the full goal, I will finish the book and I will deliver it to my backers.

Also it's possible that the feedback I receive from you brings such amazing ideas that the book will take longer to be finished. Despite of the fact that a delay is not in my plans, I am committed to deliver the very best book you can find on this topic.

Other Ways You Can Help

I'm creating this book for you. You can also help me by sending me feedback and suggestions. What would you like to see in this book?

If you like my project but the book is just not for you, you can still help by telling a colleague or a friend about this campaign. Please use the sharing buttons on this page. 

Thank you a lot!

 

Oscar

Create and Deliver a Killer Product Demo
Have you ever thought why some product demos inspire while many others are boring and soon forgotten?
Would you like to demo like Elon Musk does and Steve Jobs did?
If you have a great product, I’ll give you three reasons why this book should be on your bookshelf:
 

It’s a complete guide with practical advice on how to create and deliver a product demo
It will bring out the best of your creative side so you will craft a unique and inspiring demo
It shows the dissection of dozens of product demos that made history. A ton of inspiration


 
 
About Myself
I am Oscar Santolalla, a Peruvian based in Finland. I am Host and Producer of the public speaking podcast Time to Shine. I have worked in the technology arena for more than 10 years. Due to my years of experience as a Product Manager I became naturally interested in technical talks and product demos.
One day I started analyzing speeches and especially product demos that made history, such as Steve Jobs' iPhone launch and Elon Musk's Tesla Powerwall keynote. That led me to share the stories behind them and the mechanics of successful product demos. Today I am writing this book in which I offer you very practical advice, and also ignite your creative side so you will craft a unique and inspiring demo.

What You Will Get
Today I have a lot of material that I have created and this is the opportunity to put it all together in a 180-page step-by-step guide. This book is already more than 50% written, but I still plan to spend some extra time in researching, analyzing more product demos, conducting a few more interviews, and adding practical advice on the latest trends in demos. 
The main costs involved in this project are:

Professional editor fees
Layout and design
Printing costs
Shipping costs
Indiegogo and payment processing fees

In order to be on the safe side, I need at least USD 8,000 to produce and ship 250 copies of the book. I believe an updated book on product demos is long overdue and I need you to help make it happen.I am also offering high-value extra perks, such as: private workshops, coaching sessions and sponsorships.

The Perks
Now it's time for you to choose among the rewards you can obtain by supporting this book. All of them are high value for this time-limited offer:
 







Estimated delivery of the books is September 2016.
 
The Impact
Very often I meet new guys working for a startup or a technology company, and they confess me that they would like to find more effective and inspiring ways to show their products. If you share this feeling, this book is for you.
"Create and Deliver a Killer Product Demo" is unique as it is focused on creating those memorable WOW moments that stick on people's minds. 
The book analyzes the best of demos that made history, from Engelbart's Mother of All Demos (1968) to the contemporary demos.

Risks & Challenges
The biggest risk is that the campaign doesn't reach its goal. Rest assured that even if I don't reach the full goal, I will finish the book and I will deliver it to my backers.
Also it's possible that the feedback I receive from you brings such amazing ideas that the book will take longer to be finished. Despite of the fact that a delay is not in my plans, I am committed to deliver the very best book you can find on this topic.

Other Ways You Can Help
I'm creating this book for you. You can also help me by sending me feedback and suggestions. What would you like to see in this book?
If you like my project but the book is just not for you, you can still help by telling a colleague or a friend about this campaign. Please use the sharing buttons on this page. 
Thank you a lot!
 
Oscar

story:
In a future where curiosity has been outlawed, Ross Bridell, a language genius working at one of the last private detective agencies, thinks he and the ghost of his ex-boyfriend can still work things out. But there's more than one ghost stuck inside Ross's head, and as half a dozen voices fight for control, Ross finds himself being drawn toward an impossible apocalypse in the making. Teaming up with Neal Pendleton, a young man diagnosed with excessive inquisitiveness disorder, Ross sets out to pry the truth behind what's happening to him from a city that doesn't like questions. The old world is already gone. Which world will die next?

About The Book

Godfall Golden is a story about privacy in the digital age, the psychology of expectations, and a New York City changed forever by catastrophe. I wanted to write the kind of book I could both see myself in and lose myself in, featuring a gay perspective that feels naturally integrated and adds up to more than a tortured coming-out allegory. Godfall Golden is my magical science-fiction daydream, written as a "what the hell is going on here" book that I hope will keep surprising you until the end. Read a sample here!

As my sixth novel and a sequel to Broken Lightning: Legend of the Qi Symbol, Godfall Golden benefits from the experience of an established writer and self-publisher, and comes with a deep mythology (including a fictional language) that you can engage with as much or as little as you want. I've never been more excited about a project, and now, I'm asking for your help to make it a success.

Cover art by Christopher Curry John O'Connell; photography by Ace Salisbury.

About My Goal

The $5,000 I'm hoping to raise will cover Godfall Golden's production costs, including:

  • Payments to my team: editor, cover designer, publicity trainer, etc. I strongly believe in giving freelance employees a fair and equitable rate for their skilled contributions to this project, which would not have been possible without them.
  • Setup fees such as ISBN registration, web hosting, and proof copies of the book itself.

I've chosen flexible funding for this project because any amount that I can raise will help defer these costs.

    Risks & Challenges

    There shouldn't be much risk for you as an investor: Godfall Golden has already been fully written and edited, so all rewards that include a copy of the book should deliver as promised, and the actual release date (December 2nd 2014, with a soft launch on December 1st) should stay firm. Any physical rewards carry some risk of shipping delays beyond my control, and of course there could always be random unforeseen circumstances, but especially after launching so many previous books, I think I'm well prepared.

    The primary risk of this project is on my side. I want Godfall Golden to reach a wider and more appropriate audience than any of my books have before, and I want it to serve as an example that the Hushed Forest Entertainment publishing model can be sustainable long-term (see "What's Next?" below). As such, I've made a pretty big up-front investment in the book, and I have high expectations for its performance. How well the book's actual performance matches those expectations will have a big impact on my ability to approach similar projects in the future.

    Making sure Godfall Golden does well is also my #1 challenge, because although I've spent the last several months building a "platform" of Facebook fans and Twitter followers, I'll be the first to admit that I'm not a marketing expert, and I don't have any industry connections or anything like that to help me get publicity. That means I'll be leaning very heavily on word-of-mouth--hoping that people who believe in me will show the project to their friends--and stimulating that is something I'm only going to learn as I go. Every dollar, every comment, and every share helps!

      What's Next?

      Godfall Golden is being released under the Hushed Forest Entertainment imprint, a pseudo-micropress I created to help give all of my books a uniform and professional look. The Internet has drastically changed the face of publishing, and I want to help prove that an ordinary person can produce a successful, market-grade product without needing the approval of the establishment or the 1%.

      If Godfall Golden sells well and helps me build a reasonably sized audience, you can expect to see more books (and other types of media) released under the Hushed Forest umbrella. Just as importantly, if I succeed, I want to help others who come after me succeed, too--I won't feel like I've done enough if I'm the only one who benefits. A donation to the Godfall Golden project will help build Hushed Forest's credibility and reach, so that when I feature other artists' work on Facebook or Twitter, I'll be able to do more to help them achieve their dreams. I may even want to go into production someday, i.e., publish a book for someone else I believe in. These are all doors I've left open, and Godfall Golden's performance will have a big impact on how and when I'll consider myself ready to walk through them.

      Like The Book But Can't Donate?

      Don't worry, you'll still have a chance to get Godfall Golden when it comes out in December. And if you want to help now, it's easy: just share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, or anywhere else you talk to your friends. Indiegogo has some great sharing tools built right in. I appreciate any amount of involvement.

      Thanks for looking, and I hope you'll enjoy the book!

story:
All About L.A.

Lyrical Alliance ("L.A.!!!!") has been the performance and poetry club on Rowan University's campus for the past five years. This year's College Unions Poetry Slam Invitational (CUPSI) team will be coached by Scott Sigl, recent RU graduate and member of the 2012 and 2013 Philadelphia Fuze Slam teams, and the 2014 Pigeon Poetry Slam team. Members of Lyrical Alliance will compete for a spot on the team in early December, and the five best poets will have the pleasure of road-tripping to and then competing in Richmond, Virginia!

Watch Scott compete at the Legendary Nuyorican Cafe: 


Where Your Donation Goes

Funds raised from this campaign will go towards registering the team, renting a hotel room in case we can't find someone to stay with (if you wouldn't mind six poets sleeping on your floor for a couple nights, please don't hesitate to contact us), gas to get to VA, and any extra money will be put into the club's funds for next year. 

What We Do

Lyrical Alliance is not only a performance space, but a safe space. As a club, we run weekly writing workshops on a variety of topics and host monthly open mics where we encourage new-comers and veterans to express themselves via poetry, music, comedy, whatever they want. This club is an open conversation on topics both dark and light, and we invite you to join us on our journey!

Can't Donate? That's Okay!

If you can't contribute monetarily, please share/promote this campaign on all your social media sites!!! We appreciate the support and look forward to representing New Jersey at the 2015 CUPSI.

story:
Here's the deal:

Rather than grovel before editors in New York City, who don't know a tortilla from a wrap, I'm looking for 100 donors, people who will chip in $10 now in exchange for a copy (print or digital) of the novel by June, 2017. Funds will help me cover the costs of having the novel proofread, designed, formatted, printed and shipped. 

Your donation is guaranteed: if I don't raise enough funds here, I'll find another way to make  Ragers a reality and get it to you.

A disclaimer: I like Ragers, and my agent likes it, and my brother and some of my friends like it, but it's not for everyone. Check out the first chapter on my website, www.ragersthenovel.com. Please don't donate if you'd rather not read a book that depicts teenagers cussing, having sex, and doing other teenage things. I'll sell you some other piece of writing someday.

story:
Hello horror fans! The time has come for the second edition to The Ultimate Guide To Slasher Films. Here is what this edition will be about:

The Book

After the success of his first book Slashed Dreams: The Ultimate Guide To Slasher Films, author Ronnie Angel returns with the follow-up: Slashed Dreams Part 2: The Nightmare Continues! Slashed Dreams Part 2 features even more of what made the first book so entertaining to horror fans around the globe, including:

 

-More Top Lists!

Over 40 New Movie Reviews including:

-newer films, such as The Final Girls, Lost After Dark, 31 and more

-forgotten obscurities of the genre, such as Slashdance, Blood Voyage and Blood Frenzy

-and a slew of pseudo-slasher films such as Cruising, Silent Rage, Identity and Hot Fuzz.

and

Over 50 new interviews with the stars and directors of some of your favorite slasher films! This is your all access pass to go behind the screams and hear the inside stories from those that worked on the films, including entertaining all new original interviews with:

 

-Linnea Quigley (Legendary scream queen- Silent Night, Deadly Night, etc.)

-Kane Hodder (Jason Voorhees on Friday the 13th Parts VII-X)

-Dean Cameron (Summer School, Rockula, Bad Dreams)

-Tommy Lee Wallace (Director of Halloween III, IT, Fright Night II)

-Adam Marcus (Director of Jason Goes To Hell)

-Nathan Baesel (Leslie Vernon on Behind The Mask)

-Jordan Ladd (Cabin Fever, Death Proof, Club Dread)

-Tom DeSimone (Director of Hell Night)

-Jack Sholder (Director of Alone in the Dark, A Nightmare on Elm Street 2)

-Kelli Maroney (Chopping Mall, Night of the Comet)

-Russell Todd (Friday the 13th Part 2, Chopping Mall)

-Robert Ray Shafer (the Psycho Cop films)

-From the classic summer camp slasher The Burning, cast members Larry Joshua, Shelley Bruce, Ned Eisenberg and Brian Matthews

-From Creepshow 2, cast members Tom Wright (“The Hitchhiker”), Daniel Beer (from “The Raft” segment), and Dan Kamin (“Ol' Chief Woodinhead”)

-From Friday The 13th Part V- cast members Deborah Voorhees, Tiffany Helm, Corey Parker and Bob DeSimone

-From the movie that started the slasher craze in 1978, Hallow​een- PJ Soles and Tony Moran

and many, many more!

 

Slashed Dreams Part 2: The Nightmare Continues makes a perfect companion to the first book, and is the definitive book for the behind the scenes scoop on your favorite slasher films!

About the author:

Author Ronnie Angel made his published debut in November of 2015 with Slashed Dreams: The Ultimate Guide to Slasher Films, a labor of love that took the author nearly three years of research to compile. The book has sold steadily and received generally positive reviews from the horror community since its release and the author has been hard at work on the follow-up. Prior to Slashed Dreams, Ronnie was a professional wrestler for a decade and a lifelong horror fan. Ronnie has been a fixture in the horror community for the past decade, known for various projects within the genre such as: his acclaimed reviews for the Best Horror Movies website (where he gained the nickname the "B Movie Expert"), articles for the website Watchplayread, appearances on the hit Youtube channel "The Horror Addicts" and several years spent as head announcer and expert panelist at the Seattle horror convention Crypticon. He is one of the foremost experts on slasher films in America.

 

The Perks (pictured at top, in photo gallery)

Oh yes, there will be perks! Thanks to a few of the wonderful interviewees from the book, we are excited to offer many truly amazing, rare and collectible items from your favorite slasher films, including:

- Signed copies of Behind The Mask on DVD (signed by the star, Nathan Baesel. 4 available)

- Signed copies of Jason Goes To Hell on DVD (signed by director Adam Marcus. 4 available)

- Rare, signed pictures from Adam Marcus, on the set of Jason Goes To Hell (2 available)

- Signed pictures from the Psycho Cop films, signed by Psycho Cop himself, Robert Ray Shafer! (3 designs available, 5 total)

- Posters from the 1981 slasher classic The Funhouse (signed by actor Miles Chapin, 4 available)

- Rare, signed posters from the film Chopping Mall (Under the original title Killbots, signed by star Kellie Maroney, 2 available)

- Rare, limited edition variable artwork posters from:

      -Friday The 13th Part V (signed by star Bob DeSimone)

      -The Burning (signed by star Shelley Bruce)

and 3 different rare artwork variable design posters for My Bloody Valentine, signed by actress Helene Udy! (6 available- 2 of each design)

 

We are also offering your choice of five different designs of T-shirts from some of your favorite slasher films, courtesy of Rotten Cotten! (Just let us know the size and let us take care of the rest)

(Please keep in mind that shipping may take a bit, as books have to reach the author in order to be signed before shipping)

 

Thank you in advance to everyone who contributes to the campaign and helps make this book a reality!

story:
Nu kan du som missade crowdfundingen av Skräckkokboken passa på att förhandsköpa ett exemplar medan boken är under produktion hos tryckeriet. Boken publiceras av skräckförlaget Swedish Zombie under 2021. Böckerna som säljs här kommer dock av logistiska skäl inte signeras av författaren.

Skräckkokboken innehåller trettioen filmkvällar. Läsaren får initierade och roliga introduktioner till genrer och teman, kurerade filmtips och inte minst recept på passande maträtter. Filmkvällarna, eller om man så vill kapitlen, innehåller en inledande text som presenterar kvällens tema och tre utvalda filmer. Utöver det bjuds på vad författaren kallar ”Inkörsportar”, andra klassiska filmer som passar det utvalda temat och dessutom får vi tips på lämplig matlagningsmusik och dryck för kvällen.

Recepten i Skräckkokboken passar både köttätare och veganer.

Skräckkokboken är en bläddervänlig och lyxig coffee table-bok med läckra fotografier i fyrfärg och stämningsfulla illustrationer. Boken är gjord för att underhålla både inbitna skräckfilms-aficionados såväl som de som vill ledsagas genom skräckfilmshistorien av en stabil ciceron. Alla får inspiration till lyckade filmkvällar med härlig skräck och god mat och dryck.

Skräckkokboken är designad av Jesper Holm och med illustrationer av Jimmy Stolpe. Fotografierna är tagna av Pär Arvidson, Staffan Arvidson Asami, Erika Nyman, Eric Gyllander och Tomas Arvidsson.

  • Trådbundet hårdband med måtten 195 x 245 mm
  • Omslag med uv-lack
  • 148 sidor
  • Genomgående fyrfärgstryck
  • Dubbelsidigt bestruket papper 200g/m2
  • Rött kapitäl- och märkband
  • Design och inlaga av Jesper Holm
  • Illustrationer av Jimmy Stolpe
  • Foto av Pär Arvidsson, Staffan Arvidsson Asami, Erika Nyman, Eric Gyllander och Tomas Arvidsson
  • Förord av Lars Willfors

Boken är gjord för att underhålla både inbitna skräckfilms-aficionados såväl som de som vill ledsagas genom skräckfilmshistorien av en stabil ciceron. Alla får inspiration till lyckade filmkvällar med härlig skräck och god mat och dryck.Skräckkokboken är designad av Jesper Holm och med illustrationer av Jimmy Stolpe. Fotografierna är tagna av Pär Arvidson, Staffan Arvidson Asami, Erika Nyman, Eric Gyllander och Tomas Arvidsson.
Trådbundet hårdband med måtten 195 x 245 mm
Omslag med uv-lack
148 sidor
Genomgående fyrfärgstryck
Dubbelsidigt bestruket papper 200g/m2
Rött kapitäl- och märkband
Design och inlaga av Jesper Holm
Illustrationer av Jimmy Stolpe
Foto av Pär Arvidsson, Staffan Arvidsson Asami, Erika Nyman, Eric Gyllander och Tomas Arvidsson
Förord av Lars Willfors

story:
Story of My Book

My Venus Flytrap Won’t Open. My book is about female sexual health and sexuality in the US, specifically focusing on demystifying some of the sexual health issues women face that often go unnoticed or untreated.

My name is Danielle and I am the author of My Venus Fly Trap Won’t Open. I wrote this book because I realized, from personal experiences and from talking with my friends, that there are people being left out of the sex positivity movement because their specific issues are often unacknowledged. This problem starts when we fail to prioritize female sexual health or play into inappropriate sexuality stereotypes, which bleeds into our sexual education system, representation in media, and even the doctor’s office. I wanted to call attention to these issues and the drastic consequences that arise when we ignore them.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will gain a broader understanding of positive sexuality and sexual health. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for female sexual empowerment in you. And, ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you continue these conversations, recognize these issues, and advocate for more comprehensive sexual education and representation. 

In this book, you'll learn about commonly misdiagnosed female sexual health issues and commonly misrepresented ideas about “normal” female sexuality:

  • Debunking the damaging “sex is supposed to be painful” trope - Vera’s story with vulvodynia and forcing herself to consent to painful sex
  • How physical disability can be emotionally damaging to one’s sense of sexuality - Trista McGovern’s journey of sexuality discovery and acceptance that landed her in Vogue magazine
  • Why trans health is overlooked - Morgan Givens’ story of dismissal and incompetence from doctors as a trans male with very specific health needs
You will love this book if you identify as a woman or are female assigned at birth and experience any of these issues, or if you are interested in progressing sexual equality, education and care.

My Venus Flytrap Won’t Open is a non-fiction book that speaks to women, educators, and parents who are looking at underrepresented female sexual health and sexuality topics for the first time.

 

The Book - My Venus Flytrap Won’t Open

The book is written in 3 Parts....

Part 1 contains the Introduction + 3 additional chapters. This section will introduce the concept of “sex positivity” and provide a brief history of sexual health education in the US. This background context will lead into an exploration of why and how female sexual health issues are consistently dismissed within the medical field. 

Part 2 contains Chapters 4-11. This section will examine how sexuality issues are often overlooked if they do not fit the “norm." From first-hand accounts, the reader will learn about vaginal and vulvar pain issues, premenstrual disorders, disability health, and trans health. Part 2 will conclude with Tasneem Raja’s story, a discussion on female genital mutilation practices and human rights violations against women and girls in the US.

Part 3 contains Chapters 12-14. The final section of the book will analyze the intersectionality of these issues and groups to highlight the additional barriers that layers of discrimination create in accessing health care. The final chapters will bring in the stories of Dr. Jen Chu and Dr. Jennifer Lincoln to emphasize the importance, and attainability, of doctors and medical systems that validate and are knowledgeable of women’s sexual health concerns. 
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2020.
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Winter.
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author


Danielle Dumais is a graduate of American University, where she was active on campus as a member of Leading Women of Tomorrow and co-founder of the AU Re-volv chapter, a nonprofit dedicated to community solar installations.

I wrote this book because I want these “taboo” conversations to be had. I want women and assigned female at birth individuals to be able to share their stories in a meaningful way that will hopefully reach others and help to destigmatize these issues. 

I am a proud Maine native, an activist, and an avid traveler.

For more information you can connect with Danielle at dd3903a@student.american.edu, and on Instagram and Twitter @danielledumais_author.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #myvenusflytrapwontopen and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Danielle Dumais

story:
A different kind of bilingual book.

The Magical Closet is a unique and entertaining illustrated book series to discover and teach a new language to children aged 4 to 8 years old (French for the moment) in the best and most natural way, through story.

 

When a little girl comes out of his closet, Arthur discovers his closet is magical. Problem is, she doesn't speak the same language! They become fast friends and arise many fun bilingual adventures.

The series will be composed of 15 tomes starting with the  first three tomes: 

The Faraway Friend. Tome 1 : Arthur and Aline meet for the first time and get to know each other but how is Aline going to go back home through the closet? [Learning Greetings and Introduction]

The Runaway Pet. Tome 2 : Aline's pet ran away through the closet. She lost her cochon Grongron. But what is a cochon? Together they search the neighboring farm to find the runaway pet and what a cochon is. [Learning the animals.]

The Family Meeting. Tome 3: Arthur's Granny goes through the closet. Arthur had no choice but to go after her. With Aline's help, they ask all the members of her family if they saw Granny. Will they find her before Arthur's mom comes home? [Learning Family and how to introduce someone.]

Other tomes in the series include learning about colours, clothes, the house, prepositions, objects, food, transports, seasons, months, the weather... Three tomes have a special theme, respectively Christmas (Père Noël Who? A Christmas Adventure), Halloween (A Halloween Nightmare) and Birthday (The Birthday Party). Through the books, the children will effortlessly learn the basics of a new language.

This book series is an enjoyable way to introduce children to a foreign language. After a few reads, the children will effortlessly be able to know some french basics, which will fill them with pride and encourage them to pursue further. The advantage of this series, is that the French can be replaced to learn any other language. Soon after the first tome is published a version to learn Spanish will also be available.

Each book is 8.5" x 8.5" (21.59 x 21.59 cm) paperback and in full color.

 

The concept for The Magical Closet was inspired by a  decade of experience travelling as a nanny and french teacher.  Experience that showed me how children were more responsive and engaged to learn through stories. This lead me to numerous books, studies and research on the subject that convinced me for good:

Story was the magical key to the infinite kingdom of learning.

The traditional bilingual book is most of the time picture dictionary or translations, which isn’t very attractive to children.  Through stories, they are engaged, they work to find the words’ meaning  while having fun along the way with the added bonus of learning. 

Storytelling is the original form of teaching. Learning with stories is the best, most  effective, natural and fun way to learn a new language. Children absorb  and learn the language without realizing it while enjoying a good  story. Stories not only create a sense of connection, they build  familiarity and trust, which make the reader and listener more open to  learning.

“People acquiring a second language have the best chance for success through reading.“ Stephen D. Krashen

Children, whom it is well known, enjoy listening to stories over and over again, learn faster, better and without any effort.

 

1. Dujmovic, M. (2006). Storytelling as a Method of EFL Teaching.  2.  Stephen D. Krashen (University of Southern California), expert in the  field of linguistics, specializing in theories of language acquisition  and development. 3. Vanessa Boris for Harvard Business Publishing Corporate Learning.

 

 

Published through Once Upon A Language as an independent publisher, the books will be print-on-demand and available internationally through all retails channel.

 

Your help will finance the illustrations and bring the first tome to life and support me in creating the following tomes in the series.

 

Risks & Challenges

I have set the release date for December 2021 to allow ample time for everything to be completed. This should help in case of setbacks and delays and should not affect the delivery of your book. I will do my best to get the book out to you as soon as possible.
