story:
UPDATE: While this campaign has closed, The Algerian Dream is still available for pre-order here via Ibn Ibn Battuta.

Story of My Book

The Algerian Dream is the story of an ambitious young generation pursuing their dreams against all odds—and reshaping their society in the process.

My name is Andrew G. Farrand, and I am the author of The Algerian Dream. For the last seven years, I had the privilege of living and working in Algeria and getting to know many young Algerians along the way. Algeria is North Africa’s sleeping giant: a vast yet isolated country that almost never makes international headlines. Few outsiders know or understand the complex dynamics driving recent events there—including the peaceful revolution that swept Algeria in 2019 and that remains unresolved today.

I wrote this book to share with the world the fascinating transformations I witnessed firsthand in Algeria, with a focus on the young people who are increasingly pressing for change from the bottom up.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover what makes Algeria the most mesmerizing yet perplexing, the most beguiling yet frustrating, and the most peculiar country on Earth, yet one that still holds universal lessons. In the book, you will learn about:

  • Why young Algerians yearn for genuine political voice, yet boycott every election
  • The slow collapse of public services, and my own encounters with Algeria’s medical system
  • How vast oil wealth has enriched officials and financed the world’s most expensive highway, but failed to trickle down
  • What I learned among the crowds of Algeria’s peaceful protest movement—and from the backlash it provoked
  • How young people grapple with historical legacies of valor and violence, torn between embracing or escaping them
  • Young Algerians’ profound sense of justice, and their dreams of dignified lives in their homeland
  • ...and much more!

Whether you know nothing about Algeria or are Algerian yourself, you will find much to love in this book. Curious minds and critical thinkers will enjoy diving deep into a fascinating context largely unknown to the outside world, and pondering the social, political, cultural, and economic forces that shape human societies.

The Algerian Dream is a non-fiction book combining rich analysis with poignant, outlandish, and sometimes humorous stories from my years in Algeria. Written for popular audiences rather than academic ones, The Algerian Dream invites readers to plunge into this unique country and emerge with new insights about the dynamics driving our modern world.

Inside the Book

The Algerian Dream weaves first-person stories, interviews, and analysis in a style already familiar to readers of my blog.

  • The book begins with a Prologue and Introduction to set the scene, explain how in the world I ended up in Algeria, and introduce Algeria’s ambitious young generations. It presents eight key pillars—from political voice to cultural expression, justice to economic opportunity—that young Algerians consider essential to a dignified life.
  • Part One (Chapters 1 through 8) examines these eight pillars in detail, exploring what exactly young Algerians expect—and where their society has or has not satisfied those expectations. It focuses on the critical interim period that followed the Arab Spring—and that built pressure for a very different sort of revolution.
  • Part Two (Chapters 9 through 12) dissects the peaceful protest movement that ignited in 2019, its causes and implications, the changes it wrought, and the counter-reactions it provoked. It examines the hirak protest movement’s evolution in the face of government repression, a global pandemic, and other shocks, and what it all means for Algeria's future.

What I Need & What You Get

I have launched this pre-sale campaign to offset the initial costs of publishing my book with New Degree Press. The funds raised will cover:

  • The Editor I am working with to revise my manuscript and publish in April 2021
  • The Cover Design of my book (The images you see now are just placeholders!)
  • The Layout Design for my book’s interior text and images
  • The Copy Editing for my book, in order to polish it to perfection
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts around my book’s publication this spring

Once I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will be able to publish. I hope you will help me reach that goal, so I am offering several packages with exclusive extras to those who pre-order my book now. Several add-ons are also available:

  • Print sets of my favorite award-winning film photographs from Algeria
  • A private Author Book Talk with me, at your convenience
  • Opportunities to attend a Virtual Book Launch Event, and to help me choose the book's final cover

About the Author

Andrew G. Farrand lives in the borderlands between different peoples and cultures, working to bridge those gaps and build shared understanding.

For the last seven years, Andrew pursued that mission in Algeria, where he managed youth development programs alongside his own creative projects. Over time, he became a well-known blogger, travel writer, translator, photographer, and media personality.

Andrew regularly shares his insights and passion for foreign cultures and societies on his blog, Ibn Ibn Battuta. He is the translator of Inside the Battle of Algiers (Just World Books, 2017) by Zohra Drif, a contributor to Uncommon Alger (Uncommon Books, 2016), and author of numerous articles on Algeria. After years of appearing in viral online videos and on Algerian TV, in 2020 he served as host of "Andi Hulm," Algeria’s first entrepreneurship reality TV show.

A native of Baltimore, Maryland (United States), Andrew is a graduate of Georgetown University and is proficient in French and Algerian Arabic, or darija. Along with his wife Nina and dogs Bourek and Chorba, he currently lives in Germany, where nobody seems to understand his darija.

For more information, visit ibnibnbattuta.com or contact Andrew at ibnibnbattuta@gmail.com.

Risks & Challenges

Once editing is complete and the book heads to the presses, the next task is to get your signed copies into your hands. I have built shipping costs into the campaign’s pricing structure to enable your copies to reach you in a timely fashion.

The exact shipping date will depend on my publisher. I will work closely with New Degree Press to ensure that your signed books reach you as early as possible. I will also update you on the progress of this campaign and my road toward publication more generally, so that you will know when your books are on the way.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you’re not in a position to contribute by purchasing the book, you can still help out!

  • Share this Pre-sale Campaign with your friends, family and network via Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, or LinkedIn. (Pro tip: Use #TheAlgerianDream and tag me and my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can spread the word further!)
  • Send a brief message to any friends, family, or colleagues who you know would love this book, to let them know about this Pre-Sale Campaign.

To everyone who supports this project, thank you so much!

With gratitude,
Andrew

Part Two (Chapters 9 through 12) dissects the peaceful protest movement that ignited in 2019, its causes and implications, the changes it wrought, and the counter-reactions it provoked. It examines the hirak protest movement’s evolution in the face of government repression, a global pandemic, and other shocks, and what it all means for Algeria's future.

What I Need & What You Get
I have launched this pre-sale campaign to offset the initial costs of publishing my book with New Degree Press. The funds raised will cover:

The Editor I am working with to revise my manuscript and publish in April 2021
The Cover Design of my book (The images you see now are just placeholders!)
The Layout Design for my book’s interior text and images
The Copy Editing for my book, in order to polish it to perfection
The Launch & Promotion Efforts around my book’s publication this spring

Once I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will be able to publish. I hope you will help me reach that goal, so I am offering several packages with exclusive extras to those who pre-order my book now. Several add-ons are also available:

Print sets of my favorite award-winning film photographs from Algeria
A private Author Book Talk with me, at your convenience
Opportunities to attend a Virtual Book Launch Event, and to help me choose the book's final cover



About the Author
Andrew G. Farrand lives in the borderlands between different peoples and cultures, working to bridge those gaps and build shared understanding.
For the last seven years, Andrew pursued that mission in Algeria, where he managed youth development programs alongside his own creative projects. Over time, he became a well-known blogger, travel writer, translator, photographer, and media personality.
Andrew regularly shares his insights and passion for foreign cultures and societies on his blog, Ibn Ibn Battuta. He is the translator of Inside the Battle of Algiers (Just World Books, 2017) by Zohra Drif, a contributor to Uncommon Alger (Uncommon Books, 2016), and author of numerous articles on Algeria. After years of appearing in viral online videos and on Algerian TV, in 2020 he served as host of "Andi Hulm," Algeria’s first entrepreneurship reality TV show.
A native of Baltimore, Maryland (United States), Andrew is a graduate of Georgetown University and is proficient in French and Algerian Arabic, or darija. Along with his wife Nina and dogs Bourek and Chorba, he currently lives in Germany, where nobody seems to understand his darija.
For more information, visit ibnibnbattuta.com or contact Andrew at ibnibnbattuta@gmail.com.

Risks & Challenges
Once editing is complete and the book heads to the presses, the next task is to get your signed copies into your hands. I have built shipping costs into the campaign’s pricing structure to enable your copies to reach you in a timely fashion.
The exact shipping date will depend on my publisher. I will work closely with New Degree Press to ensure that your signed books reach you as early as possible. I will also update you on the progress of this campaign and my road toward publication more generally, so that you will know when your books are on the way.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you’re not in a position to contribute by purchasing the book, you can still help out!


Share this Pre-sale Campaign with your friends, family and network via Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, or LinkedIn. (Pro tip: Use #TheAlgerianDream and tag me and my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can spread the word further!)

Send a brief message to any friends, family, or colleagues who you know would love this book, to let them know about this Pre-Sale Campaign.

To everyone who supports this project, thank you so much!
With gratitude,Andrew

story:
Story of My Book

It’s hard to find someone who doesn’t enjoy massive success and self-growth, and yet self-help books are often cheesy, repetitive, and downright ineffective. If you’re anything like me, you want to achieve enormous goals quickly without wading through pages and pages of crap. That’s why I wrote this book.

The Archimedes Lever: The Hidden Factors of Exponential Success is about how to achieve massive, “moonshot”-level success in record time, without the bull. By exploring the habits and tactics of Silicon Valley thought leaders to ancient Stoic philosophers, this book illuminates the key factors that will exponentially increase your output potential and elevate your achievements beyond anything you thought possible.

My name is Alyssa Mavor and I am the author of The Archimedes Lever. I wrote this book because, though I love self development, I grew tired of classic self-help genre tropes like, “The key to success is waking up at 5am,” and “Make your bed every morning to start your day feeling accomplished”. I knew there must be larger, drastically more important components to exponential success. In my book, I explore the bigger principles that can dramatically change your success trajectory, be it in your career or personal life.

In this book, you'll learn about everything from how to enter flow state to creating a personal knowledge management system. We'll explore:

 

  • How Elon Musk uses First Principles Thinking to tackle complex problems, like building a rocket
  • Adele’s secret tactic to conquering fear
  • How conscious serendipity created ancient Egyptian sourdough bread in the 21st century


In reading this book, you will discover the most important factors and strategies to achieve your personal moonshot. I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion I have for consistently leveling up my personal systems, habits, and behaviors. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you do the thing that your heart has always wanted you accomplish.

The Archimedes Lever: The Hidden Factors of Exponential Success is a nonfiction book that speaks to ambitious individuals and entrepreneurs with enormous dreams who want to stop wasting their time and get on the fast track to magnificent personal achievement. This book isn’t for the faint of heart, but it is for the ones who want to make their moonshot a reality.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editors I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April of 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & printing costs for my book when I ultimately publish this spring!

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. For more information on pricing, check out the FAQ.

Ever wanted to be a beta reader or get a sneak peek at cover designs? I am offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About The Author

Alyssa Mavor is an ambitious author and world traveler. After living nomadically and freelance writing for most of 2019, Alyssa joined a fast-growing startup tech company and immersed herself in the innovation-hungry culture of Silicon Valley entrepreneurs.

Steeped in the philosophies of both ancient and modern high-achievers, Alyssa aims to demystify success and make it accessible to anyone. She approaches complex topics with humor and humility and continues to value learning above all else.

Alyssa typically drinks 6 cups of green tea every day, as is evident in her writing. She’s not the best road trip buddy due to her enthusiasm for excessive hydration, but she makes up for it with a rockin music playlist for every situation.

For more information, you can connect with Alyssa at alyssa.mavor@gmail.com or at @alyssamavor on Twitter.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Understandably, some people just can't contribute. That's okay! Here is how they can still help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Feel free to use the hashtag #ArchimedesLever and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

It takes a village. Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Alyssa Mavor

story:
Story of Adaptable Success

Adaptable Success is a book about the focus on soft skills learned and developed from the arts creative process of acting, dance, music and intersecting with the business world adding value to the workforce development.

My name is Erik Waller and I am the author of Adaptable Success. I wrote this book because I am a trained actor and advocate of the performing arts which is where my passion lies. During the pandemic it was hard to find performance opportunities so I turned to writing as a creative outlet. As we transition into the virtual/digital revolution, I wanted to focus on hard/soft skills, especially the soft "power" skills that will be most transferable to the virtual world in terms of adapting to other careers successfully.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how artists make invaluable productive employees in the public, private, and philanthropic sectors generating good business values and principles. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for the soft skills developed by artists and folks with liberal arts degrees. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you realize that artists bring the soft skills essential to today's workforce and add value not only to the workforce but educationally and economically around the globe.

In this book, you'll learn about things like...

  • The soft skills essential for employees in the workforce development.
  • Educational and economical value of the arts.
  • Why STEAM and not just STEM should be a more concentrated focus in                                  America to for the education system.
  • Embedded creative arts experience with Robotics, Automation & Artificial                               Intelligence partnerships.

You will love this book if you are a thought leader and made professional and personal life transitions. The book speaks to aspiring performing artists, business leaders, educators of all levels, and professionals across most industries.

The Book - Adaptable Success

The book is written in 7 parts.

Part 1 contains the Introduction & Performing Artists Can be Valuable Employees.

Part 2 contains Educational Value of the Arts and Perspectives from Artists &                                                      Entrepreneurs.

Part 3 contains Liberal Arts (STEAM) vs STEM.

Part 4 contains Economical Value of the Arts: Arts and Business Intersect and                                                    Perspectives from Artists & Business Leaders

Part 5 contains My Vision and Arts for Social Change: Global Impact.

Part 6 contains How the Soft "Power" Skills Shape Organizational Behavior in the                                              Workplace.

Part 7 contains Conclusion and The Future of the Performing Arts intersecting with RAAI.                               (Robotics, Automation and Artificial Intelligence)

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book.   Any additional money available after my publishing costs are covered will go to the 60th Anniversary Peace Corps Library Museum.
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in May 2022.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!).
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring 2022.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

Campaign Goals

Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published

Tier 2: Hit $6,500 and the book will get a hardcover edition

Tier 3: Hit $8,500 and we’ll get an audiobook edition

About the Author

Erik Waller is a Program Delivery Manager for DHS/FEMA in Public Assistance.  Erik was inspired to write this book because he felt it was a good therapeutic outlet during the pandemic, and saw how the COVID Pandemic was affecting how we need to adapt and perform in our jobs and communicate with our colleagues, family and friends. He writes about his passion for the topic and emphasizes the importance of hard and soft skills as we transition to the virtual world for professional and personal delivery of our objectives and goals. He is a global citizen with experience in non-profit business development. Erik has a global and forward-thinking mindset with passions for the arts as well as international relations and development efforts.

For more information, you can connect with Erik Waller at erik.waller.pchn@gmail.com or via LinkedIn at www.linkedin.com/in/erik-waller and Facebook at www.facebook.com/erik.waller.100/

International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:

  • Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks.
  • Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page).
  • Please DM me at erik.waller.pchn@gmail.com and share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo.

The Impact

  • Your support help advocate the educational & economical value and creative process of the Arts and Arts-in-Education programs nationally and internationally!  

Risk & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!

I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

  1. At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit.
  2. Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.
  3. When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

Please use #softskills and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!

Tag: #softskills

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,

Erik Waller

story:
A Little Penguin's Guide to Life

 

 

UPDATE: We have decided to donate ALL proceeds to charities and causes voted on by our backers. The more we raise the more we can donate :-).

"How will we raise our child to be a happy and secure little human who is good to others...?" 

While eagerly awaiting the arrival of our first son Marcel four years ago, like so many parents, we were as excited as we were terrified!

One night we started to talk about the main lessons and guiding principles that our parents taught us, and that we wanted to now pass on to our son. We noted them down, and over the following weeks we turned them into a series of heartfelt poems to share with him from day one.

The more friends we shared this with, the more we realised that every parent or caregiver could benefit from the quick and punchy poems that trigger broader and more in depth conversations parents can run with!

Meet Marcel our inspiration.
 

‘A Little Penguin’s Guide to Life’ is a series of loving principles that are relevant throughout childhood (and beyond!), such as:

  • The importance of family
  • Feeling safe
  • Problem solving
  • Using intuition
  • Dealing with hurt feelings
  • Showing kindness to others
  • Working hard
  • Trying your best
  • Dreaming big!

Sneak Peak from the book...

Yes this is a children's book, but it's as much for you, the adult in their lives.

As parents, we use this book as a daily reminder to reflect on what is truly important in life. For our son Marcel it's sometimes simply a book with penguins in it, and sometimes it's an opportunity to discuss his feelings or a situation he experienced during the day.

The world is constantly trying to distract us from what's important in life. We hope that reading this book becomes part of your daily routine, a few dedicated minutes when you connect with yourself and the special people in your life.

 

PERK 1

A Little Penguin's Guide to Life - Ebook. Includes BONUS Parent's Guide to help guide discussions and to explore the concepts.

PERK 2

A Little Penguin's Guide to Life - Hardcover Book. Includes BONUS Parent's Guide to help guide discussions and to explore the concepts.

PERK 3 

Hardcover Book + Six Art Cards of the beautiful illustrations. (3.5inch x 7inch)

PERK 4

Hall of Fame - Get your child's name printed inside two copies (Hardcover) of a "A Little Penguin's Guide to Life". Plus 6 x Art Cards of the beautiful illustrations (3.5 x 7Inch).

PRE-ORDER YOUR COPY BY CLICKING THE 'PERKS' - Desktop (Right hand column). Mobile (Button below).

 

 

 

"Why did I write the book?" - A note from Chantelle

 

As it happens, the little penguin is me 

Growing up, mum was my hero. I felt privileged that she was my mother. How was it that one woman had such an endless well of love to give? How was it that she could she calm every emotion, sooth every ailment, and liven any dull moment? By modern standards she was a young mother, yet had wisdom beyond her years.  Her tiny stature belied her fearlessness when protecting her children, and as a result we felt safe in her arms.  

Years later after overcoming an arduous fertility battle, I lay on the bed one evening, swollen belly and loving husband beside me. We pondered about what kind of parents we would be? How would we guide our son and instil in him good morals and values? How would we make him feel forever secure in our love? It was then that it dawned on me that this had been done before. It was time for me to become at least half the woman that my mother is (if not fill her shoes!) I was soon to be the mother.  

While I initially thought that this project was about my first steps into motherhood, I soon realised it was about much more than that. The little penguin journeying through life is my child, but it's also me, and you, and anyone who was lucky enough to have a loving adult pass on life’s most meaningful lessons.  

Illustrator

We have been really lucky to find and work with the incredibly talented artist Nicolas Lonprez. Nicolas is a passionate traveller, and his recent visit to Iceland inspired many of the illustrations in 'A Little Penguin's Guide to Life' in particular, the amazing landscapes of crystal blue ice, volcanoes and the Aurora-Borealis. Nicolas is a strong believer in the power of love and harmony, and these values are showcased in his art.

Here Nicholas talks about working on ‘A Little Penguin's Guide to Life' and his connection to the story and passion for our project.

 

As two everyday parents, in our wildest dreams we never imagined that we could one day publish a children’s book for our son!

Our journey started on a scrap of paper, and over four years this project has evolved into something we've seen bring joy to our kids, our friends' kids, and now, hopefully yours too!

We need your help to bring this book to bedside tables around the world, and we hope you will be part of the dream we have for this book; to bring security and comfort to kids as they navigate their way in the world and through life. Ultimately, we want this book to serve as a nightly reminder for all to follow their dreams!

Our aim is to put the advice in the book to work in a practical sense, by showing others that despite knowing nothing about book publication, we dared to dream, worked hard, and persisted until we created something we believed was truly special and worth sharing with the world!

Hopefully this journey will inspire others to create, share and follow their passions.

Authors: Ali Terai & Chantelle Rabaut  

Illustrator: Nicolas Lonprez  

Editor: Madeline Ross  

Campaign Video: Leigh Young (River Card Films)

Digital: Daniel Pinne

Your support will help print the first 1000 copies; pay our editor, publisher, and illustrator and continue the dream of having A Little Penguin's Guide to Life on bedside tables all across the globe!

$5 from every book sale will be donated to a worthy cause supporting disadvantaged children and families.

Timeline

July 

  • Crowdfunding campaign kicks off!
  • Put finishing touches on the book so it's 100% print ready.

August 

  • Finalise parents guide.
  • Make order with book printer. 
  • Receive funds from Indiegogo.

September / October

  • Start shipping the book to our incredible supporters!

“This book has changed the way I connect with my child! It has become an essential part of our night-time routine and I look forward every night to seeing where the book will lead our conversation. I couldn't be more grateful to my friends for writing it!” - Danielle

"Reading this book every night before bed is the perfect way to remind ourselves and our kids of the most important lessons in life. We never tire of the illustrations, and the kids just adore the penguins!"  - Ana and Glen 

Risks & Challenges

Although this is our first time publishing a book, we’ve got a great network of experienced and talented people behind us. The book is now about 98% completed.

Our major priority is shipping a high quality book to our backers, so barring any unfortunate printing disasters we anticipate the book will be in your hands in October.

Stretch Goals

From the beginning, we wanted 'A Little Penguin's Guide to Life' to make a significant difference. If we successfully hit the funding goal, we will donate $5 (20% of proceeds) UPDATE ALL PROCEEDS from every book sold to a charity or cause that focusses on helping disadvantaged children and parents. We will update this page with the charities and causes as the campaign progresses. Also our backers will have the chance to nominate and vote for the causes we support.

story_txt:
A Little Penguin's Guide to Life 

 
UPDATE: We have decided to donate ALL proceeds to charities and causes voted on by our backers. The more we raise the more we can donate :-).
"How will we raise our child to be a happy and secure little human who is good to others...?" 
While eagerly awaiting the arrival of our first son Marcel four years ago, like so many parents, we were as excited as we were terrified!
One night we started to talk about the main lessons and guiding principles that our parents taught us, and that we wanted to now pass on to our son. We noted them down, and over the following weeks we turned them into a series of heartfelt poems to share with him from day one.
The more friends we shared this with, the more we realised that every parent or caregiver could benefit from the quick and punchy poems that trigger broader and more in depth conversations parents can run with!

Meet Marcel our inspiration.
 
‘A Little Penguin’s Guide to Life’ is a series of loving principles that are relevant throughout childhood (and beyond!), such as:

The importance of family
Feeling safe
Problem solving
Using intuition
Dealing with hurt feelings
Showing kindness to others
Working hard
Trying your best
Dreaming big!

Sneak Peak from the book...

Yes this is a children's book, but it's as much for you, the adult in their lives.
As parents, we use this book as a daily reminder to reflect on what is truly important in life. For our son Marcel it's sometimes simply a book with penguins in it, and sometimes it's an opportunity to discuss his feelings or a situation he experienced during the day.
The world is constantly trying to distract us from what's important in life. We hope that reading this book becomes part of your daily routine, a few dedicated minutes when you connect with yourself and the special people in your life.

story:
My Story...

My father died of a brain stem stroke in 2011... He didn't die instantly, instead he was trapped in a "locked in" state. A state where the brain and body are 100% functional, but the brain stem is damaged and no communication can go between the two. They are left with only the ability to blink when asked questions. No head movement, just blinking.

As a software developer, I spent the last week of his life developing a book that would allow him to write a letter to my mom, one letter at a time, one set of blinks at a time... He died the night I brought it to him to use, yet never woke to use it...

Since that point, I have created and tested the book and I am happy to report that it is ready for mass production.  Publishing!


What We Need

In order to take this to the next level, and that is a published book that will get into the hands of those in need faster... I need the seed money to start the publishing process.  I have already been accepted by a major publisher and money is the only thing stopping me from achieving my goal...  Regardless if I get the entire goal or not, all money will go towards that publishing process, not a penny less!!!


What is the Impact of your contribution?

Imagine having a stroke that left you in a state where you couldn't move or talk... Your mind is completely functional and your body is as healthy as it was before the stroke.  The only difference is the communication between your brain and body is damaged.  This condition is called a "Locked In" state, and it leaves the person with only the ability to blink their eyes...

Now imagine you gave them a tool that will give them the ability to speak their thoughts, by blinking...  It isn't a miracle, just a way that family can help them communicate whatever they wish to say...


    Other Ways You Can Help

    Please use the share tools that Indiegogo provides and let the world know we are trying to make a difference...  Even if only one person gets the help they need, it is still a victory!

story:
Why This is Important

We feel that in recent years there has been a tendency to subvert European cultural heritage with misrepresentations, negative spin, half-truths, and sometimes outright falsehoods. We're taking the telling of our own heritage into our own hands. We want to give our readers a quality publication that celebrates the beauty of our great heritage.

Our publication will cover all regions of Europe and the New World. And we will make great effort to appeal to our Christian, secular, as well as native European spiritual tradition. Our goal is to build bridges and unite people who are concerned about the future of Western nations.

What We Need & What You Get

We need funding to get this project off the ground. We're going to need software, website, design, and so forth. In addition, this project will divert time away from other income opportunities. So our team will need a financial cushion to get us out of the gate.

In exchange, we promise to deliver you high quality content that will be a fresh of breath air compared to the never ending mainstream attacks on our heritage.

The Impact

Your contribution is an investment into the counter-movement. Together, we are taking a stand for tradition, for a new direction, and reclaiming our roots. Your contribution well help launch an independent publication 100% dedicated to turning the tables on the negativity and toxicity being pushed in the mainstream media and in our academic institutions today.

The biggest hurdle we face is the funding to get us going.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to help at this time, but believe in your heart that standing up for our shared cultural heritage is the right thing to do, please share this far and wide and encourage others to contribute.

About the Editor

Carolyn Emerick has been writing about Northern European history, myth, and folklore for several years. She has a bachelor's degree in English Literature and has been a lifelong student of European history.  You may view her previous work at www.CarolynEmerick.com

It has become more and more apparent that the time has come to broaden her scope and do more to promote European and more broadly Western cultural heritage in a bigger way.

While her expertise has been in Northwestern European folklore, she is actively working to engage quality writers to cover other areas of European heritage to appeal to people of all European backgrounds.

story:
From the beginning...

My younger brother called me on an evening in January and asked me if I would like to go work as a taxi driver in Finland. At first I didn’t know what to say because I had never thought of myself as a taxi driver. I told him that I needed to think for a bit because I was already working in the construction business.

A couple weeks passed by. I contacted the owner and manager of the taxi company directly. I informed him that I had to turn down his proposal this time. I decided to stay in the construction business. The owner understood and took my announcement really calmly. He wished me good luck and told me that if I ever needed a job I could turn to him.

Another 6 months passed by. The project on my construction job had ended and I went on a holiday. I was also waiting for the next construction project. It was postponed several times. A couple of months had gone by. 

I was considering the proposal I had gotten from the taxi company. I got in touch with the owner again. The gentleman, who had been working in the taxi business for about 30 years, was glad I contacted him. He promised he would arrange a training program for me and later hire me to his company. I was happy to still have an opportunity to get a job in the taxi business. Furthermore, I was already imagining myself driving a nice and expensive car, carrying around polite Finns. I envisioned that the job would just be fun, that I would meet cheerful people and earn money easily.

But you can read what really happened in my book “The Diary of a Taxi Driver in Finland. Real Finns and Finnish Life Through the Eyes of a Taxi Driver”.


We are asking for your help with the fundraising to finish the publishing of the e-book. We're gathering money for a payment of salary for designer.

The volume of the book will be approximately 200 pages. It will include several photos and maps of Finland.

At the moment the author of the e-book is the only investor in the project. We are asking for 800 USD to finish the publishing of the book. After successful fundraising we will publish the book in March of 2015 and will sell it in Amazon, Apple, Barnes & Noble and Kobo.

The book will reveal the real life of Finland and the nature of finns through the eyes of a local taxi driver. The author shows that Finland is not only a country of calm rally and formula 1 drivers or where you can enjoy a hot sauna in beautiful nature. Actually, in this book you can discover different types of finns - from calm and funny to really furious ones. Also, the author describes the nightlife in Finland really vividly.

Along with the Finns there are appearances by singaporians, russians, estonians etc in this book.The stories in this book vary from really pleasant ones to unpleasant and dangerous.

The book will include several photos and maps from Finland. 

We will focus our marketing and sales activities to Russian, Swedish, German and British readers. These are the biggest tourist’s groups visiting Finland every year, accordingly 1,6 million, 0,53 million, 0,5 million and 0,45 million people. Finland was visited by 7,5 million people in total in 2013. The source: Visitfinland.com.

I need to emphazise there are no alternative book about Finland’s taxi drivers job or a book about finnish life through the taxi driver’s eyes. Thus, our book is kind of uniqe. And you, dear supporters, can be the part of this uniqe book!

We are grateful for every your donation, small or big, because the author of the book is the only investor at the moment. He has spent all his savings to write and publish the book ...

Many thanks in advance! I'm sure we can achieve our goal together with you.

Please, come visit our blog http://lifeinfinland.net and let us know, what you think about our book!

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I’m Joe Henderson. I’m an Arctic explorer, author, dog trainer and sled dog musher. My dogs have been featured in Walt Disney’s movie; “White Fang” and many documentaries including Animal Planet.  I've spent 30 years pursuing a passion of exploring the most remote regions of the Arctic with my dog team.  During which time I have pioneered and perfected a method of travel that is unprecedented in modern times, being the only person in written history to ever have traveled solo with a dog team in the Arctic for up to four months at a time without resupply. 

Most importantly, I have gained deep understanding and respect for the Arctic’s ecosystem and its wildlife. Today, I’m reaching out to the world to help fund my latest project, “Young Old Man and His Dog”, a fiction novel which highlights the Arctic’s brutal yet fragile environment and its wildlife and also to inspire others whom have passions and dreams to never give up! 

About The Book

Much of the book is symbolism which the readers can relate life's everyday circumstances with. The story is about a man who follows his passion in search of a mysterious calling to travel and explore the Arctic.  He faces many hardships including a strange people who hunt him relentlessly.  But with the assistance of the Arctic animals he succeeds in his endeavor and eventually discovers the answer to the agonizing mystery that has driven him to the far reaches of the Arctic. 

 In a recent writing contest my first chapter won "All Time Best" and "Recognized" awards.  Here's the first of many five star reviews I've received:  “I enjoyed your fable-like, parable-like quality. You hooked me with this story of a man's quest given that we are all on quests of one sort or another. Your closing lines resonated with me the most because I thought of the quests of my late parents. Even though they did not succeed in everything they wanted to achieve, they paved the way for me:  (excerpt from chapter 1) "Be of good cheer though, because of your sufferings and sacrifices there are others who follow your trail. You have broken the pathway and have given them inspiration and direction so they too will succeed in their quests. You have broken trail for a legion of others to follow. You have accomplished what you were born to do."  “This passage warms and inspires me that I am taking the right path. Thank you for sharing. I wish you success in the contest.

 Comment Written 11-Sep-2015  fanstory.com

What We Need & What You Get

Estimated costs:

Layout and Design-$1400

Illustrator-$800

Editor-$450

Use of excess funds  will be used for wider distribution and book signings.

  In exchange for your support, in addition to my eternal gratitude, you will receive one or more of many perks listed.

The Impact

I believe this story will be entertaining, interesting and an inspiration to all. In today’s world, where we live in a materialistic and peer pressure driven society, it’s refreshing to escape into a time of  when the important things in life were simple-such as living with nature.  That said, I believe there is much to learn from the rigors of living a self-sufficient lifestyle in the Arctic wilderness which draws strength from your soul. 

Risks & Challenges

  I understand the challenges of book publishing but I have successfully published two books: Malamute Man, Memoirs of an Arctic Traveler and Malamute Man, The Brute Force of Unified Souls.  With your help we will make it happen!  So please consider supporting the Young Old Man and His Dog. Thank you!!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please get the word out, tell your friends and family. We are excited about this book and look forward to seeing it in print soon!!  Like us on Facebook – Alaskan Arctic Expeditions and www.alaskanarcticexpeditions.com

Much of the book is symbolism which the readers can relate life's everyday circumstances with. The story is about a man who follows his passion in search of a mysterious
calling to travel and explore the Arctic. 
He faces many hardships including a strange people who hunt him
relentlessly.  But with the assistance of
the Arctic animals he succeeds in his endeavor and eventually discovers the
answer to the agonizing mystery that has driven him to the far reaches of the
Arctic.  





 In a recent writing contest my first chapter won "All Time
Best" and "Recognized" awards.  Here's the first of
many five star reviews I've received:  “I enjoyed your fable-like,
parable-like quality. You hooked me with this story of a man's quest given that
we are all on quests of one sort or another. Your closing lines resonated with
me the most because I thought of the quests of my late parents. Even though
they did not succeed in everything they wanted to achieve, they paved the way
for me:  (excerpt
from chapter 1) "Be of good cheer though, because of your sufferings
and sacrifices there are others who follow your trail. You have broken the
pathway and have given them inspiration and direction so they too will succeed
in their quests. You have broken trail for a legion of others to follow. You
have accomplished what you were born to do."  “This passage warms and
inspires me that I am taking the right path. Thank you for sharing. I wish you
success in the contest. 
 Comment Written 11-Sep-2015  fanstory.com

  What We Need & What You Get
Estimated costs:
Layout and Design-$1400
Illustrator-$800
Editor-$450
Use of excess funds  will be used for wider distribution and book signings.
 

In exchange for your support, in addition to my
eternal gratitude, you will receive one or more of many perks listed.

   The Impact 

I believe this story will be entertaining, interesting and an inspiration to
all. In today’s world, where we live in a materialistic and peer pressure driven
society, it’s refreshing to escape into a time of  when the important
things in life were simple-such as living with nature.  That said, I believe there is much to learn
from the rigors of living a self-sufficient lifestyle in the Arctic wilderness
which draws strength from your soul.  

Risks & Challenges  
I understand the challenges of book
publishing but I have successfully published two books: Malamute Man, Memoirs
of an Arctic Traveler and Malamute Man, The Brute Force of Unified Souls.  With your help we will make it happen!  So please consider supporting the Young Old Man and His Dog. Thank you!!
  Other Ways You Can Help 

Please get the word out, tell your
friends and family. We are excited about this book and look forward to seeing
it in print soon!!  Like us on Facebook –
Alaskan Arctic Expeditions and www.alaskanarcticexpeditions.com

story:
While this campaign is going on, Roland is finishing up his first book, a poetry volume inspired by our daughter's homebirth. Your support while the book is on it's way to being published, is going to further secure our basis of working from home.Many thanks to all who have helped so far! We appreciate it far more than anyone could know.


Our Story

Coming up soon on our tenth year of marriage and five and a half years on our organic farm in Southeastern Hungary, we have some experiences we are eager to share about the art of living life sustainedly. The biggest and most wonderful realization moment hit us when we were living on just USD 50.- a month, for the two of us, two dogs and a couple of goats to feed. For 8 months, including the winter season, this was coupled with the romance of living without electricity.

All of these overlapping experiences have culminated into a paradoxically stimulating frustration with the world as we know it. We have instigated each other for a long time now to put out our creative energies for the use of the larger society as well, by education and within that, by writing our book.

Our goal with all of this is to begin filling a hiatus on the educational literature market that gets down to the bone and marrow of the badly needed paradigm shift that in turn will allow for carrying out the new thoughts into practice. This book we are about to write is not going to list dozens of pages of literary references, neither will it be fragmented by quotations of other theorists, in fact it will contain none. We feel like this by itself will be an already refreshing feature of the book  – that is to dare think originally. By presenting a new paradigm we intend to deliberate on practical knowledge that is understandable by just about anyone, yet it digs deep into the multi-dimensional web of life’s interconnectedness. Readers will be rewarded by experience and intuition based practical advices, often outrageously novel.

In a series of essays, grouped around more defined topics, we will elaborate on our ideas of a sustained life – the ”sustainable” world taken further, turning it into something unconditioned and leaving behind the presumption that it might not work out. The issue at stake is not about pessimism or optimism, it is not about expecting the bad or the good, it is not about fearsome or wishful thinking: it is finally about living intransigently in harmony with nature.

Our topics will range from ”edible” clothing, zero waste households and businesses, minimum to no soil disturbance gardening, local food production, communal sharing of goods and services (such as skills and knowledge), creating new traditions that fit the locale and the participants’ needs, connecting family education with schooling of our children, rethinking and remaking their toys to foster wonder and creativity. We will also touch on the fact that we should not fear death, but rather embrace it as part of the continuity of life. One might say that any of these topics have been talked about and that is true. It will be the approach, the truly novel aspect of writing about them. For example, when we say edible clothing, we mean it: to not wear anything that you could not ingest without it being toxic to your body. By zero waste, we mean ZERO waste: in our world everything we produce can and should be compostable or recyclable without quality loss. Do not fall for the illusion that Christmas is about love and family, you know that it is about giving and receiving, in other words it is a season of gluttonous consumption. Can you refrain from the media induced buying frenzy?

We encourage everyone to question EVERYTHING!


What do you get?

In exchange for your support we would love to give back to you some goods that come from our organic farm and family heritage. The products we offer as rewards are all in line with our sustainability-based thinking and philosophy that will be put forth in our book. You will receive the perk corresponding to your contribution amount, but they are not cumulative. We are not offering the book as a reward because there are too many unknown variables in the publishing process, however what we CAN give is a SURE promise.


How will your money be used?

Since we have moved on the farm we have consciously made efforts and sacrifices to avoid having to leave the farm for employment, searching for eco-friendly ways to make a living. Despite the struggle we have found this a precious commitment worth keeping especially now, having a child who can enjoy the rare benefit of both parents being at home for her. We intend to use this money for the next few months’ living expenses – so we can focus on writing, cooking and of course taking care of our baby. Our expenses consist of food, including the organic baby foodstuff we feed to our daughter, utilities, bus transportation as well as room and board for extra WWOOF volunteers to take on "our” farm work while we are typing away.  Since we heat and cook with wood, part of the money will go towards purchasing our winter wood supply, about 10 cubic meters of black locust.

If we do not achieve our goal of raising the full sum, the book writing will still go on as planned, albeit at a slower rate.

In the case that we surpass our goal we are buying an organic dairy cow, ready to milk, so that we can make our own sour cream, sour milk, butter, cheese, cottage cheese, yogurt and kefir. This would also help us reduce our dependency on mass produced foods. It  would even provide an additional small income for our family, that we could sell these dairy products to our friends and acquaintances.

Other ways you can help:

Please share our story with as many people as possible, our connection to the world from our small farm is through you! Post it on FaceBook, Twitter and everywhere else appropriate!

If your interests are wool related we sell handspun yarn, handfelted items and raw fleece from the Hungarian Racka sheep in our Etsy shop www.fibrillaria.etsy.com

story:
The Poet

Seth Landman is a warm, loving, incredible person and an extremely talented poet. But you probably already know this. Here is his bio:

  • Seth Landman is the author of four chapbooks and the full-length poetry collection Sign You Were Mistaken (Factory Hollow Press, 2013). His work can be found in Boston Review, io, Jellyfish, Lit, Forklift, Ohio, and elsewhere. He received his PhD in Creative Writing and Literature from the University of Denver (2013) and an MFA from the University of Massachusetts (2008) where he is currently an Academic Advisor. 


  • People were moved to laughter and tears as he read from the collection at the book launch of Confidence at Flying Object in Massachusetts.


The Book

Confidence just received a rare starred review from Publishers Weekly. It is 136 pages long, which is unusual for a poetry book, but its breadth matches its depth. It is a methodical and melodious, powerful work that moves quickly, arriving in thin columns running down the page, a book that asks to be reread--each person at BAP has read it more than once, on average four times. The book was edited by Broc Rossell. It has three sections:

  • Telling You I Love You 

  • Confidence

  • Breakwater


The Deal

We want you to have this book. We know some of you will pay full price for it but we also know some of you might not have the funds to pay full price, or aren't familiar with Seth's work but are curious, so we've established different price tiers for the exact same book. Pay what you can for the book, because again, we really want you to have it. We think Confidence is so good that you're going to tell your friends about it.

After this campaign, the book will be on sale on the Brooklyn Arts Press website for $18.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you're a fan of Seth or the book, help us spread the news:

  • Link to the book on your social networks
  • Ask local book stores to stock the book
  • Ask your local or university library to stock the book
  • Teach the book--contact us at info@brooklynartspress.com and we can help set that up for you.

Thanks everyone!

Cheers, 

Joe Pan, BAP

story:
Camp Chemo: A Memoir of Life with Metastatic Breast Cancer

Update - Met with my book designer and we're making progress on creating an image for the cover, the layout for the pages and size of the book.  It's so exciting, Thank you for your help!  As for editing, the book is sitting at about 600 pages, which is way too long.  I'm in the process of cutting approximately 40,000 words to make it a 400 page book.  Still loads of work to do, but happy to have you along for the ride!

This book is based on my blog chronicling  7 years of life with breast cancer.   It includes my experience raising small children, working and mortality.  

This campaign funds a self published book.  Already, I've received 2/3 of the funding I need and am seeking the final $5,000 to complete it.  

The book has already been written and pre-edited.  It's in final edit at this time.  This campaign will fund the proofread and book design which will make the book reality.  

Your contribution will help bring this book to the audience that hungers for a story about an ordinary person living with a difficult disease.  

The first 500 books printed will be donated to clinic libraries, public libraries and  individuals living with breast cancer.  

This book is unique because rather than being a retrospective telling of surviving cancer, it's a real time account of how I faced the disease.  Another unique factor is that it includes the cancer coming back or metastasizing and years of living with advanced or Stage IV breast cancer.  

The readers of my blog have encouraged me for years to make my story more available and I invite you to be a part of this process.

story:
Music in the Pitch Video is 
by Band Of Mellow

Summary

Crew

Hi, we are Riot Digital Magazine. There’s me, Effendi and my crew: 

Leo, Kate, Nancy, Nick and Ann. 

We are all students at different universities and we do different things, yet we somehow found each other and have fun together.

Objectives

We, both, personally and as a Riot crew, are against social injustice, inequality, exclusion and anything that violates fundamental human rights and freedoms. And that includes vast array of things from censorship and intolerance to totalitarian regimes and pointless wars. Our principle objective is returning the freedom that is being constantly taken away from us.

What We Do

I came up with the idea of a digital magazine a few months ago, and we have been contemplating since then, planning different strategies, thinking of the specifics of our work, assigning future roles, etc.

Why We Do

Have you ever thought, that among the astronomical amount of different news sources, magazines and newspapers, there are too few of those, who try to look beyond the boundaries set by mainstream, totally ignoring outside world with all its greatness and refusing to dig deeper?

We do think about that a lot and that’s why we want to act.


Challenges

Public Awareness

It’s natural, that a lot of us, who were lucky enough not to be tackled by these problems, don’t pay much attention to them and their victims, or we do very little to help them deal with what situation they find themselves in. Its basic human nature to overlook something that doesn’t bother him and be lazy to leave his comfort zone.

Neglect

For this reason, we want to work hard in order to raise public awareness and try to help people to care more about such things, look into them and join us in speaking out against them. We’re ones calling you all to action and we hope that we are heard.


What We Need

Your Help

Now, keep in mind everything you’ve read so far and then think about yourself being one of the biggest contributors to this work. Without your help, we have no chance of starting the Riot.

Where The Money Goes

Basically, this is the reason why we’re addressing to you here, on IndieGoGo. We don’t have enough resources to start all this independently. Whatever great goal you have, there are always realistic expenses behind it, and this is where you encounter the first obstacle.

We need quite the supplies for making Riot happen. This includes office tools and inventory, IT services and so and so forth. Of course, we could fit into strictly minimalistic finances and make some average web-magazine that would reach the audience of no more than 10 000 people, but that’s not how things are going to change. We need our work to be profitable enough so that others can benefit from it.

How Much We Need

To get the Riot started, we need $7800 (but $15000 would be much better, haha). This budget will include everything we need for a startup, both one-time and first month expenses. 
You may have concluded this already, but we still emphasize – our project is semi-commercial, in other words, it isn’t specifically oriented on profit. To be honest, we care about income as long as it lets us keep on with our vision.


What You Get

How It Works

In our magazine, we will address the problems listed in the beginning on monthly basis, sharing the writer’s personal opinion on important events and topics with its readers. The magazine will be accessible for its subscribers (and to the contributors, of course, take a quick look at the perks!) Subscription fee will be more than generous and anyone, willing to read the magazine will be able to afford it. The magazine will consist of three blocks that will contain several columns. The content will vary from satirical social comics to editor’s column. Promoting the underground art will also be significant part of our work.

What Else

Part of the income, generated by the subscriptions, will be used to further expand the operation and provide high quality content for our subscribers and another part will go to charity. This way, we’ll keep our word and share our achievement with those, who really need it.

You Can Help Us Without Funds

Now, of course you’ll make or days and weeks, if you give us a little help with some cash, but what’s needed more is spreading the word. Even if you can’t afford helping us financially, just telling a few friends about us and our goal would be a great contribution. Once we (hopefully) start the riot in a few months’ time, a fair amount of people following our progress is crucial. We will be glad for every single one of you, who will be following our twitter and facebook pages, waiting for our first issue, this is what we expect from you even more than financial support.

We hope that we got your curiosity, we even hope that we will get the attention of some of you. With that, we’ll surely be able to overcome the challenges that await us at the first stages of our work. Then things will get more sophisticated, but there will be much more motivation provided by everyone, who will be standing by our side and waiting to hear from us every month.

story:
"Going Public"

This book is about my personal journey in the venture capital business and how I used venture capital to take my company public. Most businesses fail in the first five years and most of the time due to a lack of capital. What if there was a way to get the amount of capital you need for your business? Would that be of interest to you or a business owner you know? Then get this book for yourself or a friend.

Why Should You Buy This Book?

One day I was speaking to an attorney friend of mine and he asked me "How did you take your company public"? I looked at him and said "You're the attorney, why are you asking me"? He then said to me "How would I know about your business, did you write a book? Have you taught a class or a seminar? It really got me to think about writing a book on this subject.

We Can Make an Impact!

As I go around the country and talk to business owners, I hear the same stories over and over. They just don't have the capital to keep their business running.

  • Our Goal is the help as many business owner as possible.
  • I took a marketing plan and turned it into a public traded company.

"Going Public"This book is about my personal journey in the venture capital business and how I used venture capital to take my company public. Most businesses fail in the first five years and most of the time due to a lack of capital. What if there was a way to get the amount of capital you need for your business? Would that be of interest to you or a business owner you know? Then get this book for yourself or a friend.Why Should You Buy This Book?
One day I was speaking to an attorney friend of mine and he asked me "How did you take your company public"? I looked at him and said "You're the attorney, why are you asking me"? He then said to me "How would I know about your business, did you write a book? Have you taught a class or a seminar? It really got me to think about writing a book on this subject.We Can Make an Impact!As I go around the country and talk to business owners, I hear the same stories over and over. They just don't have the capital to keep their business running.
Our Goal is the help as many business owner as possible.

I took a marketing plan and turned it into a public traded company.

story:
Our Story

Hello, my name is Emma Dewhurst and I am an actress, independent publisher and mother. I'm also the person putting this campaign before you today.

Five years ago, I found myself alone again with my beloved daughter, bright with grief and needing to make a change. For myself, for my community, for my world.

I decided to make a beautiful print magazine called WOW, to share my personal love of the arts with the community in which I live.

WOW is an award-winning arts guide to the best of What's On Where, with stunning visuals, high quality articles and regular listings in Film, Music, Theatre and Visual Art. It is much-loved and highly valued by its community of readers, who now number more than 10,000 per monthly issue. 

Here's the e-version of the current magazine: WOW November 2015

And here are some of our 2015 covers, for which we are (ahem) famed:

And here's a video telling you some more about WOW's story, made by Mathilde Guenegan, a post-graduate Journalism student at the University of Kent:


So I’m great on ideas, but I wasn’t great on business, and the past five years have been a very steep learning curve! My love for this creation of mine - and the community's overwhelmingly positive reception for it - meant that I chose frequently to subsidise the making of it from my own pocket. 

And when WOW's designer Paul Baker (A Stonesthrow Design) also became my business partner in 2012, he too began to take the hit on those months when we could not afford to pay ourselves.

Neither of us can afford to do this any more, and although we are at a crisis point, the magazine is more loved, known and used than ever before, and we are seeing this crossroads as an opportunity to change!

To date, our income has come from advertising sales, but because I am more or less the entire sales and editorial team, I have not been able to improve this area as we so easily could with more resources. 

With this campaign we are making a big, bold move to take our business model by the hand and transform it into something more sustainable, where the advertising sales will be buoyed up by reader subscriptions.

If you decide to join our crowd, you will be making a fantastic stand for the arts, for community and for print - sharing with us the belief that we can all, each of us, do small things to connect, make our communities meet and the world a brighter place.

Please take a moment to read about our mission, vision and beliefs. Our funny campaign video is almost ready, so visit again in a day or two!

  Our Mission

  • To make an informative, clear and visually stunning print magazine featuring the best of What’s On Where, available to all.
  • To give everyone involved in the arts and culture in Medway, Maidstone and wider Kent a platform from which to shout, thus involving, engaging and developing audiences for all.
  • To be part of the regeneration of Medway and wider Kent by making the area’s cultural offer more visible.

  Our Vision

  • To be the premier, go-to source of information about arts and culture in Medway, Maidstone and wider Kent.
  • To back up the information provided by our independent magazine with further arts listings on our website, wowkent.co.uk, thus covering the whole of Kent.
  • To use this campaign as an opportunity to further engage and talk with our readers, so that we are well and truly providing a service which the community wants and needs.  

  Our Beliefs

  • We believe in the power of the arts to reflect and transform our lives;  provide a valuable source of economic growth and increase the well-being of our communities.
  • We believe in the value of communication, and that a connected community is a happier one.
  • We believe that print will always survive, in addition to the digital world, as long as it is original, beautiful and life-enhancing: WOW magazine is our contribution to that thought.

  Our Awards

  • Winner, Media Category, Medway Culture & Design Awards 2012
  • Winner, Best Creative Business, Kent Independent Traders Awards (KITA) 2012
  • Kent Magazine Design of the Year + Highly Commended for Kent Magazine of the Year (Kent Press & Broadcast Awards 2015)
  • In 2012 Emma Dewhurst was recognised as a 'Community Catalyst' by Ideas Test, a grant-awarding body, by whom she was subsequently awarded a grant of £5000 to develop a new arts site for Kent, wowkent.co.uk
  • WOW was also awarded one of 100 free places on the School for Creative Start-ups Kent course in 2013.

 Our Resources

  • An amazing team, both paid and volunteer, who have been doing the job for five years.
  • A proven set of skills. We have to date produced 53 quality print magazines
  • An engaged and committed readership.
  • A loyal group of regular advertisers.
  • The ability to give our readers, advertisers and supporters a sense of ownership, with an invitation to share the journey and contribute to WOW’s future path.

      Our Target and Your Perks

    The money raised by the campaign is intended to provide WOW with a baseline cashflow over the course of 2016, which will be in addition to the income from sales of advertising space. We want to use the year to expand and grow, including employing a part-time media sales person to free Emma up to make the magazine content even better. Also we want to work towards a point where we can pay our contributors for their writing/images.

    This is a breakdown in percentages of what we estimate the monies will go towards:

    42.5% - To ensure Emma (75% business partner) can pay herself a living wage and Paul Baker (25% business partner) is also paid every month of the year.

    22% - WOW Subscriber postage and packing (one year)

    16.5% - Contingency to cover rise in print costs and overheads

    12% - Deficit from producing WOW magazine in 2015

    7% - Campaign fees and Perk fulfilment

    Perks: Take a look at the sidebar to see the fantastic number of Perks available to contributors to the campaign!

    Here's a look at the glorious 'Story of WOW' by comic illustrator Mark Barnes.

    New Perks will be added to the list as the campaign unfolds over its 30 days, so make sure you look out for our updates.

      The Impact of your Contribution…

    … will be vast! The great thing about the success of this campaign is that WOW will remain in the community for all. As well as the print copies sent to WOW subscribers each month, we will still be able to print pick-up copies for those who are unable to subscribe.

       Some of the many people/organisations WOW champions: 

    • Artists (local and regional); small artisan makers; craftspeople
    • Art groups; reading groups; dance groups; film societies
    • Teachers/tutors/adult ed/arts workshop leaders
    • Arts organisations (local and regional); museums; art galleries; co-working spaces; art galleries; theatres; independent cinemas.
    • Musicians; bands; orchestras; church groups;
    • Vintage markets; art markets; record fairs; flea markets

      Some of the top quality arts organisations with whom we work:

    The Historic Dockyard, Chatham

    Royal Engineers Museum, Gilingham

    Guildhall Museum, Rochester

    Maidstone Museum & Bentlif Art Gallery

    Nucleus Arts

    The Beaney, Canterbury

    Canterbury Festival

      What other people say about the value of WOW:

    “[WOW]… has been key in supporting the growth of arts in the area and does so with love and passion on very small margins…” Jane Pitt, multi-disciplinary artist

    [WOW has] been a must-read publication in our house since it was first available and pretty much governs how our free time is spent. Malcolm Wright, designer

      Our Risks and Challenges

    This is a ‘Fixed Funding’ campaign, which means that if we do not reach our target, your money will be refunded to you and we will not be able to go ahead with printing WOW in 2016. 

    Another risk is that not enough people will renew their subscription at the end of 2016. But we are confident that anyone who receives WOW through their letterbox for one year will want to continue doing so! And if successful we will continue to run a subscription drive during 2016.

    Lastly, because the price of print can fluctuate, we have built into our figures a monthly ‘buffer’, in case there is a sudden rise, so that we can guarantee we can print the magazine all year.

      Everyone can help by sharing the campaign! Thank you x

story:
Apple Blossom (pen name) aka Amanda Phillips is the mother of two children with Autism. She also falls within the Autism spectrum herself.

A description:

I HATE SOCKS! - is written from a child's point of view. It addresses many common traits that come as a part of the Aspergers/Autism spectrum.

Read this book together with your child to bring understanding into both of your worlds, no matter how diverse they may appear.

Remember…with humour, calmness, and structure, children with this disability can live happy and fulfilled lives. It just takes patience, time, praise, and a lot of love. Lots of LOVE!

The impact would be enormous.  For as I reach my goal of $1,000 I can self publish this book and get it out to a wide audience, not only in my home country of Australia, but also around the world. 

The money would be used 100% to buy a self publishing package, with any remanding money being utilised to help market this book.

I do not wish to be rich.  For I am already rich in my heart being blessed with two beautiful kids with Autism.  

 

My wish is to spread the word to the world about what Autism really is.  The fights and battles as a mother I have had to deal with and the common traits and quirks which come with this disability.  

I simply want to bring awareness to an otherwise closed world!

Facebook: Aspergers Autism Support

Facebook: Apple Blossom (Amanda Phillips)

Facebook: Psychic and Medium World of Apple Blossom

Website: http://www.appleblossomauthor.com 

With rainbow bliss,

Apple Blossom
