story:
On The Rails 

To explore and uncover the stories of founders, founders who are carving their own path embodying a pioneering spirit synonymous with opportunity and the American West. 

One millennial's journey by train from Los Angeles to Detroit, uncovering and sharing 5 inspiring founder's stories from 5 American cities along the route of The Millennial Trains Project 2016 UNITY trip. 

UNITY: August 10-18 // Los Angeles → San Francisco → Denver → Milwaukee → Detroit

In order for the On The Rails project to come to fruition, I must raise $5,000 by June 15 in order to secure my spot on the UNITY trip and journey across the US with 30 other like-minded millennials. 

Overview

The pioneering spirit of America is experiencing a resurgence, taking hold with current-day founders and entrepreneurs. These founders are united in their gumption, their readiness to question the status quo and a willingness to embrace and pursue the, “why not?.” Therein they are creating a marketplace for the doers and the makers. The people behind these companies ground themselves in the morals and the beliefs of community, innovation, strength of pure courage and unfiltered passion.

Their journey will be the focus of On The Rails, a 6-episode feature. 

Plan 

On The Rails will find 5 inspirational small business founders (1 from each city stop + 1 end-cap episode) who are imagining, creating and building meaningful work and lives. These founders are imagining, creating and building meaningful work and inspiring others to do the same. 

Once the journey begins, at each stop, On The Rails will meet with that founder/leader and learn about their story.

Outcome

On The Rails will create a 6-episode feature, to be released weekly following the end of the trip. The first 5 episodes will focus on 1 founder and the 6th and final episode will be the dedicated end-cap, completing the 6-episode feature.

Each episode will include a podcast of the interview held and a written blog post including one or more of the following; photos, videos and/or designed element. This will create a multi-dimensional story-sharing platform where audiences can experience inspirational stories through the eyes and ears of The Millennial Trains Project.

About

Ally Seeley
A Marylander by birth, but an outdoor junkie at heart, I came out to Denver, CO by way of attending the University of Denver. After graduating with a degree in Electronic Media Arts and Design, I found myself as a Graphic Designer and later to being a part of the Something Independent team. With Something Independent, I’ve had the unique opportunity of working within the Colorado entrepreneurial community and have truly found my passion within its people and spirit.

THE MILLENNIAL TRAINS PROJECT
THE MILLENNIAL TRAINS PROJECT (MTP) is an award-winning 501(c)3 non-profit organization that leads transcontinental train journeys for young innovators to explore America’s new frontiers. This an officially-approved campaign for one of MTP's August 2016 journeys. 

Needs

On The Rails hopes to raise $5,000, in order to be a part of the August journey. 

Contributions toward successful applicant campaigns go directly to MTP to help underwrite expenses associated with the journey (on-train accommodation, meals, and all MTP-related programming activities) and are tax-deductible.

If my campaign is among the first 30 to reach its $5,000 goal, all funds raised will go to MTP, which is a 501(c)3 organization. As such, they will be tax-deductible. These funds help to underwrite the costs of the journey and its associated programming, transportation, and hospitality costs. If I am not among the first 30 applicants to reach their crowdfunding goal, none of my supporters will be charged.

Follow

This is an exciting time, follow the journey from start to end and see what it's like for On The Rails!
Instagram - www.instagram.com/allyseeley
Facebook - www.facebook.com/SomethingIndependent
Share
Feel free to share my page to your networks! 

https://igg.me/at/ontherails

story:
About the Book

Hi:))  I am Isha Sacheti, a 14 year old student and also the writer and illustrator of “Lily’s wish.” The main character of this story is Lily who is just a seven-year-old girl. Join her on her exclusively solo adventure! Learn about how she manages to find strength in herself and comes to realize that her difference is what makes her perfect.

Basically, the thought of creating a picture came to me when I saw young children not being able to express themselves, just because they could not counter or understand their fears. I have realised that children learn in an environment which they find friendly and conducive. I have tried to showcase Lily’s story as an inspiration for young children, using illustrations and language they find relatable to. Lily is a character which is like every young child. She has aspirations and curiosity like all young children. Her family, her environment and her quest is like every young child’s. 

I wish to take my passion of drawing and communicating to a level where I can publish more stories that relate to children’s quests. I wish to make games and tools that children find comfortable and simple. 

PURPOSE

Lily's wish is about facing your own fears and overcoming them, a story about confidence and hope despite differences.... It's a story about finding out who you are.

Since this is my first book, I need your help to make this book a reality! It would be wonderful for me to watch this project blossom into a success. I really want to get this book out, and I want you to feel happy with the perks I can give you :)

 

THE BOOK

The book has a hard cover and the dimensions are 11.5 by 8 inches. It consists of 32 pages with illustrations and text that will draw the reader into this story.

 

The Funding I Need

With your contributions we will be able to get the book published and into the world! Every contribution will help us reach our goal! I need your help to print the hardcover copies of the book, get the rewards made, publish the book and spread the word about the book. Our goal is to raise $2,597 for this project. We have some great perks planned for donors!

 

REWARDS

Each perk offers you different rewards. I hope you like them!

  • These are the bookmarks based on Lily's character.

  • Receive a very creative 2017 mini-calendar which is extremely handy.

  • A jigsaw puzzle featuring Lily

 

Risks & Challenges

I will be making sure that the printing comes out flawless, and that no mistakes are made. I'll instantly send an alternative copy if yours reaches damaged.

Ultimately, I’ll try to keep you all pleased with the book and the perks which will be sent to you maximum, by December 2016!

 

I NEED HELP!

Please donate whatever you can. Every dollar helps!

If you can't donate, please help us by spreading the word on social media platforms. I need your  support to help make my dream of becoming an author and publishing this book come true – so tell your friends, family, neighbors, educators, co-workers, librarians, and everyone about this book!

I decided to launch this book on indiegogo because I want to have a chance to connect with our audience, that's you! So thank you so much...

story:
Pre-Order:

The novel will be wide released on February 3rd, 2017. This campaign gives you the opportunity to receive an autographed copy of the book in either hardcover or paperback!

Synopsis:

In the rural town of Acadian Springs, Lousiana, Ashton Freely finally thought he could get some peace and quiet from the chaos he had caused for himself. With his partner by his side and the newly purchased plantation home, he believed solace would be found within the walls, but small towns have different values than the eccentric streets of New Orleans. As hypocrisy begins to run rampant and harassment becomes a part of life, Ashton's inner demons began to manifest into something much larger. To many, ignorance is bliss but as history tends to show, ignorance can leave the world a dark and deviant place.

COMING FEBRUARY 3RD, 2017

story:
Short Summary

My name is Julian Zehr and I am the author of On Social Media. I wrote this book to take readers on a personal journey through some of social media's concerning questions.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover what social media is like through the eyes of an early Generation Z guy. In this book, I hope to convey a little about the social media atmosphere and clear up technical misunderstandings. Ultimately, I want this book to raise other questions besides the ones that are answered in it.

This book is a long informal interview, about social media, where I go through different questions and my particular answers to them.

You will love this book if you have questions about social media, want a writer’s perspective on it, or just want to read some short commentary about it.

On Social Media is a nonfiction book that speaks to anyone who wants to look at social media and the internet in a different way.
 

The Book - On Social Media


The book is written in 2 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-4. Readers will learn about a few chosen Internet slang terms, the block button and how it works across different platforms, actions that aren’t recommended, and the delete button and how it works across different platforms.

Part 2 contains chapters 5-9. In the second part of this book, readers will go through extensive commentary on Snapchat, Instagram, OnlyFans, Discord, and TikTok.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Fall of 2021.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!
 

About the Author

Julian Zehr is a writer, social commentator, and technology enthusiast. He has worked as a part-time screenwriter where he helped incorporate future technologies into heartfelt stories. Julian has helped create tales we can all relate to - of getting lost, growing up, or being found. Above all, Julian is a storyteller.

He has written extensively about social media, and this book is a detailed compilation of his expertise. In these pages, readers will experience an informal written interview that covers social media and its experiences as it pertains to the author.

Julian likes long bike rides, calisthenics, movies, and texting strangers. He has no pets, and prefers it that way. His friends used to call him the ‘Energizer Bunny' because he never seems to run out of energy. In the summer, he likes to work outdoors as a lifeguard.

For more information, you can connect with Julian Zehr at julianzehr@protonmail.com and at www.julianzehr.com.

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #OnSocialMedia and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Julian Zehr

story:
Story of My Book

Fitness without Fear debunks many of the myths and haphazard approaches that are circling around exercise and health. Our bodies evolved to need exercise, but not the no pain, no gain variety. Proper movement, the foundation of all exercises, is a learned skill, similar to reading or playing an instrument.

My name is Sara Fleming and I am the author of Fitness without Fear: A Practical, Gentle Guide to Improving Your Life Through Good Movement. I wrote this book because throughout my practice in working with high level athletes and average folks from all walks of life, I have learned that the fitness industry’s approach to exercise seems to mainly target the already fit. For the other 60-80 percent of the population, an approach that prioritizes learning skills and good movements that are ideal for the individual is what actually works best. Unfortunately, the dominant, no pain, no gain attitude and approach to fitness, while fun for some, is more often intimidating to others. It is also the source of many preventable training injuries that occur.

In reading this book, my hope is that you will learn how to assess what you need, and what you don’t need, in your exercise program as you build the basic skills key to a healthy and functional life. Fitness is not an either or prospect, and there are many ways to build it into your life over time. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to learn how to turn your body into the most functional version of itself that suits your lifestyle and enables you to have a long and healthy life without limitations.

Fitness without Fear was written for those who have felt intimidated, disenfranchised, or turned off by the commercial fitness industry. In this book, you will learn what really drives positive physical changes, and how to design your own fit lifestyle.

Ultimately, I hope that Fitness without Fear inspires a transformation in how you view the role fitness should play in your life. In this book you will learn:

  • No pain, no gain is a dangerous lie.
  • Movement in general is medicine for our bodies and minds.
  • Simple strength training is the key to overcoming pain and immobility and is the foundation of athletic ability regardless of age.

 

If you want to learn how to practically incorporate effective fitness into your schedule for a healthy and sustainable lifestyle, then this book is for you.

I look forward to pulling back the curtain on fitness and empowering my readers to make big impacts on their health through small but powerful changes in their lives.
 

The Book - Fitness Without Fear

This book is written in 4 parts.

Part 1 contains the Introduction as well as Chapter 1: Where do we begin?, Chapter 2: No Pain, No Gain?, and Chapter 3: How to Train Like a Scientist. In this section, I explain the evolutionary and physiological basis of how exercise changes your body. It dives into how and why we need to tune out the voices telling us that intensity is the most important thing, and we begin by taking a look at how you begin to assess your personal journey. The top coaches and athletes in the world do not train the way you think they do. Skill development and practice is what makes most athletes great and having a fitness foundation to build those on is where we start.

Part 2 contains chapters 4: Let’s Go For a Walk, Chapter 5: Strength Training: The Art and the Tools, Chapter 6: Power Training and Weighted Carries, and Chapter 8: Building Workouts. In this section we will explore the basics of exercise including why walking is one of the best exercises you can do for both your body and mind, and how basic strength training can free you from pain and immobility. You will learn to design short workouts that deliver big results in health and functionality. If you think you are past your prime, you couldn’t be more wrong. Anyone can start daily routines that promote a healthy and active lifestyle.

Part 3 contains Chapter 9: Staying Motivated, Chapter 10: Achieving Your Goals, and Chapter 11: Success Stories for Inspiration. In this section we talk about how to maintain your motivation and how to write your own programs for long term training goals. This section will also provide some moving and inspirational true life stories. You will even be provided with examples of programs you can use in your own fitness journey. Once you learn how to establish some basic routines as demonstrated in Part II, you can create your own fitness journey and Part III will help guide you along the way.

The Appendix contains three more sections that you may want to refer to as you are reading the book. The first is a lexicon of gym and fitness terms that you may not be familiar with. The second is an extensive appendix of strength exercises and stretches that you can use to design your workouts and address any flexibility issues you may encounter. Finally, you will learn early on that this book is not about weight loss, but rather, a tool to help you achieve your fitness goals by addressing why diet is the keystone for success in reducing body fat.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish in April 2021.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Sara Fleming has been a personal trainer and a strength and sports coach for over ten years. She has a masters degree in biochemistry from Georgetown University. Prior to her coaching career, she spent ten years in medical research applying scientific methods to numerous problems in the research lab. After she and her husband started their family, she made the transition to personal training and coaching. Her unique approach has brought both her and her clients a great deal of success in competition, wellness, and in life. Coming from a non-athletic background, Sara has used her educational approach to training to learn how to participate and become competitive in a variety of sports and activities, including the Scottish highland games.

Sara has always been passionate about teaching fitness to folks from all walks of life. Many people give up on fitness because its too involved, requires too much effort, and quite frankly, is too intimidating. Sara has never liked that aspect of the fitness industry and every brave soul who has entered her gym has been relieved to find out that her goal is to teach them to have the fit active life they've always wanted. She assists them in creating a plan on their own terms and for their own purposes.

Sara has trained athletes of all ages and levels of competition including national and world level strength athletes. She has learned that the effective and safe training principles that make her athletes successful also apply to her every-day clients. She has trained a diverse group of people from powerlifters with national and world titles, to grandmothers just looking to keep up with their grandkids. The key is to her approach is to train the individual for what they need, and not apply a one size fits all approach.

Sara has three active teenagers and an ER doctor for a husband, so her schedule tends to be a bit hectic. However, she still finds time to go for long walks with her crazy rescue dog, Macy, and bake the occasional pie.

To learn more, you can connect with Sara Fleming at flemingsj4616@gmail.com and at instagram.com/sarafleming_author.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #fitnesswithoutfear and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Sara Fleming

story:
Who We Are

What happens when keen insights into U.S. and global progressive politics are mixed with humor and more than a dash of snark?

You get Borderless News and Views (BNV).

BNV is a news site small enough to feel like a community, but large enough to be covering diverse topics with 25 writers located in over 10 countries. The site publishes several articles a day seven days a week, with the focus on Progressive Politics with a dash of snark. In addition to Politics, we publish stories in the areas of Lifestyle, Technology, Finance, Social Change, and “Art-itorials.”

The tagline for BNV is to Educate, Entertain, and Eradicate Borders.

Educate: This progressive blogazine does more than report mainstream news. We do our homework to educate readers on stories and points of view not typically found with the larger news organizations. Stories about life in Singapore, local Pakistani politics, and first person accounts on the effects of the War on Women are just a few examples.

Entertain: What could be more humorous than the current U.S. presidential campaign? In our opinion -- not much.

 Eradicate Borders: Whether real or imagined, we work hard to break down the borders in society. We believe that starts with telling the truth. And, while we enjoy snark, we also find a place to bring a message of unity and understanding to our readers. We work hard to accomplish this, which begins with our writers. Our staff is made up of a broad and diverse mix, varying in age, gender, sexual orientation, racial background, and religious beliefs.

How Your Support Will Help Us

We are proud of what we have accomplished to date, but we want to do more, which requires funding. A few examples of what our staff has shone a light on includes important issues such as the War on Women, the Susan G. Komen defunding of Planned Parenthood, and reporting on the U.S. presidential candidates’ campaigns. But we can do more, reaching a broader audience and rewarding those working hard to continue our success.

Our talented writers are the heart of our site. Without their diverse, unique perspectives, we would not have such an eclectic mix of reporting. Right now our team writes for us because of their passion and interest in having a voice regarding the U.S. political system and the state of the world. We would like to compensate our writers and a successful campaign will help us accomplish this important goal.

We also want to increase our reporting to be able to include regular video and audio podcasts to the mix. 

While we accept paid advertising, our goal is to also be able to have the ability to leave advertising space for global organizations that seek to bring a positive change to the world such as Doctors without Borders, Playing for Change, One Laptop Per Child, Barefoot College, and various micro lending organizations such as Kiva. Cutting back on paid advertising slots to promote charitable organizations means alternative sources of revenue, such as this campaign.

Other Ways You Can Help

We hope you will be a backer of our campaign; we have many great levels as a supporter and fun rewards for your financial commitment. Here's just one example:

In addition to your financial support, we need help spreading the word about our campaign. We are working as a team to promote this campaign, but the greater the audience we reach, the better our chance is of meeting our goal.

Please share a link to our campaign on Twitter, Facebook, Google+, or any other place you visit. If you have a blog, please write about our campaign. Or send an email to like-minded friends.

 Thank you for your time and support to help us reach our goal!

story:
A Brand New Collection of Sherlock Holmes Stories Written Specifically for Young Adults!  

Belanger Books is proud to present a new collection of seventeen all new Sherlock Holmes stories written specifically for young adults. The anthology contains some of the best known Sherlockian authors as well as first time young adult authors.

The story collection is written by professional writers such as David Marcum (The MX Book of New Sherlock Holmes Stories), Chris Chan (The Strand ), Will Murray (Marvel Comics), Margie Deck (Sherlock Holmes is Like), Dick Gillman (Sherlock Holmes, The Collector's Edition), and edited by award winning author Derrick Belanger (The Irregular Adventures of Sherlock Holmes). Plus introductions by Francine Kitts, BSI and  Beacon Society Headlight Denny Dobry, BSI. 

Six Baker Street Elementary comics are featured in the book.

Table of Contents

Introductions

A Message from the Headlight by Denny Dobry, BSI - In this introduction we learn about the important work of the Beacon Society

Holmes at Home by Francine Kitts, BSI - Ms. Kitts tells of her family's collection of Sherlock Holmes memorabilia.

Traditional Adventures of

Holmes and Watson

Once a Soldier by Robert Stapleton - A former soldier and a street child help Holmes capture a notorious criminal.

The Adventure of the Hostile Hound by Paul Hiscock - Holmes solves the case of a calm family dog who has suddenly become violent.

Sherlock Holmes and the Case of the Missing Heirloom by Jonah Horstmann - There were 13 guests at a party. Which one stole Toby's family heirloom?

All is not as it Seems by Thomas J. Shea - Mr. Gregory Witherspoon is found dead with his finger pointing to his desk. What evidence on the desktop will help Holmes solve the murder?

The Burning Major by Sean Venning - Miss Claire Atkins is visited by the flaming spirit of her uncle. Could he be a real ghost? Holmes must solve this yuletide mystery.

Different Takes on Holmes and Watson

The Adventure of the Ransomed Carrots by Phoebe Belanger - Detective Marble and her assistant Dr. Marshmellow must discover the identity of the mysterious carrot thief.

The Adventure of the Cursed Ruin by Allyn Gibson - Mr. Escott Sigerson receives a unique client in this case inspired by popular video games.

The Missing Snowflake Necklace by Nora Baker - A modern day Sherlock Holmes adventure involving a stolen necklace.

Stories Inspired by the Canon

The Sting of the Killer Wasp by Senna Muncy -  Stormie Stranges must solve the case of a kidnapper who leaves mysterious notes written in rhyme.

Murders at Midnight by Arabelle Mackintosh - Detective Alex Cora and her assistant investigate a series of murders that occur every night at midnight.

She-Shed, He Said by Chris Chan - Who set fire to Mrs. Waggett's shed? It is up to student advocate Isaiah Funderburke to solve the case.

Spring the Wiser, a Memoir by Margie Deck - Jacob Marsh must follow the Musgrave Ritual to find his stolen bike. This delightful story is written as a series of blog posts. 

Longer Adventures: Novellas

Sherlock Holmes & The Angel's Trumpet by Dick Gillman - A traditional Holmes and Watson mystery involving a family friend of Mrs. Hudson.

The Mystery of Athena’s Charm by Rhea Belanger - A high school student must think like Sherlock Holmes in this fast paced futuristic thriller.

Stories for Older YA Readers

Ingression by Joseph Trujillo - A dark Sherlock Holmes adventure involving murder and revenge.

The Alarming Adventure of the Audacious Assassin by Will Murray - A former foe once again tries to thwart Holmes and Watson.

Sherlock's Diagnosis by Kevin P. Thornton - Holmes deduces the illness of one of Dr. Watson's patients in this tale about the terrible harm of bullying.

The Treasures of the Gog Magog Hills by David Marcum - Holmes and Watson answer the question of why young George Shelford disappears into the Gog Magog Hills at night.

Stretch Goals

#1 - If the campaign reaches $750, all backers will receive a Bonus Story by Derrick Belanger

#2 - If the campaign reaches $1,000, all backers' names will be added to a special thank you section in the book.

 

A Fundraiser for the Beacon Society

The proceeds from this Indiegogo campaign will be donated to The Beacon Society, a Sherlock Holmes Scion Society which gives grants to teachers, libraries, and Sherlock Holmes organizations to help introduce students to Sherlock Holmes. 

By backing this Indiegogo campaign, you will not only get an amazing collection of Sherlock Holmes stories, you will also be helping to support schools and libraries. 

The Impact

Your contribution to the campaign will help the Beacon Society reach young readers in many ways. For example:

The Jan Stauber Grant Program—This program provides grants for educators to create programs in their schools, libraries, youth-oriented theatre or museums that introduce the Sherlockian Canon to young people. 

The R. Joel Senter Sr. Memorial Essay Contest—An essay writing competition with cash prizes for students in Grades 4 through 12.

The Fortescue Scholarship Honours Program—This program enables youth and adults to earn their degrees in Sherlockiana studies. 

Risks & Challenges

The book has been completed. All stories have been received and compiled. The only challenge is that there could be a delay in printing and shipping the books because of the current covid pandemic.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please back the campaign and share this campaign through email and social media (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, TikTok, etc...). Use the Indiegogo share tools to help make this campaign a huge success!

The Adventure of the Hostile Hound by Paul Hiscock - Holmes solves the case of a calm family dog who has suddenly become violent.
Sherlock Holmes and the Case of the Missing Heirloom by Jonah Horstmann - There were 13 guests at a party. Which one stole Toby's family heirloom?
All is not as it Seems by Thomas J. Shea - Mr. Gregory Witherspoon is found dead with his finger pointing to his desk. What evidence on the desktop will help Holmes solve the murder?
The Burning Major by Sean Venning - Miss Claire Atkins is visited by the flaming spirit of her uncle. Could he be a real ghost? Holmes must solve this yuletide mystery.
Different Takes on Holmes and Watson
The Adventure of the Ransomed Carrots by Phoebe Belanger - Detective Marble and her assistant Dr. Marshmellow must discover the identity of the mysterious carrot thief.
The Adventure of the Cursed Ruin by Allyn Gibson - Mr. Escott Sigerson receives a unique client in this case inspired by popular video games.
The Missing Snowflake Necklace by Nora Baker - A modern day Sherlock Holmes adventure involving a stolen necklace.
Stories Inspired by the Canon
The Sting of the Killer Wasp by Senna Muncy -  Stormie Stranges must solve the case of a kidnapper who leaves mysterious notes written in rhyme.
Murders at Midnight by Arabelle Mackintosh - Detective Alex Cora and her assistant investigate a series of murders that occur every night at midnight.
She-Shed, He Said by Chris Chan - Who set fire to Mrs. Waggett's shed? It is up to student advocate Isaiah Funderburke to solve the case.
Spring the Wiser, a Memoir by Margie Deck - Jacob Marsh must follow the Musgrave Ritual to find his stolen bike. This delightful story is written as a series of blog posts. 
Longer Adventures: Novellas
Sherlock Holmes & The Angel's Trumpet by Dick Gillman - A traditional Holmes and Watson mystery involving a family friend of Mrs. Hudson.
The Mystery of Athena’s Charm by Rhea Belanger - A high school student must think like Sherlock Holmes in this fast paced futuristic thriller.
Stories for Older YA Readers
Ingression by Joseph Trujillo - A dark Sherlock Holmes adventure involving murder and revenge.
The Alarming Adventure of the Audacious Assassin by Will Murray - A former foe once again tries to thwart Holmes and Watson.
Sherlock's Diagnosis by Kevin P. Thornton - Holmes deduces the illness of one of Dr. Watson's patients in this tale about the terrible harm of bullying.
The Treasures of the Gog Magog Hills by David Marcum - Holmes and Watson answer the question of why young George Shelford disappears into the Gog Magog Hills at night.
Stretch Goals
#1 - If the campaign reaches $750, all backers will receive a Bonus Story by Derrick Belanger
#2 - If the campaign reaches $1,000, all backers' names will be added to a special thank you section in the book.
 

A Fundraiser for the Beacon Society
The proceeds from this Indiegogo campaign will be donated to The Beacon Society, a Sherlock Holmes Scion Society which gives grants to teachers, libraries, and Sherlock Holmes organizations to help introduce students to Sherlock Holmes. 
By backing this Indiegogo campaign, you will not only get an amazing collection of Sherlock Holmes stories, you will also be helping to support schools and libraries. 

The Impact
Your contribution to the campaign will help the Beacon Society reach young readers in many ways. For example:
The Jan Stauber Grant Program—This program provides grants for educators to create programs in their schools, libraries, youth-oriented theatre or museums that introduce the Sherlockian Canon to young people. 
The R. Joel Senter Sr. Memorial Essay Contest—An essay writing competition with cash prizes for students in Grades 4 through 12.
The Fortescue Scholarship Honours Program—This program enables youth and adults to earn their degrees in Sherlockiana studies. 

Risks & Challenges
The book has been completed. All stories have been received and compiled. The only challenge is that there could be a delay in printing and shipping the books because of the current covid pandemic.

Other Ways You Can Help
Please back the campaign and share this campaign through email and social media (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, TikTok, etc...). Use the Indiegogo share tools to help make this campaign a huge success!

story:
Story of My Book

The battle against COVID has worsened in India in a matter of days. There are not enough resources to keep up with demand, not enough hospital beds or oxygen tanks to sustain those falling ill.  I am personally contributing an equal amount of all my book campaign presales for #EmpathyAndArrogance made through the end of the campaign to a trusted organization supporting relief efforts.

My name is Gurmeet Kaur and I am the author of Empathy & Arrogance: The Paradox of Digital Products. I wrote this book because I noticed teams taking a process and checklist based approach to building digital products. While this approach works to build a short term digital presence, the approach does not set you up to build competitive advantage or succeed and thrive in a Darwinian digital world where it is survival of the digitally fit.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that it takes more than a process or checklist to build products that win over your customers and make them true brand fans. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for building strong connections with your customers and truly humanizing digital. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you change your approach to both thinking and building digital products.

In this book, you'll learn about the evolution of digital products, the need for a different approach as well as the need for both empathy and arrogance to build strong digital products. You'll hear stories such as...

  • Why established companies such as Kodak, Borders, and Blockbuster failed in their digital efforts
  • The story of startups as well as popular digital products such as Waze, TikTok, AirBnb and how they used both empathy and arrogance to build their digital products
  • Why the empowered product manager needs to understand data, along with the traditional product components of business, user experience and technology.

 

You will love this book if you are a creative thinker and want to challenge your thought process, if you understand that processes are the means to the end but not the end, if you like story-based problem solving, and if you love to build digital products, as much as I do.


Empathy & Arrogance: The Paradox of Digital Products is a nonfiction book that speaks to everyone who dreams, touches and builds digital products as well as non-digital users who want to understand and look at product mindset and product approach in a new way.

 

The Book - Empathy & Arrogance: The Paradox of Digital Products - is written in three parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-3. The first part of the book establishes the foundation for why digital products need a different approach and mindset. Along with learning about digital wars, you will learn how to re-define why you, as a company or team, exist, what customer problem you are trying to solve, and the mindset you need to play the digital game when building digital products.

Part 2 contains chapters 4 - 6: Building on the foundational elements, this section focuses on Empathy. You’ll learn why empathy is essential to playing the digital product game. You’ll learn about customer obsession and how companies use the obsession to build products that delight their customers. You’ll also learn about the nuances of global products.

Part 3 contains chapters 7-11: We delve deeper into arrogance, and key components of a digital product: user experience, technology, and data, as well as marketing. We explore common pitfalls for each component as well as understand how each component can be used to build competitive advantage of your product.
 

What I Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.

 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

 

About the Author

Gurmeet Kaur is a digital product executive with more than two decades of experience building digital products across industries spanning startups, Fortune 500, governments and non-profits.

A digital technologist as well as a certified Gallup StrengthsFinder coach, Gurmeet is passionate about humanizing digital and the workplace. Her first book is a callout to the digital community to be thoughtful and insightful when building products. Tapping into human elements of empathy and arrogance, she equates digital products as an infinite game where teams play with the goal to surprise, delight and empower their customers.

Gurmeet lives in the Washington, DC metro area. Her life evolves around the kitchen table conversations where the dialogue with her two daughters and husband continue to inspire her.  When not writing, you will find Gurmeet at a coffee shop, reading or engaged in conversations with her friends. With a global extended family, Gurmeet loves to travel and learn about global cultures and traditions. 

For more information, you can connect with Gurmeet on email or LinkedIn

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #empathyandarrogance and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Gurmeet Kaur

story:
Short Summary

All Roads Lead to Nowhere is a novel that follows seven important people who are pushed to the edge of desperation through interactions with each other, their environment, and unforeseen forces in an alternate future timeline. China and Russia defeated the United States in a nuclear global conflict, and those who remain must persevere in the devastated areas of Nowhere, finding new conflicts with the lucky few who live in the Paradise Cities. 

My name is Alexander Skikos and I am the author of All Roads Lead to Nowhere. I wrote this book in order to provide insight regarding the philosophies that divide us in contemporary times and hopefully educate people through a fun and thrilling story how each paradigm survives in the face of a humanitarian crisis. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the importance of understanding others—thinking about what connects us, and what supposedly divides us.

The book takes place in a post-apocalyptic future America. The U.S. has devolved into a colony for the newly united People’s Republic of Russia and China. In this world, there are two settings: the supposedly beautiful and majestic Paradise Cities, each named after an iconic American metropolis, and what they call Nowhere, the remains of the wasteland that once was the United States. Those stuck in Nowhere are forgotten by those who are not.  

You will love this book if you love:

  • science-fiction thrillers like Blade Runner, Dune, or Watchmen
  • a page turner that forces you to answer, “Who deserves to have the Good Life?”


All Roads Lead to Nowhere speaks to people trying to make sense of our modern political and social strife and those who grapple with what qualities are required for someone to be considered a worthy role model.

About the Author

Alexander Skikos has studied Political Science and Communication. He is passionate about a multitude of topics ranging from dinosaurs to discussing Plato’s Republic, with the ultimate goal of understanding how environment impacts the communication techniques used by politicians and media outlets, or vice versa. His hope is for people to hold up a mirror and reflect on how they can improve themselves to live out their desires and fulfill their potential. 

Alex is a sports enthusiast, as his favorite teams are the Golden State Warriors, San Francisco Giants, and 49ers. He loves hiking, going to the beach, and enjoys a wide variety of music ranging from Pink Floyd to Kendrick Lamar. 

For more information, you can contact Alex at askikos@scu.edu, on Instagram @allroadsleadtonowherebook, and LinkedIn at www.linkedin.com/in/alexander-skikos. 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this spring.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book ($5,000), I will publish a paperback and ebook.

When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book ($6,000), I will also publish a hardcover edition.

When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book ($8,000), I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #ARLN or #allroadsleadtonowhere and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Alexander Skikos

story:
Hello!

My name is Blou (which means ‘blue’ in Afrikaans) and I'm hoping to bring my story of a shattering stroke and its profound blessing, to life.

Almost seven years ago, a pituitary apoplexy stopped me in my tracks. I was twenty seven, and suddenly my well planned world disintergrated. As it turns out, losing my head helped save my life. And it is this journey, my unconventional tale of transformation, I wish to turn into a book...

Briefly: fear and desire for financial security led me to abandon my creative side in favour of a more logical and reasonable path. After seven arduous years of study and what often felt like soulless work, I qualified as a chartered accountant (US equivalent of a CPA). The one aspect of work I enjoyed, a lighthouse beam through the gloom, was facilitating training – and this created an exciting opportunity to work at KPMG’s Learning and Development global head office in America. Already a workaholic, my life became increasingly unbalanced until the 9th of February 2006: I blew my hormonal motherboard. Without a pituitary seamlessly orchestrating my vital hormones, I developed a chronic, life threatening condition. Reality altered radically to say the least.

Forced to resign and return home to Africa, I struggled to accept the massive change this condition wrought. Having always been fiercely independent and physically strong, I was now debilitatingly weak and dependent on help from family and friends. And there were more devastating challenges to face: my disability insurers refused to pay long term benefits; healthcare and medication to manage this rare condition proved expensive and there was no way my body could cope with the stress of my old career.

So began a slow process of surrender as I pieced together a new life. Fundamental changes had to be made and I struggled to find meaning in my radically diminshed life. I invested my carefully squirreled lifesavings into getting well: healing by almost imperceptible increments and gradually developing a new kind of strength. I began working towards my dream of writing by starting a blog (ScarletNguni.com) and learning to follow my heart. In April, against medical precedent and to the great surprise of my doctors, tests revealed I was begining to regain some pituitary functionality!

Two months ago, I took another massive leap into the Unknown, finally committing fully to the dream of sharing my story. I moved out into the country, living in a simple cottage without electricity where I can focus on birthing this book. A massive oak tree dominates my view here and inspired another creative project to celebrate cycles and try balance my old dragon - workaholism: 360*tree

I believe what happened to me was largely due to stress and doggedly following an inauthentic path. My recovery is testimony to the innate wisdom of the body, its natural inclination towards vitality and the transformative power of ‘disaster’.  Ultimately, I perceive what happened to me as a gift. I hope that by sharing my experience, I might offer constructive alternatives to those trapped in destructive cycles as well as hope to those shattered by some life-changing circumstance. Your support will help pen this story and bring two books to life (Losing My Head and 360*tree).  

 

Converting Dream >> to >> Reality

Funding will create a window of time for me to focus on writing and producing this book. Based on my budget this amounts to $25,000 and covers

  • basic expenses for a period of 6months to a year, allowing for initial draft and re-writes
  • professional editing
  • printing and production
  • special gifts perks
  • postage/distribution

See below for details of unique and exciting rewards available to all you kind souls and patron saints.

 

( If we manage to raise MORE than the original goal, I’d like travel back to America, to meet and interview colleagues and doctors. As well as taking photographs and record footage for a possible ‘special edition’ documentary. Big dream! Let’s hope... )

If we don’t manage to raise the target, the book will still get written. Somehow. Any funds raised will be invested towards this and funders will still receive their perks. Albeit at a later date...

My goal is to launch the book on 09 February 2014, the 8th anniversary, of the swift blow to the head that changed everything... for the better. Supporters of this project will receive their copies earlier, as soon as the book’s complete.

 

Why Back This Project?

Being both a passionate reader and writer, I’ve found solace in stories since I was a child. As I‘ve journeyed, meeting unknown situations both terrible and terrific, the shared experience of friends, family and strangers (in the guise of authors, poets and songwriters) has served as an invaluable compass. I believe there’s a power in our stories, both individual and collective, and by sharing them, we act as ‘turnkeys’ for one another. This sense is substantiated by ancient wisdoms from around the world which view story, myth and faerytales as sacred medicine to help us heal.

I believe this story can inspire people to seek what is truly important and of value in their lives, orientate towards greater balance and lead more meaning filled lives – without having to get sick or face death. The stroke helped me face my greatest fears, choose a path toward freedom which revealed life's endless abundance of intense joys, simple pleasures and mundane magic, the very things we tend to forget or overlook in today’s choatic world. I hope my book will help readers re-appreciate the amazing gift life is and recognise the awe and wonder inherent in every passing day.

 

Cash Strapped? There're Plenty Of Other Ways To Help!

If you are unable to contribute financially (I understand what it’s like to be in that position!) but would still like to help turn this dream into reality, here are ways which will go a long way to supporting this project:

  • Send an email to any of your friends, family or colleagues who you think might be interested in supporting this project
  • If you are on social media, consider mentioning this project via Twitter, Facebook, Linkedin or your own blog
  • Come visit 360*tree or Scarlet Nguni: comment or sign up to receive updates
  • Send support postcards, pens, pencils or paper (like empty journals I can write in). I’d love to hear from you! Send me an email and I’ll give you my postal address
  • Tie a blessing ribbon to a tree... or even better, plant one (um, a tree that is, not a ribbon. wonder what *that* might grow into? )

 

Thank you!
story_txt:
Hello!
My name is Blou (which means ‘blue’ in Afrikaans) and I'm hoping to bring my story of a shattering stroke and its profound blessing, to life.
Almost seven years ago, a pituitary apoplexy stopped me in my tracks. I was twenty seven, and suddenly my well planned world disintergrated. As it turns out, losing my head helped save my life. And it is this journey, my unconventional tale of transformation, I wish to turn into a book...
Briefly: fear and desire for financial security led me to abandon my creative side in favour of a more logical and reasonable path. After seven arduous years of study and what often felt like soulless work, I qualified as a chartered accountant (US equivalent of a CPA). The one aspect of work I enjoyed, a lighthouse beam through the gloom, was facilitating training – and this created an exciting opportunity to work at KPMG’s Learning and Development global head office in America. Already a workaholic, my life became increasingly unbalanced until the 9th of February 2006: I blew my hormonal motherboard. Without a pituitary seamlessly orchestrating my vital hormones, I developed a chronic, life threatening condition. Reality altered radically to say the least.
Forced to resign and return home to Africa, I struggled to accept the massive change this condition wrought. Having always been fiercely independent and physically strong, I was now debilitatingly weak and dependent on help from family and friends. And there were more devastating challenges to face: my disability insurers refused to pay long term benefits; healthcare and medication to manage this rare condition proved expensive and there was no way my body could cope with the stress of my old career.
So began a slow process of surrender as I pieced together a new life. Fundamental changes had to be made and I struggled to find meaning in my radically diminshed life. I invested my carefully squirreled lifesavings into getting well: healing by almost imperceptible increments and gradually developing a new kind of strength. I began working towards my dream of writing by starting a blog (ScarletNguni.com) and learning to follow my heart. In April, against medical precedent and to the great surprise of my doctors, tests revealed I was begining to regain some pituitary functionality!
Two months ago, I took another massive leap into the Unknown, finally committing fully to the dream of sharing my story. I moved out into the country, living in a simple cottage without electricity where I can focus on birthing this book. A massive oak tree dominates my view here and inspired another creative project to celebrate cycles and try balance my old dragon - workaholism: 360*tree
I believe what happened to me was largely due to stress and doggedly following an inauthentic path. My recovery is testimony to the innate wisdom of the body, its natural inclination towards vitality and the transformative power of ‘disaster’.  Ultimately, I perceive what happened to me as a gift. I hope that by sharing my experience, I might offer constructive alternatives to those trapped in destructive cycles as well as hope to those shattered by some life-changing circumstance. Your support will help pen this story and bring two books to life (Losing My Head and 360*tree).  


 
Converting Dream >> to >> Reality
Funding will create a window of time for me to focus on writing and producing this book. Based on my budget this amounts to $25,000 and covers

basic expenses for a period of 6months to a year, allowing for initial draft and re-writes
professional editing
printing and production
special gifts perks
postage/distribution

See below for details of unique and exciting rewards available to all you kind souls and patron saints.
 
( If we manage to raise MORE than the original goal, I’d like travel back to America, to meet and interview colleagues and doctors. As well as taking photographs and record footage for a possible ‘special edition’ documentary. Big dream! Let’s hope... )
If we don’t manage to raise the target, the book will still get written. Somehow. Any funds raised will be invested towards this and funders will still receive their perks. Albeit at a later date...
My goal is to launch the book on 09 February 2014, the 8th anniversary, of the swift blow to the head that changed everything... for the better. Supporters of this project will receive their copies earlier, as soon as the book’s complete.

story:
Who I am and why I wrote the book:

My name is Sharlyn Hidalgo and I am an author and metaphysical teacher and have traveled to Egypt many times because of my great love for Egypt. Through my travels I got to know the owner of Quest Travel, Mr. Nazmy, who proved to be mentor, business alchemist, spiritual warrior, and all around amazing human being worth emulating. Egypt, Quest Travel, and Mr. Nazmy had a profound effect upon me, and this is true of thousands of others who have come to know Nazmy through their travels to Egypt. I was so mobilized and changed by Nazmy and his efforts in Egypt that I wanted to bring his story to the world.  It has implications for how to create peace in our lives and in our world.

What the book is about:

This is the story of how one spiritual man has changed the face of travel in Egypt through his vision of creating peace, one relationship at a time, as people from the Middle East and the West come to know each other as friends.  The purpose of this spiritual alchemy is to raise consciousness and foster peace on the planet. Mohamed Nazmy, his travel company Quest Travel, the many new thought teachers and scholars who travel with him, and the powerful healing energies of ancient and modern Egypt, along with the kind and warm hearted people of Egypt, are all working together to make this happen.

This is the story of one man's living example of how to create peace every moment in your daily life.  This is the story of the big work that is being done to open travelers'  hearts and minds and encourage tolerance. And this is the story about how we can change our consciousness and celebrate our differences.  This is also a story about Egypt, and her people, who are presently struggling to form their own definition of democracy. The book is full of practical spiritual teachings and wisdom from Nazmy himself, as well as from the spiritual teachers who travel with him.  Read this book and perhaps you too will jump on the peace bus and become one of Nazmy's peace ambassadors. In this way we can all become world citizens together and have and impact upon our world. By contributing to this project you are doing something worthwhile.

What is the benefit to humanity?

My friend Suzanne Lentz, a friend and colleague wrote these words: “I want to create a world in which each person feels whole and loved; a world where folks feel free to show their authentic selves -- to stand in their power and shine the light of their individual souls out into the universe.”

This reminded me so much of Nazmy. He too wants to create such a world, and in fact he does. This is his universal service. While he conducts his business and shares his country through his award winning company, he also is helping to create a safe place for people to open to their true power and light and to new potential and possibility. This is part of the magic of interacting with him.  It is nearly impossible for him to see people other than in this light.

Why this project is important:

Many of us benefit from mentors and examples. When someone really aspires to true prosperity and gratitude, by being generous and loving, it touches our hearts and opens us up. We often think of such a person as a spiritual guide or leader. Nazmy is truly one of those inspiring wise men.

I call him a magus not only because he is a spiritual mentor, but because he is also a magician and knows how to create what it is that he has a vision for. Nazmy is a master exemplar in this regard. He believes we all are a unique expression of the divine and he likes to remind us of this. Nazmy simply loves people, and is motivated to express that love. We can do the same. We too can create peace any time and any where. This is the message. We just need open hearts and open minds.

Through Quest Travel he meets thousands of travelers.  He demonstrates positive and sincere regard for every human being that he comes in contact with. He asks them to become his peace ambassadors, to go home and tell about their experiences in Egypt. Mohamed knows many new thought teachers and authors who travel with his company and bring tours to Egypt. He has prepared the tours for such people as Gregg Braden, Jean Houston, Nicki Scully, and Maureen St. Germain. They are part of Nazmy's peace team, and they are a part of mine. They teach about unity and new ways of being together on the planet that do not involve war and further violence.  They are encouraging us to identify with our spiritual natures. By sharing their stories in this book, they share Egypt and this consciousness.

Come and be inspired! I invite you to get on Nazmy's peace bus by contributing to this campaign. In this was we all participate in spreading the good news that we are more alike than different, and that we are each others' brothers and sisters.

Crowd funding is such an amazing way to make things happen:

I am so grateful to Indiegogo in that we have an opportunity through this media to make our dreams and passions a reality. My desire to write this book comes from my desire to promote peace on the planet. When I saw what Mohamed Nazmy was doing in Egypt I was truly blown away. We can help each other make our dreams come true. I have an inspiring story to share, and now it is possible for me to do this.  You too might want to use this vehicle someday to promote your own ideas and passions. This is really a grassroots way of reaching our goals. This means that the control for what we want to do is in our own hands. When I speak about global citizens and peace ambassadors I am asking you to help me create peace on the planet. By contributing to this project you are helping with something very important.

What we need & what you get:

Your contributions will help to pay for the publishing  and promotion of the book. This involves designing the book cover and the cover art, creating the inner book design, editing, and copy editing, and then printing the book as well as advertising and publicity.  If we don’t reach our goal, the money that is raised will still help us with the cost and is very important to getting this project off of the ground. And we have some wonderful and unique perks for you when you contribute.

The impact:

This is my first Indiegogo project, and I am learning so much. There are already too many negative stories in the world, wouldn’t it be great to read about a positive story that is making a difference?  I am seeing the world here as one place and that we are more alike than different. This is important. Let Mohamed Nazmy influence you, let his life teach you. You too can make a difference. 

Other ways you can help:

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help. Please tell your friends, family, and co-workers about this site and this campaign. I am reminding you that you can use the Indiegogo share tool to help me get the word out.  Perks with readings are limited to the first 100 who sign up.  If you have selected a perk with a reading, I will get back to you after June 9th to set up a time to Skype. The launch date for the book is August 5, 2014 and perks with books and e-books will be sent to you after this time. Thank you again for your generosity and support.

story:
Es un sitio web, de periodicidad fija, que se propone convertirse en un espacio referencial de historias cuidadosamente elaboradas y que busca ser puente en el que se encuentren las mejores expresiones del arte de contar, con un objetivo  específico: compartir historias que conecten y conmuevan al lector común.

Es una propuesta con un diseño y una estructura sencillos, cuyo lanzamiento está previsto para finales de enero de 2017. Y por ese énfasis sobre la buena historia, el espacio puede abarcar los géneros autobiográficos, la semblanza, el ensayo y los formatos multimedia. La condición común de estas piezas será la impecable factura, garantizada en ese cruce de experiencias y posiciones estéticas de sus editores, Albor Rodríguez y Héctor Torres, quienes provienen desde distintas orillas de la escritura: el periodismo y la literatura.

Queremos mostrar al país plural en la singularidad de sus historias.

Contar la vida, y ¡contarla con gusto! 

Fotografía / Fabiola Ferrero

Una de las camisetas diseñadas por Pure Love
especialmente para La vida de nos.
Es una de nuestras recompensas en esta campaña
 

Crear un espacio para testimoniar la vida en Venezuela o entre los venezolanos, hoy por hoy, resulta más que pertinente, indispensable. Esta época de crisis por la que atraviesa Venezuela, manifestada tanto en su deterioro social y económico como en la migración sin precedentes que estamos experimentando, nos lleva a reflexionar sobre ella y a proponernos:
 

  1. Reunir el talento de periodistas, escritores, fotógrafos,  videógrafos, ilustradores o, sencillamente, personas con una historia que contar, para lograr los más conmovedores relatos que pongan de manifiesto la experiencia de vivir en nuestro tiempo;

  2. Impulsar la autorrealización a través de la escritura, lo que permitirá que cualquier persona interesada cuente su vida o la vida de otros, con nuestro acompañamiento;

  3. Ofrecer, a partir de un arduo proceso editorial, las más maravillosas historias de estos días y de los días por venir, para dejar un testimonio de ellos.

  4. Compartir historias de otras latitudes que puedan decirle algo a los venezolanos.

Para lograr este cometido, hemos diseñado un modelo de negocios que nos permita ser autosustentables en el lapso de un año. Para ello nos basamos en la experiencia de sitios exitosos de distintas partes del mundo. Nuestra idea es procurar ingresos poniendo el foco en financiar la creatividad y no solo asuntos operativos; configurar una organización ligera y flexible que implique gastos fijos mínimos, de manera que podamos dedicar nuestros esfuerzos y recursos a lo más importante: los contenidos. Así nos concentraríamos en tres aspectos:

  1. Convocar a los mejores talentos,

  2. Contribuir con su promoción y formación,

  3. Ofrecer la mejor remuneración por el trabajo de todos.

 

Para reunir el capital semilla que permita echar a andar este emprendimiento digital y darnos tiempo de que La vida de nos se convierta en un sitio autosustentable, hemos ideado esta campaña de recolección de fondos colectivos en la que te invitamos a participar. Puedes aportar donaciones a partir de $5. Cualquier monto es más que bienvenido. También está la figura de las recompensas, que lejos de una contraprestación son formas de agradecimiento.   

Otras formas de ayudar

 

El aporte económico, donado o en pos de una recompensa, es solo una de las formas que tienes de ayudar.

También puedes multiplicar este mensaje:

  1. Invita a tus amigos a ver nuestra campaña en Indiegogo e invítalos a donar. Divulga nuestro video de promoción en tus redes sociales y a través de tu lista de correos electrónicos.

  2. Entra en la plataforma de Indiegogo y comparte desde allí nuestra campaña y nuestra experiencia.

  3. Apoya desde twitter y facebook la etiqueta #LavidadeNOS

story:
Our Story


We are Candy and KB, two Austinite 'zinesters who couldn't help but notice how prevalent and inspiring the D.I.Y. culture is in Austin. It's everywhere from the stencil or knit installation on the street corner to the countertops or bathroom door of your favorite bar. There's a huge culture of people who make their lives simpler and more affordable by making something out of what otherwise could be considered nothing. We are in awe of the urban beauty, functionality and cultural message that these projects bring to our lives every day. 


Therefore, we decided to use our lust for print and the process behind 'zining to pay tribute to D.I.Y. culture and the many creative and interesting minds behind it.


We are both 20 somethings trying to balance the desire to make an impact on our surrounding community while working multiple jobs to make ends meet. Such is the strife of young, talented, educated Austin. But instead of letting the pressure bog us down at the end of the day, we've chosen to harvest our inspiration into energy and explore the ways that people around us are using resources and art to not only cope with these times we are in... but make the best they can out of them. Being broke can be fun. It just takes an open mind and the desire to turn nothing into something. The interviews and snapshots in our 'zine highlight just a handful of the people we've had the pleasure to speak with who don't rely on others to make things happen for them. They do it themselves. And they are happy to share what they do with others. And that's what we're all about too.


We started the 'zine a couple of months ago and put out the first issue December 9th. It's made a positive impact on our community already and we are excited about working on issue II.


The Impact

Our 'zine is advertisement free and free to the public. We want to keep it this way because we want to make it as real and accessible as possible. We've distributed 200 issues over the first weekend, from our hands to the readers. We will continue to distribute by means of local bookstores, collectives, coffee shops and the baskets of our bikes. 

The feedback from our readers so far has been overwhelming. We've stirred up a momentum toward creativity and community building. We've linked resources which are the recipe for new projects, collectives and collaborations. It's amazing to watch the sparks that this issue has created. These sparks were especially interesting to watch between issue I's contributors and interviewees at our launch party.


We are very excited to see what we can help stir up in our community over upcoming issues.


What We Need & What You Get


We need to raise $1,500 in 45 days. This amount in full would finish paying off our credit card for the printing of the first issue (yikes! interest!) and fully fund the printing for the second issue which, as we said, we'd like to have released in two months. If IndieGoGo is successful for us, we'd like to continue using it, in conjunction with fundraising parties and events, for all of our future issues. 


If we cannot reach our entire goal through IndieGoGo, we will still but the money toward print cost and do what we can through other methods of fundraising to cover the costs. Any amount we make will be put toward paying off issue I first, and the remainder will go toward funding the second issue. 


We will put out a second issue, no matter how little we make. Our community is interested in what we are doing and what the D.I.Y. culture in Austin is doing. We won't let them our ourselves down. The risk of not raising the money, however, is a smaller 'zine with less content and less copies for distribution. This is not what we hope for pR. We would like it to reach as many people as possible and we would like it to be the kind of publication you keep around. Small, independent press is here. Please support it.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our IndieGoGo page with your friends and anyone you think might be interested in supporting our cause. Don't forget to like us on Facebook, where you can keep up-to-date with future fundraising parties, tablings and releases. Thank you, thank you, thank you for supporting independent press and the Austin D.I.Y. community. We love you.

story:
LGBTQ Writers Caucus - Who Are We?

LGBTQ Writers Caucus logo, designed by Ellie Schlegel.

Since 2012, the LGBTQ Writers Caucus has provided a safe and inclusive space for lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender writers to network and discuss common challenges and concerns. Through annual meetings at the Association of Writers and Writing Programs conference (AWP), the board and community members of the LGBTQ Writers Caucus work together to organize and develop, foster, and strengthen queer representation for future AWP conferences, and develop initiatives to nurture the creative and professional lives of our members.

The LGBTQ Writers Caucus has worked to encourage members to submit more queer focused and oriented proposals to the conference, resulting in the highest percentage of LGBTQ panels in AWP recent years.

Fundraising Goal: $600

 

Fundraising Goal Breakdown - What We Need & What You Get

On-Site Mixer

Since 2016, The LGBTQ Writers Caucus has co-sponsored a Social Justice Mixer, held in collaboration with Lambda Literary, and other partnering organizations. The mixer provides the opportunity for LGBTQ, minority, and all members of AWP to network with one another, as well as highlight its sponsors’ initiatives to unite and advocate for its community members.

Due to the success of our Social Justice Mixer at AWP16 and AWP17, we're planning to co-host another mixer for AWP18. Working with our coalition of partners once again, each organization is responsible for approximately $600 to cover mixer expenses.

Details of our successful fundraisers from 2016 and 2017 can be seen here and here.

Why Should I Donate?

  • Are you an AWP member and member or ally of the LGBTQ community? 
  • Are you a current member of the LGBTQ Writers Caucus, or have you previously attended an LGBTQ Writers Caucus meeting? 
  • Are you a queer writer eager to network with other queer writers at the largest gathering of creative writers in North America?
  • Have you always wanted the opportunity to attend an exciting networking event for queer writers at AWP?

If you answered "Yes" to any of these questions, consider supporting our effort to fund co-sponsorship of a mixer with Lambda Literary at AWP18 in Tampa, FL.

Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't support the Caucus financially, that doesn't mean you can't help increase visibility for LGBTQ writers at AWP 2018. You can always...

  • Share the LGBTQ Writers Caucus campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and any social media hub that's home to your queer writer friends.
  • Like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter.
  • Share our Facebook mixer event page.
  • Tweet loud and be proud! Our official hashtag is #AWPLGBTQ

The folks above have graciously agreed to serve on the board of the AWPLGBTQ Caucus for the 2017-2018 year.  Congratulations to Miguel Morales (Vice President; back left),  Jay McCoy (Secretary, Back Middle), Sean Patrick Mulroy (Communications Officer; back right), Tiff Ferentini (President; front left), and Samantha Tetangco (Communications Officer; front right).
